Absolut Pears Mule.description: Mellow out your mule with the subtle sweetness of pears. The Absolut Pears Mule: sit back, sip, and repeat.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Absolut Pear
3 parts Ginger Beer
Splash Fresh Lime Juice
Absolut Pears Mule.name: Absolut Pears Mule
Absolut Pears Mule.recipeInstructions: Pour Absolut, ginger beer, and lime juice into a mule mug filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of Pear

Adults Only-Frozen Hot Chocolate.description: Freezing ingredients in place of regular ice cubes is an easy way to take a drink to the next level. This adult-only frozen hot chocolate is oh so good. Warning, a few of these could get your name on the naughty list.
Adults Only-Frozen Hot Chocolate.name: Adults Only-Frozen Hot Chocolate
Adults Only-Frozen Hot Chocolate.recipeInstructions: In a blender combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve in mugs

Alabama Slammer.description: This fruity and somewhat nutty flavored highball drink is said to have been created at the University of Alabama. The Alabama Slammer gets its name from the fact that the drink can be served on the rocks or  "slammed" as a shooter.
Alabama Slammer.name: Alabama Slammer
Alabama Slammer.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice and shake until cold. Strain into a highball glass with fresh ice then garnish with an orange and cherry

All American Lemonade.description: Lemonade for adults, this easy to make drink is perfect for summer sipping. Make a batch for a backyard soiree or rooftop gathering.
All American Lemonade.name: All American Lemonade
All American Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Pour Tito's Handmade Vodka over ice. Fill rest of glass with lemonade. Stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge or mint sprig

Amaretto Sour.description: Amaretto Sours are sweet, slightly tart cocktails made with an almond-flavored Italian liqueur and a lemon sugar or sour mix. An amaretto sour is typically garnished with a fresh orange slice or maraschino cherries.
Amaretto Sour.name: Amaretto Sour
Amaretto Sour.recipeInstructions: Combine Amaretto, simple syrup, and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker with ice; shake for 10-15 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry and a slice of orange

American Mule.description: An American take on the classic cocktail, the American Mule is a simple drink with a little bite.
American Mule.name: American Mule
American Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a chilled mug with ice. Add fresh lime juice and Tito' Handmade Vodka. Add ginger beer. Stir. Garnish with a lime wedge

American Sour.description: Great on its own – even better in a mixed drink. American Honey is as versatile and approachable as the good company you choose to keep.
American Sour.name: American Sour
American Sour.recipeInstructions: Pour American Honey and sour mix in a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with club soda. Garnish with a slice of orange

Americano.description: This classic cocktail was first served in creator Gaspare Campari's bar, Caffè Campari, in the 1860s. The Americano is refreshing with a light and bitter taste.
Americano.name: Americano
Americano.recipeInstructions: Pour Campari and vermouth over ice in a rocks or highball glass. Add a splash of club soda. Stir. Garnish with an orange twist

Americran Harvest.description: Proudly raise the flavor with a recipe that tastes as great as autumn in America.
Americran Harvest.name: Americran Harvest
Americran Harvest.recipeInstructions: Place sliced apple and cranberries in a pitcher and muddle. Add the rest of the ingredients and ice. Stir until chilled and strain into coupe glasses. Garnish with apple slices and cranberries

Amethyst Anchor.description: This fun take on the classic Dark & Stormy has a bold color that makes it hard to miss. The signature sweetness from the Crème De Cassis balances out the spicy kick of ginger beer making it a perfect drink for anytime of year.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Spiced Rum (We used Kraken Black Spiced Rum)
Amethyst Anchor.name: Amethyst Anchor
Amethyst Anchor.recipeInstructions: Fill a tall collins glass with small ice cubes and pour in rum, Blue Curacao, Crème De Cassis and lime juice.. Once settled pour in ginger beer.. Top with just a splash of the Blue Curacao and Crème De Cassis. Serve with a straw and lime wedge.

Anejo Rum Old-Fashioned.description: Using Brugal Anejo rum to make an Old-Fashioned puts a new twist on a classic cocktail. Our cask-aged Anejo rum is smooth, full of character and sure to make you stop in your tracks. And it's fun to muddle things up every once in a while, too.
Anejo Rum Old-Fashioned.name: Anejo Rum Old-Fashioned
Anejo Rum Old-Fashioned.recipeInstructions:
Add the sugar, bitters
and orange peel into an old-fashioned glass. Muddle to a paste. Add Brugal with
ice and stir. Garnish with a lemon twist

Anejo Shot.description: The finest expression of el Jimador is our much-prized Añejo. Aged for 12 months, it needs no further introduction. Sip it neat and pure, or add ice, and expect big, rich flavors of cinnamon and caramel with a hint of butter. We'll take one if you're pouring.
Anejo Shot.name: Anejo Shot

Aperol Spritz.description: Aperol is one of Italy's most popular aperitifs, and its signature Aperol Spritz is one of the most widely consumed cocktails there.  Bright orange in color, it is sparkling and light, with an appealing bittersweet flavor of orange and herbs.  Mixed with Prosecco and club soda, the Aperol Spritz is the perfect cocktail to enjoy with friends at brunch or happy hour.
Aperol Spritz.name: Aperol Spritz
Aperol Spritz.recipeInstructions: Pour Prosecco in wine glass filled with ice. Add Aperol then top with club soda. Garnish with an orange slice

Apothic Red Moon Over Manhattan.description: For a spooky take on a classic drink, try adding Apothic Red to this bourbon-forward cocktail. Don't be scared at how much you'll love it.
Apothic Red Moon Over Manhattan.name: Apothic Red Moon Over Manhattan
Apothic Red Moon Over Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Shake all of the ingredients with ice for 20 seconds. Rub the orange peel around the rim of the glass. Add the ice sphere to the glass and strain the cocktail over the sphere. Scoop one cherry to place inside the drink and add two more on a twig or cocktail stirrer to garnish the glass

Apple Cider Honey Jack Martini.description: This cider honey martini is Fall in a glass!  It’s the perfect balance of sweet and tart thanks to yummy ingredients like apple cider, fresh lemon juice, Honey Jack, and a pinch of cinnamon.
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey Whiskey Liqueur
Apple Cider Honey Jack Martini.name: Apple Cider Honey Jack Martini
Apple Cider Honey Jack Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine Honey Jack, lemon, and cider in a shaker with a pinch of cinnamon. Add ice and shake.. Rim the martini glass with a mixture of ground cinnamon & granulated sugar, then garnish with apple slices.

Apple Cider Old Fashioned.description: This 5 ingredient apple cider old fashioned cocktail recipe…let me tell you…it’s crazy delicious and perfect for fall (or any time of year). In fact, let’s just say testing this particular cocktail recipe was super fun...because I could not stop drinking them.
Apple Cider Old Fashioned.name: Apple Cider Old Fashioned
Apple Cider Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In a glass add the sugar and bitters, stir to dissolve the sugar.. Pour in the apple cider and bourbon. Add ice cubes, stir to combine. Garnish with fresh apple slice(s) if desired, and enjoy

Apple Martini.description: Apple martinis, also known as Appletinis, are the perfect combination of tart, sweet, and a little sour. There are a few different ways that people make this cocktail but you really can't go wrong. The bright color and fresh apple wedge make it a fun cocktail to serve and very easy to drink.
Apple Martini.name: Apple Martini
Apple Martini.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker filled with ice, shake until cold. Serve up in a martini glass and garnish with a slice of green apple

Apple Rosemary Rickey.description: Fresh rosemary evokes a sense that the holiday season is near. Muddle with apple in your Cointreau Rickey and you have a present that can be enjoyed time and time again.
Apple Rosemary Rickey.name: Apple Rosemary Rickey
Apple Rosemary Rickey.recipeInstructions: Muddle apple slices and fresh rosemary. Pour in Cointreau. Add in the freshly-squeezed lime juice. Add ice and club soda, then stir. Garnish with rosemary sprig and slice of apple

Appleton Mule.description: Appleton Estate Signature Blend's golden warmth mingles with fiery ginger beer in our take on the classic Mule. A dash of bitters adds a touch of complexity in this perfectly rounded cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Appleton Estate Signature Blend Rum
Appleton Mule.name: Appleton Mule
Appleton Mule.recipeInstructions: Muddle limes in a highball glass. Add ice and build the remaining ingredients, then stir. Garnish with lime wedge and stir

Arsenic & Old Lace Cocktail.description: Spring always makes me want to drink floral cocktails with delicate flavors and flower garnishes - this drink matches that profile perfectly. The Absinthe makes the cocktail opalescent - a mesmerizing introduction into spring.
Arsenic & Old Lace Cocktail.name: Arsenic & Old Lace Cocktail
Arsenic & Old Lace Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Stir with ice . Strain into a chilled cocktail coupe.

Asian Plum Spritzer.description: We chose to use Bulldog Gin for the Asian Plum Spritzer because it's bright citrus and tropical fruit notes pair well with the slightly sweet flavors of the plum wine and prosecco. The yellow chartreuse and thyme add an unexpected herbaceous layer to this spring cocktail.
Asian Plum Spritzer.name: Asian Plum Spritzer
Asian Plum Spritzer.recipeInstructions: Place a large sphere ice cube into the bottom of a white wine glass. . Next, pour in your gin, plum wine, and yellow chartreuse.. Slowly stir with a bar spoon to combine. . Top with 3 ounces of Prosecco.. Garnish with plum slices and a sprig of fresh thyme.

B 52 Shot.description: The B 52 shot is a retro cocktail, typically taken as a shooter, that has a sweet, creamy taste. It's said to be named after the popular band from the 1970s. Here, three different liquors poured on top of each other create a distinct, layered look. This is a great cocktail for practicing your layering skills!
B 52 Shot.name: B 52 Shot
B 52 Shot.recipeInstructions: Layer the three spirits in a shot glass in the order they're listed; Kahlua, Baileys, Grand Marnier. For the second and third layer pour gently over the back of a spoon to keep the layers from mixing as you pour

BACARDI Coconut & Pineapple.description: BACARDÍ Coconut has to be tasted to be believed. It's got the smooth flavor of BACARDÍ Rum infused with the intense yet clean flavor of fresh coconut. And it just seems like the most natural thing in the world to match it up with the creamy sweetness of freshly pressed pineapple juice. What are you waiting for?
BACARDI Coconut & Pineapple.name: BACARDI Coconut & Pineapple
BACARDI Coconut & Pineapple.recipeInstructions: Fill a glass with ice. Pour in the BACARDÍ Coconut and pineapple juice. Stir. Garnish with a pineapple wedge

BACARDI Daiquiri.description: An all time classic, this daiquiri cocktail is simple and satisfying.
BACARDI Daiquiri.name: BACARDI Daiquiri
BACARDI Daiquiri.recipeInstructions: Place sugar and freshly squeezed lime juice into a cocktail shaker and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Add BACARDÍ Superior Rum and fill the shaker with cubed ice. Shake vigorously until thoroughly chilled. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a thin lime wheel

BACARDI Limonade.description: Fresh and tart, lemonade is combined with BACARDÍ Limón for a truly refreshing drink.
BACARDI Limonade.name: BACARDI Limonade
BACARDI Limonade.recipeInstructions: Add ice to a highball glass. Pour in ingredients. Stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge

BACARDI Mojito.description: Depending on who you believe, the mojito either came from the Spanish word 'mojar,' which means to wet, or the African word 'mojo, which means to cast a spell. Anybody who's ever tasted one will agree that it's thirst quenching and spellbinding in equal measures.
BACARDI Mojito.name: BACARDI Mojito
BACARDI Mojito.recipeInstructions: Muddle mint leaves, sugar and lime in a highball glass. Add BACARDÍ Superior Rum and stir well. Fill glass with crushed ice. Top with club soda and gently stir. Garnish glass with lime wedge and sprig of mint

BACARD\u00cd Tropical Refresher.description: Sweet notes of pineapple are balanced by the refreshing flavor of fresh coconut for the perfect summer cocktail.
BACARD\u00cd Tropical Refresher.name: BACARDÍ Tropical Refresher

BLT.description: Step aside, vodka and gin—this Bulleit BLT is the new go-to summer drink. You may associate tonic water with vodka or gin, but what about bourbon? This golden alternative is just as simple and light for summer.
BLT.name: BLT
BLT.recipeInstructions: Fill a collins glass with ice. Pour in Bulleit and tonic water. Stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Bacon Old Fashioned.description: The ultimate cocktail for every meal! Why have a mimosa or bloody mary when bacon could be in every component of brunch. Beer for lunch? Who needs it when your cocktail pairs perfectly with your bacon burger. Wine for dinner? Not when you're having a bacon wrapped filet and need the perfect drink to match.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz of Bacon-Infused Bourbon or Rye Whiskey
Bacon Old Fashioned.name: Bacon Old Fashioned
Bacon Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass add 3 dashes of bitters and maple syrup and stir. Add whiskey and a large ice cube and stir again. Garnish with a slice bacon and serve

Bad Blood.description: This bourbon based cocktail was mixed up with Taylor Swift's chart-topper, Bad Blood in mind. It's a strong drink with a kick of flavor. If you're feuding with a friend and in the mood to just kick back and brood, this drink is for you.
Bad Blood.name: Bad Blood
Bad Blood.recipeInstructions: Slice the fresh blood orange and put 1-2 slices into the bottom of a rocks glass. Add sugar cube, add 3 dashes of bitters. Use muddler to slowly crush sugar into the orange slices with the bitters. Pour mixture from above into fresh rocks glass with 1 large ice cube. Add bourbon and stir gently with swizzle stick. Garnish with blood orange rind and cherry

Bahama Mama.description: The Bahama Mama is a classic tropical rum cocktail. This drink's sweet blend of flavors will transport you to the islands even when it's not served in a coconut. A refreshing and easy-drinking crowd pleaser.
Bahama Mama.name: Bahama Mama
Bahama Mama.recipeInstructions: Combine rums, coffee liqueur, grenadine, and juices in a shaker over ice; shake until cold (10-15 seconds). Strain into hurricane glass over crushed ice. Garnish with fresh orange slice and cherry

Baileys Cookies & Cream Milkshake.description: Boozy milkshakes? What more could you ask for? Try this cookies and cream recipe from Baileys and indulge unapologetically.
Baileys Cookies & Cream Milkshake.name: Baileys Cookies & Cream Milkshake
Baileys Cookies & Cream Milkshake.recipeInstructions: Combine skim milk, cookies, ice cream, and Baileys in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve in a parfait glass or any tall glass. Garnish with whipped cream and another cookie

Baileys Martini.description: For a decadent twist on a quintessential cocktail, try the Baileys Martini. Try garnishing with a light dusting of dark chocolate shavings or a fun design of chocolate syrup to take this cocktail to another level of indulgence.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Baileys Original Irish Cream
1/4 oz Vodka
Baileys Martini.name: Baileys Martini
Baileys Martini.recipeInstructions: Pour Baileys and vodka into an ice-filled shaker. Shake well. Strain into a martini glass

Baileys Over Ice Cream.description: Dessert after dinner? Or a nightcap? Enjoy both with Baileys poured over ice cream. Indulge away.
Baileys Over Ice Cream.name: Baileys Over Ice Cream
Baileys Over Ice Cream.recipeInstructions: Put one scoop of vanilla ice cream into a small glass. Pour Baileys over ice cream. Sprinkle on your favorite topping

Baileys Pomegranate Martini.description: Our version of true love - a Baileys Pomegranate Martini.
recipeIngredient: Optional: White Chocolate Heart and Pomegranate Seeds
Baileys Pomegranate Martini.name: Baileys Pomegranate Martini
Baileys Pomegranate Martini.recipeInstructions: Coat the rim of a martini glass with chocolate sauce, then roll on a plate of shaved chocolate. Pour 1 oz of pomegranate juice into the glass. Shake 1.5 oz of Baileys with ice and carefully pour on top. Garnish with a white chocolate heart and three pomegranate seeds

Barrel Proof on the Rocks.description: From the barrel to the bottle to your glass.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz Jack Daniel's Single Barrel "Barrel Proof" Tennessee Whiskey
Barrel Proof on the Rocks.name: Barrel Proof on the Rocks
Barrel Proof on the Rocks.recipeInstructions: Add ice to a rocks glass. Pour in Barrel Proof

Basilico Fresco.description: If you're looking for the ultimate easy-sipping summer cocktail, this is the one for you. Essentially "summer in a glass", this drink is visually stunning, refreshing and pairs incredibly well with a sunny day.
Basilico Fresco.name: Basilico Fresco
Basilico Fresco.recipeInstructions: Muddle basil and grapes thoroughly to break up the grapes and release the basil notes. Add vodka and gingerale then stir. . Serve over ice or up as a martini. . Large basil leaf for garnish, if desired.

Batanga.description: This is a Mexican classic. It means “thick in the middle" and was the self-declared nickname of a larger-than-life customer at a famous bar in Tequila (the town that gave its name to the greatest spirit on earth). Kick back and relax with this full-flavored yet simple recipe. Salud!
Batanga.name: Batanga
Batanga.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add el Jimador, Coca-Cola, and a squeeze of lime. Stir and garnish with a wedge of lime

Bay Breeze.description: A variation on the Cape Codder, the Bay Breeze is a fruity, summer favorite. Light and refreshing, this drink can also be made with rum in place of vodka for a twist on the original recipe.
Bay Breeze.name: Bay Breeze
Bay Breeze.recipeInstructions: In a highball glass combine vodka and cranberry juice. Next add the pineapple juice and garnish with a lime wedge

Beer-Rita.description: This batch recipe takes two backyard all-stars and smashes them together. The Beer-Rita is the winning combo of beer and Blanco tequila. Next time you're at the grill, make them one of these.
Beer-Rita.name: Beer-Rita
Beer-Rita.recipeInstructions: Fill pitcher with ice. Pour in frozen limeade, Cabo Blanco and light beer. Toss in a couple sliced limes. Stir it up!

Bees Knees.description: The Bees Knees is a classic cocktail that pairs gin with its favorite friend lemon juice and then mixes in just the right amount of sweetness with the honey syrup.
Bees Knees.name: Bees Knees
Bees Knees.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker filled with ice, shake 5-10 seconds until cold. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a lemon peel

Bellini.description: Originating in Italy, the classic Bellini is made with white peach puree and Prosecco. Many people now substitute other dry sparkling wines in the bellini recipe. Initially this drink was served only during summertime when peaches were in season. Now it's a brunch favorite throughout the year. If you're making your own peach puree opt for white peaches whenever possible for the best flavor.
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Prosecco or Sparkling White Wine
Bellini.name: Bellini
Bellini.recipeInstructions: In a champagne flute, gently pour sparkling wine over peach puree

Berry Crush.description: An American themed cocktail to please the masses!
Berry Crush.name: Berry Crush
Berry Crush.recipeInstructions: Gently muddle the blackberries in glasses. Fill the glasses with crushed ice. Add vodka, simple syrup, lemon juice, and blue curacao into a pitcher and mix with no ice. Pour over the crushed ice and garnish

Berry Margarita.description: Perfect for any season, but especially Fall when berries are at their ripest. Produces a beautiful, bright pink color that’s inviting to even the most timid tipplers.
Berry Margarita.name: Berry Margarita
Berry Margarita.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain over ice in a sugar rimmed rocks glass. Garnish with blackberries

Berry Merry Christmas.description: Have a Berry, merry Christmas with this pomegranate Bubbly cocktail and share with friends this holiday season.
Berry Merry Christmas.name: Berry Merry Christmas
Berry Merry Christmas.recipeInstructions: Place pomegranate seeds in bottom of a chilled champagne flute. Add chilled pomegranate juice and vanilla extract to flute. Top with Barefoot Berry Bubbly

Berry Merry Collins.description: It's the most wonderful time of the year! Mix up a batch of these festive and fruity cocktails to share with friends this holiday season. The cranberry juice and black raspberry liqueur combine for the perfect pre-dinner palate cleanser. The fresh rosemary provides the subtle scent of the holidays.
Berry Merry Collins.name: Berry Merry Collins
Berry Merry Collins.recipeInstructions: Combine vodka, liqueur and juices in a shaker with ice. Shake until cold then strain to a collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a sprinkle of sea salt and a sprig of fresh rosemary

Berry Moscato Lemonade.description: There is so much to love about this Berry Moscato Lemonade that we hardly know where to begin. Well, okay, how about the fresh blueberries and blackberries? Or maybe it's the sweet, full-bodied Moscato? Regardless, this cocktail is truly a must-try.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup New Amsterdam Red Berry Vodka
Berry Moscato Lemonade.name: Berry Moscato Lemonade
Berry Moscato Lemonade.recipeInstructions:
Fill
your favorite glass pitcher with blueberries, blackberries, and lemon slices.
(Pro tip: for extra berry flavor, mash up the berries a bit). Pour
in Moscato, Red Berry Vodka, and lemonade. . Add
ice (optional) and mix well.. Keep
refrigerated until ready to serve.

Berry Rickey.description: Look to the bramble bush at the turn of the season for a more fruity Rickey.  The muddled berries create a colorful and fruitier Cointreau Rickey variation.
Berry Rickey.name: Berry Rickey
Berry Rickey.recipeInstructions: Muddle berries in mint in a glass. Add Cointreau. Add in freshly-squeezed lime juice. Add ice and club soda, then stir. Garnish with skewered berries and a mint sprig

Beso Caliente.description: A perfect tequila cocktail for any night of the year!
Beso Caliente.name: Beso Caliente
Beso Caliente.recipeInstructions: Shake first three ingredients. Strain into glass . Float Angostura bitters (3-4 dashes)

Best Damn Root Beer Float.description: Nothing beats a root beer float. Unless it's a hard root beer float. Made with BEST DAMN Root Beer.
recipeIngredient: 1 bottle of BEST DAMN Root Beer
Best Damn Root Beer Float.name: Best Damn Root Beer Float
Best Damn Root Beer Float.recipeInstructions: Place one scoop of vanilla ice cream into a tall mug. Pour 1 bottle of BEST DAMN Root Beer over the ice cream. Enjoy

Best Damn Spirited Butter Pecan Shake.description: An unlikely trio of flavors - butter pecan ice cream, scotch, and Best Damn Sweet Tea - make up this sweet, creamy cocktail that's perfect for dessert or for a nightcap with friends. Cheers!
Best Damn Spirited Butter Pecan Shake.name: Best Damn Spirited Butter Pecan Shake
Best Damn Spirited Butter Pecan Shake.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a blender with ice and blend to a preferred consistency. Pour into a chilled mug and garnish with crushed pecans

Best Damn Sweet Tea Smash.description: Simple, delicious, and refreshing, this riff on a classic cocktail perfectly blends the bite of bourbon and the smoothness of Best Damn Sweet Tea. Try it with muddled mint leaves for a cool, fresh finish.
Best Damn Sweet Tea Smash.name: Best Damn Sweet Tea Smash
Best Damn Sweet Tea Smash.recipeInstructions: Pour Best Damn Sweet Tea over ice into a chilled cocktail glass. Shake remaining ingredients together with ice and strain into the glass. Garnish with fresh mint or a lemon wedge

Better Than Mimosas Cocktail.description: The scariest (and best) cocktails are the ones that taste so good and so refreshing that you actually forget there's alcohol in it! Well, that's this cocktail (you've been warned!). Hopefully you don't have an attachment to orange juice and champagne because this brunch drink just might move to the top of your list! Don't believe me? Make it and see for yourself.
Better Than Mimosas Cocktail.name: Better Than Mimosas Cocktail
Better Than Mimosas Cocktail.recipeInstructions: In a collins glass, gently muddle the cucumber slices, mint, lemon juice, simple syrup. . Pour in gin, elderflower liqueur, and some light ice. . Stir the cocktail to blend the ingredients, then fill with more ice and top with club soda. . Garnish with a sprig of mint and cucumber wheel

Birthday Cake Shot.description: The birthday cake shooter is a cause for celebration in itself. First lick the sugar off the fresh lemon wedge, tip back the tasty shot, and finish by biting on the lemon. The flavors combine to magically taste like a delicious piece of chocolate cake. Candles not included.
Birthday Cake Shot.name: Birthday Cake Shot
Birthday Cake Shot.recipeInstructions: Fill a shot glass with equal parts vodka and Frangelico hazelnut liqueur. Serve with a lemon wedge coated in granulated sugar

Black Box Fros\u00e9.name: Black Box Frosé
Black Box Fros\u00e9.recipeInstructions:
Remove rosé wine bag from box
and place in freezer. Freeze bag for
at least 6 hours prior to preparation. When ready to serve, blend all
ingredients together until smooth. Garnish with strawberries and fresh
mint. Serve and enjoy!

Black Manhattan.description: A new twist on the traditional Manhattan. Enhance this classic cocktail with the Italian amaro, Averna, which adds complexity with its deep, bittersweet flavor.
Black Manhattan.name: Black Manhattan
Black Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice until cold. Strain into a well-chilled coupe. Garnish with a brandied cherry

Black Raspberry Margarita.description: Mix el Jimador and Chambord for a margarita packed with flavor.
Black Raspberry Margarita.name: Black Raspberry Margarita
Black Raspberry Margarita.recipeInstructions: Add el Jimador and Chambord Black Raspberry Liqueur, pomegranate juice, lime juice to a cocktail shaker. Shake, shimmy and strain into a margarita or martini glass. Top with a raspberry or two

Black Russian.description: A cousin of the famous White Russian, the Black Russian cocktail has the smooth taste of coffee liqueur mixed with the crisp clean taste of vodka.
Black Russian.name: Black Russian
Black Russian.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass with ice combine ingredient. Stir with a bar spoon then strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice

Blackberry & Peach Infused Bourbon.description:
Some spirit lovers may raise an eyebrow to anything that alters the smooth flavor profile of bourbon, but trust us this infusion will keep even the most strict liquor aficionado coming back for more. The classic hints of sweetness in bourbon are brought to a whole new level when combined with the natural flavors of fresh peach and blackberries. You can enjoy this infusion on its own over ice, or with ginger beer and a spring of mint.



Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
Blackberry & Peach Infused Bourbon.name: Blackberry & Peach Infused Bourbon
Blackberry & Peach Infused Bourbon.recipeInstructions: Place sliced peaches and blackberries into the bottom of a 1.5 pint mason jar.. Fill the rest of the jar with a bourbon of your choice (we used Jim Beam) and seal with lid. . Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 3 days, shaking occasionally. . After 3 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused bourbon into a sealed jar.. Infusion will keep for several weeks refrigerated.

Blackberry Gin Lemonade.description: Planning a party? Go for large batch cocktails like this Blackberry Gin Lemonade. It's easy to make in advance, giving you more time to mingle when the party arrives.
Blackberry Gin Lemonade.name: Blackberry Gin Lemonade
Blackberry Gin Lemonade.recipeInstructions: In a large pitcher or bowl, combine juices and gin. Serve in small glasses with fresh fruit garnish. For some added eye-candy, freeze fresh blueberries into your ice cubes

Blackberry Patio Crusher.description: Create an outdoors cocktail all year with the Blackberry Patio Crusher. The combination of zesty lemon and the sweet blackberries will be a refreshing choice no matter what time of year.
recipeIngredient:
1
part Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
Blackberry Patio Crusher.name: Blackberry Patio Crusher
Blackberry Patio Crusher.recipeInstructions:
Shake
on rocks. Serve
in a rocks glass over crushed ice. Top
with ginger beer or soda optional. Garnish
with mint and blackberries

Blackberry Sage Gin Smash.description: Blackberry Sage Gin Smash with Candied Sage Leaves is a deliciously fresh cocktail that really brings out the floral notes in the gin. If you are a gin girl (or boy!) like me, you can’t skip this one.
Blackberry Sage Gin Smash.name: Blackberry Sage Gin Smash
Blackberry Sage Gin Smash.recipeInstructions: Bring 1/3 cup water and 1/3 cup sugar to a boil over medium heat. . Once the sugar is dissolved, dip 2 sage leaves carefully in the hot simple syrup, shaking off the excess. . Roll the leaves in a light coat of sugar and lay flat on a plate to cool and harden in the refrigerator.. In a shaker, muddle together blackberries with 8 sage leaves. Pour in gin, lime juice and simple syrup and fill with ice.. Shake and strain evenly between into two glasses filled with ice.. Top with club soda and garnish with extra blackberries and candied sage leaves.

Blackberry Smash.description: This jammy bourbon cocktail has layers of complexity, but is shockingly easy to make!
Blackberry Smash.name: Blackberry Smash
Blackberry Smash.recipeInstructions: Add Early Times Bottled-In-Bond, chilled Earl Grey Tea, blackberry syrup, and ice to a mixing glass. Stir well. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a blackberry and a sprig of rosemary

Blanche Chaud.description: Herbaceous green chartreuse and rich chocolate is an unexpected but delightful combination that can never go wrong. The classic version of this drink with milk or dark hot chocolate is an apres-ski favorite in the French and Swiss Alps. We threw in our own little twist and opted for white chocolate resulting in a sweeter more sugary mixture.
Blanche Chaud.name: Blanche Chaud
Blanche Chaud.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a mug, stir then top with whipped cream.

Blood Orange Armagnac Sidecar.description: This is a twist on a classic cocktail, the Sidecar. Cognac is replaced with a more rustic Armagnac, and Cointreau is replaced with Solerno blood orange liqueur. The resulting combination is tart and citrusy, yet balanced and rich, set off with a cinnamon-sugar rim.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 ounces Clés des Ducs Armagnac Brandy
Freshly picked thyme sprig, for garnish
Blood Orange Armagnac Sidecar.name: Blood Orange Armagnac Sidecar
Blood Orange Armagnac Sidecar.recipeInstructions: Rim a chilled coupe or martini glass with cinnamon-sugar. Set aside.. In a mixing tin, combine the Armagnac, blood orange liqueur, and fresh lemon juice.. Fill the tin with ice, shake well, and double-strain into the chilled cocktail glass.. Smack your sprig of thyme to release its oils and carefully place it into the glass.

Blood Orange Bourbon Hot Toddy.description: This drink is the cure to all your winter ailments. It's sweet, smooth, and soothing all in one. For added blood orange flavor we infused the bourbon with blood orange and also steeped the tea in a warm blood orange soda.
Blood Orange Bourbon Hot Toddy.name: Blood Orange Bourbon Hot Toddy

Blood Orange Sangria.description: A delicious sangria with a bit of a twist. The blood orange enhances a typical citrus-forward sangria into something more sophisticated. The added cinnamon makes it perfect for a chilly winter day.
recipeIngredient: 2 bottles of Chilled Yellow Tail Cabernet Sauvignon
8 oz Fresh Squeezed Blood Orange Juice
Blood Orange Sangria.name: Blood Orange Sangria
Blood Orange Sangria.recipeInstructions: Add cut blood orange slices to a pitcher, add brandy and orange liqueur. Pour in chilled wine and drop in cinnamon sticks. Stir well, then cover and refrigerate for at least 4-6 hours. Stir well and enjoy over ice

Blood Orange Scotch & Soda.description: Sick of blood oranges yet? Me neither! The slight bitterness you get from simmering down the peel/pith plays really nicely with smokey scotch. And I'm already anticipating (read: DREADING) the blood-orange-less days soon to come. I'm ready to say goodbye to winter, but not winter citrus!
Blood Orange Scotch & Soda.name: Blood Orange Scotch & Soda
Blood Orange Scotch & Soda.recipeInstructions: Combine all but the soda in a cocktail shaker with ice . Shake and pour over ice . Top with club soda . Garnish with a blood orange slice (mine are dehydrated!) and (for a touch of sweetness, totally optional) a cardamom sugar rim

Blood and Sand.description: First appearing in The Savoy Cocktail Book in 1930 by Harry Craddock, the Blood and Sand cocktail has a bit of a mysterious past. It is supposedly named after the famous 1922 bullfighter silent film of the same name from the early Hollywood era. Due to the unique ingredients, all of equal parts, this cocktail provides a diverse yet nuanced flavor. Similar to the dance of a bullfighter in the ring, this cocktail will surprise and delight with its sweet, yet bitter, flavors.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso
3/4 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur
Blood and Sand.name: Blood and Sand
Blood and Sand.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry

Blood on the Beach.description: Should you want to take your Sex On The Beach to the next level, this will get you there. It's got all the marks of the classic original, with a grenadine "blood" floater for a dash of extra sweetness (and a total Shark Week favorite).
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Peach Schnapps
1 1/2 oz Orange or Pineapple Juice
1.5 oz Cranberry Juice
1 tbsp Grenadine
Orange Wheel for garnish
Blood on the Beach.name: Blood on the Beach
Blood on the Beach.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients, except grenadine, to a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with grenadine and garnish with orange wheel

Bloody Maria.description: This take on the Classic Bloody Mary uses tequila in place of vodka. Tequila has a more bold flavor that pairs well with extra spicy tomato juices.
Bloody Maria.name: Bloody Maria
Bloody Maria.recipeInstructions: Combine both ingredients in a shaker with ice, shake until cold. Pour mixture and ice into a spice rimmed glass and garnish with a fresh lime wedge

Bloody Mary.description: From spicy to tart, every Bloody Mary lover has their favorite recipe they swear by (we'll take extra horseradish and lemon in ours, please). If you want to kick up your favorite pre-made mix, try adding pepper or cilantro flavored vodka. No matter how you prefer to mix it up, we think any Sunday that starts with your favorite Bloody Mary is a good one.
recipeIngredient: Lemon wedges & celery stalks to garnish
Bloody Mary.name: Bloody Mary
Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients into a pitcher and mix to combine. . Stop and taste the mix before serving, adjusting things like heat and horseradish levels as you go.. Divide evenly between three glasses filled with ice. Garnish with fresh lemons, celery stalks and more.. Enjoy.

Blue Cosmo Beach Bag.description:
Upgrade your beach day with our frozen take on the classic Cosmopolitan. We've added blue curacao for a kick of color, and swapped in white cranberry juice for a smooth hit of sweetness. These individual frosty drinks are the perfect treat for a hot summer day.

Check out the rest of our 'Beach Bag' cocktails!
Blue Cosmo Beach Bag.name: Blue Cosmo Beach Bag
Blue Cosmo Beach Bag.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a small 8 oz zip-top plastic bag and seal. . Gently shake bag to mix. . Lay flat in freezer for 6-8 hours until frozen. . When ready to serve gently crush bag contents until a slush.. Open bag and drop in garnish and serve with a straw.

Blue Hawaiian.description: Hailing from the hula-loving island of Hawaii, this tropical drink will transport you to a beachy state of mind instantly.
recipeIngredient: Cherry and Fresh Pineapple to garnish
Blue Hawaiian.name: Blue Hawaiian
Blue Hawaiian.recipeInstructions: In a blender combine all ingredients with ice and blend until smooth. Serve in a hurricane or highball glass with fruit garnish and a straw

Blue Lagoon.description: Despite the mesmerizing blue-green color of this cocktail its flavor is bright and citrusy, making it a fun play between the visual and your tastebuds. The soda water keeps this drink from being overly sweet.
Blue Lagoon.name: Blue Lagoon
Blue Lagoon.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a large glass over ice. Stir gently with a bar spoon before serving

Blue Margarita.description: Plus up your margarita with a touch of tropical flavor and a pop of color! Take Sauza® Silver Tequila to the base of the cocktail and combine with DeKuyper® Triple Sec, Blue Curacao and lime juice for a margarita that is equally enticing to the eye and the palate.
recipeIngredient:
½
part DeKuyper®
Blue Curacao Liqueur
Blue Margarita.name: Blue Margarita
Blue Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker. Shake
and strain into a margarita glass with ice. Garnish
with a lime and/or blueberries. Finish
with salt on the rim

Blueberry & Basil Infused Moonshine.description:
Moonshine, a once forbidden southern spirit has recently made it's way into the mainstream with several brands launching their own high proof versions. As a neutral grain spirit, it does not have much flavor on its own which is why it makes the perfect blank canvas for some fun fresh infusions. We chose to pair tart fresh blueberries with basil to make this infusion stand out from the crowd. Try it served over ice with club soda, or mixed with some homemade lemonade.

Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
Blueberry & Basil Infused Moonshine.name: Blueberry & Basil Infused Moonshine
Blueberry & Basil Infused Moonshine.recipeInstructions: Place the blueberries and basil leaves into the bottom of a 1.5 Pint Mason Jar and muddle gently.. Fill the rest of the jar with an unflavored moonshine of your choice (we used  Firefly Moonshine) and seal with lid.. Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 5 days, shaking occasionally.. After 5 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused moonshine into a sealed jar.. Infusion will keep for several weeks refrigerated.

Blushing Bubbles.description: Put a tropical twist on your next brunch cocktail with Blushing Bubbles. Next stop, paradise.
Blushing Bubbles.name: Blushing Bubbles
Blushing Bubbles.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker except La Marca. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass while simultaneously pouring in the La Marca. Garnish with a twist of the citrus fruit of your choice

Boozy Baileys Milkshake.description: This boozy milkshake blends up a classic summertime treat with Baileys Original Irish Cream, Vanilla Vodka and plenty of Chocolate Ice Cream. This one-of-a-kind adult-approved drink is (almost) better than that feeling you get when you hear the Ice Cream Truck jingle...
recipeIngredient: 1 Klondike Choco Taco Ice Cream Treat
Boozy Baileys Milkshake.name: Boozy Baileys Milkshake
Boozy Baileys Milkshake.recipeInstructions: Chop the Choco Taco treat in half. Add half of the Choco Taco, and all other ingredients to a blender.. Pulse until mixture is smooth. Pour into a chilled pint glass. Garnish with other half of the Choco Taco and serve with a straw

Boozy S'mores Milkshake.description: A tasty, sweet, definitely strong Boozy S'mores Milkshake that can be made indoors or outdoors.
recipeIngredient: 6 scoops of vanilla ice cream (we used vanilla bean)
Two bars of chocolate (we used a salted almond chocolate - yum!)
4 oz Godiva chocolate (or white chocolate) liqueur
Boozy S'mores Milkshake.name: Boozy S'mores Milkshake
Boozy S'mores Milkshake.recipeInstructions: Toast marshmallows and assemble your s'mores.. Blend all liquid ingredients and ice cream until thick and combined.. Pour into glass and top with chopped bits of leftover chocolate from your bars.. Add s'mores on top and a marshmallow on a skewer for garnish.

Boulevardier.description: A cousin of the Negroni, the Boulevardier is  a simple cocktail recipe that produces big flavor. Substituting bourbon in place of gin creates a more sweet drink that is typically drank neat and up in a cocktail glass.
Boulevardier.name: Boulevardier
Boulevardier.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice, stir 5-10 seconds. Strain into a classic cocktail glass

Bourbon Ball Julep.description: This creative take on a Julep is for the chocolate lover!
recipeIngredient: ½ part DeKuyper® White Crème de Cocoa
Bourbon Ball Julep.name: Bourbon Ball Julep
Bourbon Ball Julep.recipeInstructions: Pour Maker's Mark® Bourbon Whisky, DeKuyper® Amaretto Liqueur, DeKuyper® White Crème de Cocoa, DeKuyper® Muddled Mint over ice in a shaker. Shake well and strain over ice. Sprinkle with sugar and crushed pecan

Bourbon Bramble.description: As dark and mysterious as it is refreshing, this version of the classic Bourbon Bramble is made even more delicious when using Russell's Reserve as the base spirit.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz Russell's Reserve 10 Year Old Bourbon
Bourbon Bramble.name: Bourbon Bramble
Bourbon Bramble.recipeInstructions: Shake first three ingredients in a shaker with crushed ice. Muddle blackberries in a rocks glass, then add contents of shaker into the glass. Top with floater of blackberry liqueur. Garnish with lemon and blackberries

Bourbon Float.description: Remember that pretty cool person you met that didn't like root beer floats? Yeah, me neither. Adding some quality bourbon into this classic dessert instantly turns this into a boozy treat anyone would enjoy.
Bourbon Float.name: Bourbon Float
Bourbon Float.recipeInstructions: In a glass, combine 2 oz of bourbon and root beer. . Place 1-2 scoops of vanilla ice cream in the glass and drizzle blood orange syrup on top.. Serve with a straw and sundae spoon

Bourbon Ginger Cider.description: One of our top seasonal faves. This cider cocktail has the smooth taste of pressed apples with the warm finish of bourbon. The ginger liqueur and fresh grated ginger provide depth of flavor and the tiniest bit of bite. This one will warm you to the core.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Domaine de Canton Ginger Liqueur
Bourbon Ginger Cider.name: Bourbon Ginger Cider
Bourbon Ginger Cider.recipeInstructions: Combine cider, bourbon, liqueur  and grated ginger in a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously then pour shaker contents into an old fashioned glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick

Bourbon Spiked Cider.description: Sweet, tart and with just a hint of spice, this winter warmer cocktail is our favorite way to cozy up after a chilly winter day. Crowd pleasing flavors like spiced apple cider and cranberry juice make this bourbon based drink the perfect batch cocktail for your next holiday party or ski trip.
recipeIngredient: Handful of fresh cranberries to garnish
Bourbon Spiked Cider.name: Bourbon Spiked Cider
Bourbon Spiked Cider.recipeInstructions: Into a medium sauce pan combine apple cider, cranberry juice, cinnamon sticks, orange zest and half of your apple slices.. Bring mixture to a slow simmer until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in bourbon. Distribute mixture evenly between two coffee mugs. Garnish with apple slices and fresh cranberries. Enjoy!

Brain Hemorrhage Shot.description: A great shooter for Halloween this eery looking drink mixes two different liqueurs for a deliciously weird combination.
Brain Hemorrhage Shot.name: Brain Hemorrhage Shot
Brain Hemorrhage Shot.recipeInstructions: Chill both liqueurs before making this shot. Pour 1 oz of chilled peach schnapps into a shot glass. Next gently pour chilled Irish Cream liqueur over the back of the bar spoon into the glass layering the two. Finally add 2 to 3 dashes of grenadine

Brandy Alexander.description: A deliciously smooth dessert cocktail, this drink is the ultimate adult milkshake. It's most commonly made with brandy but some early recipes actually used gin. The exact origins of the drink are unknown but whoever mixed this up was someone we sure would have liked to be friends with.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Heavy Cream or Whole Milk
Fresh Nutmeg and Cinnamon to garnish
Brandy Alexander.name: Brandy Alexander
Brandy Alexander.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice, shake 10-15 seconds until ice cold. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon and nutmeg

Bubbly Mind Eraser.description: This drink adds a bubbly and fruity twist to the classic Mind Eraser, making it the perfect pairing for any summer occasion.
Bubbly Mind Eraser.name: Bubbly Mind Eraser
Bubbly Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Add Kahlua to a highball glass. Add Absolut Vodka. Add club soda. Add champagne or sparkling wine. Add a splash of pineapple juice

Buckcherry.description: This modern, citrusy cocktail is the perfect way to ease into a holiday dinner party with its subtle fruity and herbal flavors.
Buckcherry.name: Buckcherry
Buckcherry.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except mint leaf in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice to chill. Strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a small sprig of mint

Bulldog.description: Add a zest of lemon to this tonic cocktail!
Bulldog.name: Bulldog
Bulldog.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add gin, orange juice, and Schweppes Ginger Ale to top. Garnish with lemon wedge. Enjoy!

Bulleit Boilermaker.description: Go old-school with Bulleit's take on the classic whiskey and beer drink.
Bulleit Boilermaker.name: Bulleit Boilermaker
Bulleit Boilermaker.recipeInstructions: Pour Bulleit into a shot glass. Pour Guinness beer into a pint glass. Serve as complements to one another. Enjoy!

Bulleit Old Fashioned.description: It doesn't get much more classic than the Old Fashioned. This timeless drink is a staple for any mixologist or home bartender!
Bulleit Old Fashioned.name: Bulleit Old Fashioned
Bulleit Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass, muddle sugar and bitters. Add bourbon, water, and a large ice cube. Twist slices of lemon and orange peel over the drink and drop the slices in. Garnish with a cherry

Bushwacker.description: This delicious frozen drink is an amazing twist on the pina colada. The coconut, chocolate, and coffee flavors combine for a decadent and memorable frozen drink that won't disappoint. We don't suggest substituting pina colada mix here, it won't be nearly as good as this recipe.
Bushwacker.name: Bushwacker
Bushwacker.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with 1 cup of ice and blend until smooth. Pour into a hurricane glass and garnish the top with chocolate syrup

Buttery Nipple.description: A Buttery Nipple shot is a smooth layered shooter with the sweet taste of butterscotch and cream.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Buttershots Liqueur
1/2 oz Irish Cream Liqueur
Buttery Nipple.name: Buttery Nipple
Buttery Nipple.recipeInstructions: Pour 1 oz of buttershots liqueur into chilled shot glass. Gently pour the Irish cream liqueur over the back of the bar spoon to layer the two ingredients

Caborita.description: Here's our take on the margarita - the Caborita, a Thick Cut drink that should only be served in a mug. Don't call it a cocktail – it's a drink, and the full agave flavor of Cabo Blanco shines through in this one.
Caborita.name: Caborita
Caborita.recipeInstructions: Salt the rim of a mug and fill it with ice. Pour in Cabo Blanco, Triple Sec and Grand Marnier. Fill the rest of the mug with fresh margarita mix. Toss in a lime wedge and stir it up

Cadbury Creme Egg Shooter.description: Cadbury Creme Eggs only come once a year so why not make them useful.  Mix vodka, Kahlua and coconut creme for an easy to drink shooter.  Pour into a shot glass or hollowed out creme egg if you’re feeling ambitious!
Cadbury Creme Egg Shooter.name: Cadbury Creme Egg Shooter
Cadbury Creme Egg Shooter.recipeInstructions: Pour vodka, Kahlua and coconut cream into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.. Shake vigorously until chilled. Strain into shot glasses . Cut open a Cadbury Cream Egg and allow some of the filling to drop into the shot glass. Take the shot and chase with the remaining Cadbury Creme Egg

Can't Feel My Face Gin Bucket.description: As the popular song by The Weeknd would suggest, this drink will get the party started. Proceed with caution, the easy-drinking nature of this drink can have you sipping them down quickly without remembering how strong they are. Enjoy responsibly, friends.
Can't Feel My Face Gin Bucket.name: Can't Feel My Face Gin Bucket
Can't Feel My Face Gin Bucket.recipeInstructions: Combine gin, lemon juice and orange dry soda into a large pitcher or punch bowl. Fill with ice, add lemon and lime slices and top with full bottle of sparkling wine. Serve immediately

Canada Dry Champagne Punch.description: From the sparkling taste of Prosecco to the freshness of the basil, this punch will be a festive party hit with your favorite Canada Dry!
recipeIngredient:
1 750ml bottle of Cold Dry Sparkling Wine (a Brut Prosecco, Cava, or Californian is a
good bet)
3 cups of cold Canada Dry Ginger Ale
Canada Dry Champagne Punch.name: Canada Dry Champagne Punch
Canada Dry Champagne Punch.recipeInstructions:
Pour the sparkling wine into a punch
bowl. Slowly add in the Canada Dry Ginger Ale and the orange liqueur. Add the basil and frozen cranberries
(if using) or a few handfuls of ice. Cheers!

Canada Dry Warm GingerApple Rum Punch.description: Sweet, spicy, and comforting, this punch will warm up any crowd.
recipeIngredient: ¼-inch piece fresh Ginger, peeled and thinly sliced
Canada Dry Warm GingerApple Rum Punch.name:
Canada Dry Warm Ginger
Apple Rum Punch
Canada Dry Warm GingerApple Rum Punch.recipeInstructions:
In a large pot, combine apple cider, apple
slices, orange slices, ginger, and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil over high;
reduce to a simmer and cook 10 minutes on low. If desired, can be cooked on low
up to 2 hours. Remove from heat and stir in Canada Dry Ginger Ale and rum. Pour
into a punch bowl; serve warm

Canchanchara.description: A simple concoction said to revive the human spirit. This is a true Cuban heritage cocktail that puts an interesting twist to the classic combination of sweet, citrus and rum.
Canchanchara.name: Canchanchara
Canchanchara.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain over a rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lime wheel

Candied Sapphire.description: A gem of a cocktail, the Candied Sapphire will brighten any brunch.
Candied Sapphire.name: Candied Sapphire
Candied Sapphire.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a glass. Stir. Add ice. Garnish with lime or pineapple

Candy Cane Cocoa.description: There's nothing better than a warm cup of hot cocoa on a chilly winter day... but why stop there? We've added a few ounces of homemade candy cane infused vodka and Baileys Irish Cream for a holiday treat that will keep you feeling holly jolly all day long.
recipeIngredient: Whipped Cream & Crushed Candy Canes to Garnish
Candy Cane Cocoa.name: Candy Cane Cocoa
Candy Cane Cocoa.recipeInstructions: Pour your favorite hot cocoa recipe into a sauce pan over low heat to warm through.. Once heated to your desired temperature, remove the pan from the heat and mix in Candy Cane Vodka and Baileys Irish Cream. Pour mixture into a coffee mug. Top with whipped cream and crushed candy canes

Candy Corn Martini.description: Celebrate Halloween in style by mixing up a Candy Corn Martini! This festive martini features homemade candy corn-infused vodka, ginger beer, pineapple juice and tonic water before it's garnished with cotton candy, which dissolves into the drink. Strong on candy corn flavors, this cocktail is perfect for anyone who enjoys a sweet drink. Make the infused vodka a few days before Halloween, then serve to friends while you celebrate the holiday!
Candy Corn Martini.name: Candy Corn Martini
Candy Corn Martini.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the candy corn vodka, pineapple juice and ginger beer.. Shake until chilled, then pour into chilled martini glasses.. Top with tonic water.. Garnish with cotton candy, which will melt into the drink, and enjoy immediately!

Cannon Blast Shot.description: This intense shot of citrus is the perfect way to kick your night up a notch.
Cannon Blast Shot.name: Cannon Blast Shot
Cannon Blast Shot.recipeInstructions: Add Cannon Blast into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a shot glass

Cape Codder.description: The Cape Codder is a classic drink enjoyed throughout the year by many cable knit sweater-loving prepsters and beyond. Very easy to make and almost too easy to drink. For a slightly less sugary version, add soda water in place of the full amount of juice.
Cape Codder.name: Cape Codder
Cape Codder.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass over ice, combine vodka and juice. Stir and serve with a fresh wedge of lime

Capone.description: Two of Al Capone's major imports were whiskey and balsamic vinegar, legend has it he asked his people make him a drink that included both. We went the extra step and included some garden fresh tomatoes. A sweet reminder of the home country.... This recipe was adapted from the Bufala Negra Cocktail.
Capone.name: Capone
Capone.recipeInstructions: In a shaker muddle simple syrup, whiskey, balsamic, 2 leaves fresh basil (slice basil first), and 3 cherry tomatoes chopped. Add ice and shake vigorously for 10 seconds then strain into rocks glass. Fill glass with fresh ice and top with ginger beer. Garnish with large basil leave and one slice tomato

Captain Morgan Mojito.description: This classic Cuban cocktail contains only a few simple ingredients, but is sure to pack a fresh and flavorful punch. The smooth white rum combined with fragrant mint, tangy lime and hint of sweet simple syrup makes this drink light, bubbly and perfectly refreshing for summertime.
Captain Morgan Mojito.name: Captain Morgan Mojito
Captain Morgan Mojito.recipeInstructions: Muddle the lime, mint leaves and simple syrup in a shaker. Add Captain Morgan White Rum and fill with ice. Shake well. Pour into a glass and top with club soda. Add mint sprig for garnish

Captain Morgan Pina Colada.description: You don’t have to be caught in the rain to enjoy this delicious Piña Colada made with Captain Morgan White Rum. But you could.
Captain Morgan Pina Colada.name: Captain Morgan Pina Colada
Captain Morgan Pina Colada.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients including Captain Morgan White Rum with ice in a blender and blend

Captain Morgan's Cuba Libre.description: This cocktail became popular around the end of the Spanish American war, the name Cuba Libre translates to "Free Cuba".  It's basically a rum and coke with the addition of fresh lime juice. Easy and refreshing.
Captain Morgan's Cuba Libre.name: Captain Morgan's Cuba Libre
Captain Morgan's Cuba Libre.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass filled with ice add rum and cola, top with lime juice and stir

Caramel Apple Moscow Mule.description: The ginger beer imparts the classic spicy flavors of a Moscow Mule, while apple cider and caramel vodka sweeten things up a bit.  Last, a squeeze of lime juice cuts the sweetness just a bit, resulting in a delicious Fall sipper that tastes just like a caramel apple!
recipeIngredient: thin slice of apple, for garnish
Caramel Apple Moscow Mule.name: Caramel Apple Moscow Mule
Caramel Apple Moscow Mule.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients over ice and stir to combine. . Garnish with a slice of apple.

Caramel Apple Pie Cocktail.description: Now you can have your pie and drink it too. Caramel apple vodka, smooth rum cream and apple cider combine to make the perfect fall dessert - no culinary skills necessary!
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Caramel Apple Vodka
1 oz Rumchata
8 oz Apple Cider
Caramel Apple Pie Cocktail.name: Caramel Apple Pie Cocktail
Caramel Apple Pie Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Combine cider, vodka and Rumchata with a few ice cubes in a cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously for about 30 seconds and strain into a glass. Garnish with caramel and  vanilla marshmallows, or rim the glass with caramel and cinnamon sugar!

Caribou Lou.description: Attributed to the rapper TECH N9NE, the Caribou Lou is a somewhat fruity drink with a strong kick from the 151 proof rum. The song goes as far as to call out how "numb" this drink might make you, enjoy responsibly friends.
Caribou Lou.name: Caribou Lou
Caribou Lou.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine all ingredients and shake until cold. Serve in a rocks glass with fresh ice

Carrotini.description: Want to try a funky alternative to the brunch bloody? Give this vegetable juice and infused vodka cocktail a taste. The bright orange color and refreshing vodka flavors make for a drink that's a definite departure from your typical Sunday brunch order.
Carrotini.name: Carrotini
Carrotini.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake until cold and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with carrot and cucumber

Cazadores 1862 Margarita.description:
Cinco de Mayo celebrates Mexico's unlikely victory over the French army in 1862 at the Battle of Puebla. More of an emotional victory than a military one, to Mexicans Cinco de Mayo represents Mexican pride, resolve and bravery in the face of overwhelming odds.

 

This year, celebrate Cinco de Mayo with a delicious Cazadores 1862 Margarita. Featuring Tequila Cazadores Blanco from Mexico & St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur from France, the 1862 Margarita brings the two countries together again to create the perfect cocktail for the holiday. Salud!
Cazadores 1862 Margarita.name: Cazadores 1862 Margarita
Cazadores 1862 Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine all the ingredients with ice. Shake and

serve over the rocks in a 12 oz. glass. Garnish with lime wheel

Cazadores Jalape\u00f1o Margarita.description: For those who enjoy a bit of a kick, the Cazadores Jalapeño Margarita is a journey through the Mexican highlands, where the blue agave grows tall and the jalapeño adds an extra layer of flavor to foods and drinks alike.
Cazadores Jalape\u00f1o Margarita.name: Cazadores Jalapeño Margarita
Cazadores Jalape\u00f1o Margarita.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine all the ingredients with ice. Shake well. Serve over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with a jalapeño wheel

Cazadores Paloma.description: A Pacific coast sunset that's as refreshing as it is tasty. The Cazadores Paloma, with its light fruity flavors and fizzy finish, is the perfect pairing to any late afternoon.
Cazadores Paloma.name: Cazadores Paloma
Cazadores Paloma.recipeInstructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice. Pour in the tequila and top with grapefruit soda. Stir. Garnish with grapefruit and lime

Century Rum Punch.description: Century Rum Punch was based on a recipe from the legendary "Professor" Jerry Thomas and is as good now as it was in 1862.
Century Rum Punch.name: Century Rum Punch
Century Rum Punch.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Fine strain the mixture into a highball glass full of shaved or crushed ice. Garnish with 4 pineapple slices cut into triangles

Cerveza Preparada.description: Cerveza Preparada, (meaning 'prepared beer') is a term used in Mexico when referring to a beer mixed, or prepared to include ingredients like hot sauce or tomato juice. For our version we've chosen to use Clamato juice because of the distinct briny flavor it brings. This combination of beer and clamato juice may seem odd at first, but this distinctly tangy and refreshing drink will hook you from the first sip.
Cerveza Preparada.name: Cerveza Preparada
Cerveza Preparada.recipeInstructions: Pour spice mixture onto a small plate wide enough for the rim of a pint glass or beer mug to fit.. Wet the edge of your glass with a lime wedge and roll the edge into the spice mixture until evenly coated.. Fill glass with ice and pour in clamato juice, and the juice of both your lemon and lime.. Fill the remainder of the glass full with beer. Add hot sauce and additional lemon juice to taste.. Garnish with a lemon wedge and serve.
