<!--StartFragment-->The Chai White
Russian with a Twist: This take on the White Russian will replace the heavy cream with
coconut milk to make it vegan. This will make the drink accessible to those who
previously wouldn't be able to enjoy it.
recipeIngredient: 3-4 parts Almond Milk (I like Almond Breeze)
4 parts Oregon Chai The Original (Sugar free)
Chai White Russian with a Twist (non-dai.name: Chai White Russian with a Twist (non-dairy)
Chai White Russian with a Twist (non-dai.recipeInstructions: Fill glass half full with ice cubes. Pour over the ice 2 parts Kahlúa. Then pour in 2 parts of Absolut Vodka. Next up pour in 4 parts Chai. Finish with 3-4 parts Almond Milk. Stir with spoon and top off with 2 cinnamon sticks

Chambord Margarita.description: For an twist on the classic margarita, try adding Chambord Black Raspberry Liqueur.
Chambord Margarita.name: Chambord Margarita
Chambord Margarita.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a salt-rimmed, ice-filled martini or margarita glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Chambord Royale.description: A bright and flavorful cocktail great for brunch, sipping with friends, or toasting to family.
Chambord Royale.name: Chambord Royale
Chambord Royale.recipeInstructions: Pour Kobel into a champagne flute. Top with Chambord. Garnish with a raspberry

Chambord Spritz.description: A light, bubbly, and fresh drink with a burst of flavor.
Chambord Spritz.name: Chambord Spritz
Chambord Spritz.recipeInstructions: Take a large wine glass and fill it with ice. Add Chambord, white wine and soda

Charred Pineapple Punch.description: A party-pleasing twist on your typical rum punch.  The bitterness of the Campari is tastefully balanced with fresh pineapple, lime and simple syrup.  The charred pineapple garnish will surely impress your guests!
recipeIngredient:
.5 oz Fresh Lime Juice
1 oz Simple Syrup
.75 oz Campari
 1.5 oz Pineapple Juice
1.5 oz Dark Rum
Charred Pineapple Punch.name: Charred Pineapple Punch
Charred Pineapple Punch.recipeInstructions: Fill a tall collins glass with ice. Muddle charred pineapple in a shaker with your simple syrup, lime juice, pineapple juice, Campari and dark rum. Shake to combine. Pour over ice. Add a slice of charred pineapple on the rim for a garnish

Cheerleader Champagne Cocktail.description: A sparkling cocktail that mixes berry goodness with your favorite bubbly. What completes this sweet sipper is the fun and easy pom pom topper on the end of the popsicle stick.
recipeIngredient:
Brut Sparkling Wine
1/4 oz. Creme de Cassis Liqueur
1 Raspberry Frozen Popsicle
Cheerleader Champagne Cocktail.name: Cheerleader Champagne Cocktail
Cheerleader Champagne Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Pour Creme de Cassis into a champagne flute. Put popsicle into glass. Fill glass with chilled sparkling wine. Serve immediately

Cherry Bourbon Smash.description: What's not to love about a refreshing soda paired with a delicious spirit? The muddled maraschinos up the strong cherry flavors in the soda and pairs perfectly with a smooth, oaky bourbon.
Cherry Bourbon Smash.name: Cherry Bourbon Smash
Cherry Bourbon Smash.recipeInstructions: In the base of a cocktail shaker, muddle 2-3 maraschino cherries, lemon juice and bourbon. Add ice and shake until cold. Strain into a rocks glass. Top with ice and Dr Pepper

Cherry Mind Eraser.description: The cherry-coffee pairing isn't seen very often, but the rich, dark fruit along with the vanilla and caramel notes in the Kahlúa® were meant for each other.
Cherry Mind Eraser.name: Cherry Mind Eraser
Cherry Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Fill rocks glass with ice. Add Kahlua and vodka. Add cherry syrup. Top with soda water

Chocolate Martini.description: Dessert in a glass. The Chocolate Martini is a decadent cocktail that's an ideal night cap. Vodka and chocolate combine for perfection in this drink. Some may call it girly but we say chocolate is for everyone.
Chocolate Martini.name: Chocolate Martini
Chocolate Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, shake vigorously for 10-15 seconds until ice cold. Strain into a martini glass and serve

Christmas Cookie Shot.description: Give this Santa-approved twist on a classic holiday treat a try this year. The sweet mix of cointreau, irish cream, coffee liqueur and smooth butterscotch schnapps come together to create a festive cookie flavor, no baking required.
recipeIngredient:
4 oz Baileys Irish Cream
2 oz Butterscotch Schnapps Liqueur
1 oz Cointreau
.5 oz Kahlua
Christmas Cookie Shot.name: Christmas Cookie Shot
Christmas Cookie Shot.recipeInstructions: Measure out all ingredients into a cocktail shaker full of ice. Shake vigorously until chilled thoroughly. Strain liquid equally into 5 shot glasses. Enjoy

Chronic Iced Tea.description: Tasting much more like iced tea than the infamous Long Island Iced Tea, this concoction is the ideal blend of smoky and sweet. Born out of the B-Side Lounge in Cambridge (R.I.P.), it's a specialty drink that will elevate your bartending game.
Chronic Iced Tea.name: Chronic Iced Tea
Chronic Iced Tea.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients, except tea, to a pint glass filled with ice. Fill pint glass with tea and garnish with lemon wedge

Cilantro & Jalapeno Infused Tequila.description:
Tequila is totally trending right now, not only because it is a great spirit for summer, but some say it's main ingredient, Blue Agave has some major health benefits. We love sipping on a smooth silver tequila in a spicy margarita so we decided to take some of those flavors and infuse them directly into the spirit. We enjoy serving it on the rocks topped with a grapefruit spiked seltzer, or just plain club soda with a wedge of citrus

Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 Cup (half a bushel) of Cilantro Leaves
Cilantro & Jalapeno Infused Tequila.name: Cilantro & Jalapeno Infused Tequila
Cilantro & Jalapeno Infused Tequila.recipeInstructions: Place sliced jalapeno and cilantro leaves into the bottom of a 1.5 Pint Mason Jar.. Fill the rest of the jar with a silver tequila of your choice (we used Espolon Blanco )and seal with lid. .  Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 3 days, shaking occasionally. . After 3 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused tequila into a sealed jar.

Cilantro Jalapeno Margarita.description: All it takes are some hot jalapeno slices and a few crisp sprigs of cilantro in your classic margarita to create the ultimate party time pitcher.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 parts Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
Cilantro Jalapeno Margarita.name: Cilantro Jalapeno Margarita
Cilantro Jalapeno Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine Sauza®
Signature Blue Silver, simple syrup, fresh lime juice, and jalapeno slices in a
shaker with ice. Shake and strain over ice. Garnish with fresh cilantro

Cinnamon Spice Sangria.description: Cinnamon Spice makes everything nice! This spiced sangria is the perfect sweater-weather refreshment and easy-as-pie to prepare. Plus, it's super pretty to look at. In summation: this one's a winner.
Cinnamon Spice Sangria.name: Cinnamon Spice Sangria
Cinnamon Spice Sangria.recipeInstructions: In a punch bowl, pour in Barefoot Pinot Noir. Add in apple cider. Add in the cut up fruit, cinnamon sticks, and star anise. Pour in lemon juice. Stir and pour into serving cups. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cinnamon stick

Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shot.description: A blast from the past, the Cinnamon Toast Crunch shot tastes just like a bowl of our childhood favorite cereal. This tasty treat can be enjoyed as a shot, or over ice as a delicious dessert cocktail.
Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shot.name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shot
Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shot.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker over ice and shake until cold. Strain into a shot glass rimmed with cinnamon sugar mixture.

Citrus Margarita.description: Add a citrus flavor to your classic margarita. This new favorite combines tequila with zesty orange and lime juices, topped off with agave nectar.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Sauza® Gold Tequila
1/2 part DeKuyper® Triple Sec Liqueur
2 parts Orange Juice
2 parts Lime Juice
2 parts Agave Nectar
Citrus Margarita.name: Citrus Margarita
Citrus Margarita.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled shaker. Shake well. Strain over ice into glass

Citrus Marmalade Mule.description: Looking for something new and refreshing to drink?  Here is your go-to.  Take the traditional mule to the next level with orange marmalade, fresh mint leaves and don't forget the frosty copper mug.  It certainly will not disappoint.
Citrus Marmalade Mule.name: Citrus Marmalade Mule
Citrus Marmalade Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill your copper mug with ice. In your shaker-pour your vodka, add orange marmalade, fresh mint leaves, and lime juice. Shake to combine. Pour over ice. Add ginger beer. Stir and garnish with lime and mint leaves. Enjoy!

Citrus Mint Pinot Grigio.description: It's funny—our Pinot Grigio is already known for its fresh and crisp flavor, but we just can't seem to stop ourselves from adding more. This Citrus Mint cocktail will magnify everything you already love about this classic white wine.
recipeIngredient: 1 L The Naked Grape Pinot Grigio
Citrus Mint Pinot Grigio.name: Citrus Mint Pinot Grigio
Citrus Mint Pinot Grigio.recipeInstructions:
In a
large pitcher, combine all ingredients. . Let chill
for 2-4 hours (or overnight, if you can wait that long!). Serve
chilled or over ice.

Classic Hot Toddy.description: For colder days ahead, warm up with the Old Forester classic hot toddy.
Classic Hot Toddy.name: Classic Hot Toddy
Classic Hot Toddy.recipeInstructions: In a mug, combine all liquid ingredients. Garnish with floating lemon wheel and fresh grated nutmeg on top

Classic Margarita.description: Timeless and simple, there’s a reason classics never go out of style. Tequila, aromatic triple sec and zesty lime make up the classic margarita recipe we’ve come to love. Pair it with a salty or spicy dish for an explosion of flavors.
Classic Margarita.name: Classic Margarita
Classic Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine all ingredients
in mixing glass and shake vigorously with ice. Strain
over fresh ice in glass. Garnish
with a lime wheel or wedge on the rim and serve. Salt
optional

Cleanse-a-rita.description: This easy take on a margarita combines one of the most popular juice cleanse recipes with tequila for a drink just under 120 calories. The spicy cayenne pepper and tart lemon complement tequila's bite for a balanced beverage you can enjoy almost guilt-free.
Cleanse-a-rita.name: Cleanse-a-rita
Cleanse-a-rita.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila, lemon, water, agave syrup, and a small pinch of cayenne pepper with ice. Shake vigorously until cold. Pour into a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge dusted with salt and cayenne pepper

Clementine Crush.description: Jam-packed with tangy citrus flavor and a dash of tequila, this clementine cocktail never disappoints.
recipeIngredient: 1 part Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
Clementine Crush.name: Clementine Crush
Clementine Crush.recipeInstructions:
Add ingredients to an
ice­-filled shaker. Shake and strain over ice into glass and serve

Cl\u00e1sico 1934.description: A modernized take on the classic rum Manhattan. This drink was designed in 2016 in New York City and named after the year the Arechabala family registered and launched HAVANA CLUB rum in Cuba.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 part Martini & Rossi Rosso Sweet Vermouth
Cl\u00e1sico 1934.name: Clásico 1934
Cl\u00e1sico 1934.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Stir all ingredients vigorously with plenty of ice until very cold. Strain into a rocks glass with an ice sphere. Garnish with an orange lemon peel

Coconut Chambord Slush.description: It's a slightly weird one, this slush, but you'll enjoy it all the same. It’s a bit tropical, a bit berry-tastic (oh, that’s not a thing? Now it is) and really who doesn’t enjoy a good slush on a hot day? Sure, it may have been about 40 degrees out when I made these, but you get the point.
Coconut Chambord Slush.name: Coconut Chambord Slush
Coconut Chambord Slush.recipeInstructions: Shake coconut cream until combined (separation is normal).. Combine Chambord, coconut cream, dark rum, and club soda in a blender.. Add 2 cups of ice (to start, you can add more if you'd like for consistency purposes).. Blend until mixed.. Pour into glasses.. Garnish with berries and coconut!

Coconut Water Mangorita Beach Bag.description:
This refreshing combo of coconut water, mango and tequila is the perfect frozen drink for any beach day.

Check out the rest of our 'Beach Bag' cocktails!
Coconut Water Mangorita Beach Bag.name: Coconut Water Mangorita Beach Bag
Coconut Water Mangorita Beach Bag.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a small 8 oz zip-top plastic bag and seal. . Gently shake bag to mix. . Lay flat in freezer for 6-8 hours until frozen. . When ready to serve gently crush bag contents until a slush.. Open bag and drop in garnish and serve with a straw.

Coffee After Eight.description: Nothing says holiday to us more than minty chocolate. This drink can be enjoyed hot or over coffee ice cubes (so the flavor doesn't dilute). It's the perfect way to keep the party going late into the night.
Coffee After Eight.name: Coffee After Eight
Coffee After Eight.recipeInstructions: Combine schnapps, creme de cacao, heavy cream, coffee in a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously until cold and strain into a mug filled with coffee ice cubes

Cognac Caipirinha.description: In honor of the 2016 summer games in Brazil, Rémy Martin has put a unique twist on the country's national cocktail: the Caipirinha. This refreshing cocktail is the perfect combination of sweet and tart.
Cognac Caipirinha.name: Cognac Caipirinha
Cognac Caipirinha.recipeInstructions: Cut up a lemon into 6 wedges. Muddle the wedges in a rocks glass with simple syrup. Add Rémy Martin VSOP and top with ice. Stir and enjoy!

Cointreau After Dark.description: A simple cocktail with only two ingredients, the Cointreau After Dark is a smooth addition to any holiday soirée.
Cointreau After Dark.name: Cointreau After Dark
Cointreau After Dark.recipeInstructions: Pour Cointreau into a rocks glass . Top with chocolate bitters. Add ice and stir briefly. Garnish with an orange peel

Cointreau Breeze.description: As refreshing and cooling as the summer breeze, this is an easy craft cocktail that can be enjoyed year round.
Cointreau Breeze.name: Cointreau Breeze
Cointreau Breeze.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to an iced highball. Briefly stir

Cointreau Cranberry.description: Don't use all of the cranberry sauce for the turkey!  This simple cocktail is perfect when gathered around a table for Thanksgiving or Christmas.
Cointreau Cranberry.name: Cointreau Cranberry
Cointreau Cranberry.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick

Cointreau Cucumber Mint Rickey.description: The cooling taste of cucumber pops with the addition of fresh mint, making this Rickey a perfect refresher.
Cointreau Cucumber Mint Rickey.name: Cointreau Cucumber Mint Rickey
Cointreau Cucumber Mint Rickey.recipeInstructions: Muddle the cucumber and mint in the bottom of the glass. Pour Cointreau and fresh lime juice. Add ice, top with club soda and stir. Garnish with a cucumber wheel and a mint sprig

Cointreau Original Margarita.description: The Original Margarita, made with Cointreau, was the result of a chic socialite, Margarita Sames, mixing her favorite spirits together until she made the perfect drink while entertaining at home. In 1948 in Acalpuco, Mexico, the Margarita was born, made with two of her favorites: Tequila & Cointreau.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Cointreau
2 oz Blanco Tequila
3/4 oz Fresh Lime Juice
Cointreau Original Margarita.name: Cointreau Original Margarita
Cointreau Original Margarita.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain over ice into a salt rimmed rocks glass. Garnish with a lime wheel

Cointreau Rickey.description: Originally made with rye whiskey, the Rickey is a classic drink simply crafted with fresh lime juice, your favorite base spirit, and club soda. The Cointreau Rickey is a perfection of this American creation, as the sweetness of Cointreau beautifully balances the tartness of fresh lime.
Cointreau Rickey.name: Cointreau Rickey
Cointreau Rickey.recipeInstructions: Pour Cointreau and fresh lime juice into a glass. Add ice, top with club soda and stir. Garnish with a lime and orange zest

Cointreau Strawberry Basil Rickey.description: The distinct aromatics of fresh basil greet your palate with the promise of warmer weather. Paired with ripe strawberries, Cointreau and lime, this Rickey tastes as beautiful as it looks.
Cointreau Strawberry Basil Rickey.name: Cointreau Strawberry Basil Rickey
Cointreau Strawberry Basil Rickey.recipeInstructions: Muddle the strawberry and basil in the bottom of a glass. Pour Cointreau and fresh lime juice. Add ice, top with club soda and stir. Garnish with a strawberry and basil leaf

Collingwood Canadian Mule.description: Take the mule out of Moscow with Collingwood Canadian Whisky.
Collingwood Canadian Mule.name: Collingwood Canadian Mule
Collingwood Canadian Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a lowball glass or mug with ice . Mix in all the ingredients. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Collingwood Dry Manhattan.description: Use extra dry vermouth for this Collingwood version of a Manhattan.
Collingwood Dry Manhattan.name: Collingwood Dry Manhattan
Collingwood Dry Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Fill a shaker with ice. Add ingredients and shake well. Strain into a martini glass

Collingwood Sour.description: Make your next whiskey sour with Collingwood Canadian Whisky and enjoy this simple and classic drink.
Collingwood Sour.name: Collingwood Sour
Collingwood Sour.recipeInstructions: Fill a shaker with ice. Add in ingredients. Shake well . Strain into a low ball glass filled with fresh ice

Coopers' Cup.description: Swap Moscow for Kentucky with this mule from Coopers' Craft.
Coopers' Cup.name: Coopers' Cup
Coopers' Cup.recipeInstructions: Add first three ingredients to a tin cup over crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lime and a sprig of mint

Coopers' On The Rocks.name: Coopers' On The Rocks
Coopers' On The Rocks.recipeInstructions: Pour Coopers' Craft into a rocks glass. Add ice cubes

Coquito.description: The creamy coconut and rum make you feel like you've been transported to the Caribbean for Christmas. Yes please. Many "true" recipes call for raw egg but we opted for  a version without here.
Coquito.name: Coquito
Coquito.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Mix thoroughly. Store in a bottle in the fridge for up to three days. Always serve cold over ice. Garnish with a cinnamon stick

Cosmopolitan.description: A cocktail that went from a solid sour by Tony Cecchini to Carrie Bradshaw's sugary signature. But this version brings the drink back to its authentic roots. And remember, a proper Cosmo should be pink. If it's red, it's wrong.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 oz Citrus Vodka
1 oz Cointreau
1/2 oz Fresh Lime Juice
1-2 dashes Cranberry Juice
Cosmopolitan.name: Cosmopolitan
Cosmopolitan.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15-20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Cowboy Margarita.description:
Cowboys aren't known for drinking margaritas. But if they did, we imagine they'd drink it with
beer. And plenty of jalapeños. Try the Cowboy Margarita: it's proof that the best way to cool
down during the warm summer months, is with a fiery cocktail by your side.
Cowboy Margarita.name: Cowboy Margarita
Cowboy Margarita.recipeInstructions: In blender, add ice, Jose Cuervo Especial® Silver, limeade concentrate, orange juice and beer. Blend. Run lime wedge around the rim of glass then dip the glass into salt. Pour in blender mixture. Garnish the glass with a lime wedge and jalapeno

Cranberry Margarita.description: This is a holiday twist on a favorite mixed drink. And this margarita couldn't be easier to make. The bitterness of the cranberry with the tart lime juice compliments the tequila, resulting delicious and festive flavors
recipeIngredient: 1/4 oz Simple syrup or agave syrup
Fresh cranberries and lime to garnish
Cranberry Margarita.name: Cranberry Margarita
Cranberry Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake until outside of shaker is frosty and cold. Pour into a salt rimmed glass over fresh cubes. Garnish with cranberries and lime wheel

Cranberry Mezcal-Rita.description: Born out of leftover cranberries from Thanksgiving, this recipe has seen me through the winter and then some. The smoky layers of Mezcal combined with the sweet tart cranberry and lime? Heaven.
Cranberry Mezcal-Rita.name: Cranberry Mezcal-Rita
Cranberry Mezcal-Rita.recipeInstructions: Pour all into a shaker, shake it up, and pour over ice. Garnish with cranberries

Cranberry Mint Sparkler.description: Looking for a light and refreshing winter cocktail? Try this amped up version of a classic vodka soda. Swapping plain club soda for a cranberry spiked seltzer adds a boozy kick of flavor that pairs well with the fresh cranberry & mint ice cubes. Fizzy, tart and a perfectly balanced way to mix up your winter cocktail routine.
Cranberry Mint Sparkler.name: Cranberry Mint Sparkler
Cranberry Mint Sparkler.recipeInstructions: Place one cranberry mint cube into the bottom of a rocks glass. Pour in vodka and top with spiked seltzer. Mix gently and enjoy!

Crannon Blast.description: What happens when you combine a citrus shot with some fruity flavor? Shake up a Crannon Blast and find out for yourself.
Crannon Blast.name: Crannon Blast
Crannon Blast.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a shot glass

Crownberry Apple.description: Enjoy a crisp cocktail as the seasons turn with a recipe that is as easy to make as it is to drink!
Crownberry Apple.name: Crownberry Apple
Crownberry Apple.recipeInstructions: Add Crown Royal Regal Apple to an ice-filled rocks glass. Top with cranberry juice and stir. Garnish with an apple wedge

Cuba Libre.description: To celebrate the end of the Cuban War of Independence, US soldier Captain Russell ordered a BACARDÍ Gold Rum and cola with lime. Curious onlookers asked its name. The Captain proposed a toast, 'Por Cuba Libre,' 'For A Free Cuba,' and the original Cuba Libre was born.
Cuba Libre.name: Cuba Libre
Cuba Libre.recipeInstructions: To build this legendary cocktail, fill a highball glass with ice. Squeeze a lime wedge over the ice. Pour in the BACARDI Gold Rum and cola. Gently stir. Garnish with a lime wedge

Cucumber Basil Smash.description: Now liberated from the burdens of boredom, you are free to enjoy the Hendrick's Cucumber Basil Smash! Tipple Away!
Cucumber Basil Smash.name: Cucumber Basil Smash
Cucumber Basil Smash.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass, muddle basil, cucumber, and simple syrup.  . Add HENDRICK'S GIN, lemon juice, and ice. Shake well and fine strain into an iced double rocks glass. Garnish with basil and cucumber wheels

Cynar Julep.description: The herbal and bitter taste of Cynar, pairs perfectly with mint, lemon and grapefruit juice in this refreshing julep variation.
Cynar Julep.name: Cynar Julep
Cynar Julep.recipeInstructions: In a Collins glass, add mint and all ingredients except soda water and bitters. Gently muddle. Add ice and soda, then top with bitters. Stir. Garnish with fresh mint

Dark Horse Fros\u00e9.description: Rosé: the drink of summer. And spring. And fall. And maybe winter, we're not judging. Whether you are looking to cool down on a hot summer day, for a reason to break out the blender, or just need any excuse to sip some rosé, we're here to help. Try this delicious frosé with a pomegranate twist and feel refreshed, no matter the season.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Pomegranate Syrup (4 ounces pomegranate juice / 4 ounces sugar)
Dark Horse Fros\u00e9.name: Dark Horse Frosé
Dark Horse Fros\u00e9.recipeInstructions: Pour bottle of Dark Horse Rosé into a quart container. Freeze for 6 hours. Combine pomegranate juice and sugar. Stir until sugar dissolves. Combine Dark Horse Rosé, pomegranate syrup, and strained lime juice in a blender and blend. Transfer blender to freezer and let thicken for 20-30 minutes. Pour into a glass and garnish with lime or pomegranate seeds

Dark and Stormy.description: A refreshing highball cocktail made with dark rum (the dark) and ginger beer (the stormy).  The Dark and Stormy is a classic cocktail served widely throughout Bermuda.
Dark and Stormy.name: Dark and Stormy
Dark and Stormy.recipeInstructions: Pour ginger beer into a highball glass over ice. Top off with rum and garnish with lime wedge

Daylight Saver.description: Everybody loves a holiday cocktail that transitions seamlessly from day to night, especially when it's this tequila's take on a savory classic.
Daylight Saver.name: Daylight Saver
Daylight Saver.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except absinthe in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice to chill. Rinse a chilled cocktail coupe or martini-style cocktail glass with absinthe, discarding the excess liquid. Strain cocktail into prepared glass. Garnish with a  lime wheel

DeLeon Mexican Mule.description: Pair DeLeon tequila with ginger beer and a touch of citrus for the perfect cocktail!
DeLeon Mexican Mule.name: DeLeon Mexican Mule
DeLeon Mexican Mule.recipeInstructions: Combine DeLeon tequila, lime juice, and simple syrup into a martini shaker filled with ice. Strain into mule mug. Top with Ginger Beer and serve

DeLeon Repaloma.description: You can never go wrong with combining fruity grapefruit juice and tequila with a splash of soda!
DeLeon Repaloma.name: DeLeon Repaloma
DeLeon Repaloma.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain over fresh ice into glass. Top with club soda

Dill & Snap Pea Sake.description: Not every cocktail has to pack a high-alcohol punch to be delicious. This particular spring sipper features fresh cucumber, dill, and spring pea pods, along with low ABV Junmai sake. It’s light, refreshing, and sessionable. Cheers!
recipeIngredient: 2 snap pea pods with tendrils for garnish
1 sprig dill with extra for garnish
Dill & Snap Pea Sake.name: Dill & Snap Pea Sake
Dill & Snap Pea Sake.recipeInstructions: In a mixing tin, muddle the snap pea pods, cucumber slices, dill, and preserved lemon, along with the St. Germain.. Add ice, the sake, limoncello, and lemon juice.. Shake well and double strain into a cocktail glass filled with fresh ice.. Add a splash or so of soda and garnish with a pea tendril and a dill blossom.

Dirty Martini.description: The Dirty Martini is a drink for olive lovers. This salty and briny martini made with gin or vodka is a classic cocktail lounge favorite.  It can be served on the rocks or straight up in a chilled glass. The preferred olives are typically extra large Spanish olives stuffed with pimento.
Dirty Martini.name: Dirty Martini
Dirty Martini.recipeInstructions: In a shaker filled with ice combine vodka or gin, olive juice, and dry vermouth; shake until the cold. Strain into chilled martini glass or rocks glass with fresh ice. Garnish with 2 to 3 olives on a pick

Double Oaked Old Fashioned.description: Try Woodford Reserve Double Oaked Bourbon in the classic Old Fashioned.
Double Oaked Old Fashioned.name: Double Oaked Old Fashioned
Double Oaked Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a mixing glass. Add ice to the mixing glass and an old fashioned glass. Stir ingredients for 30 to 40 seconds. Strain into the old fashioned glass. Garnish with a lightly expressed orange peel

Double Oaked Sour.description: Try this bourbon sour with Woodford Reserve Double Oaked.
Double Oaked Sour.name: Double Oaked Sour
Double Oaked Sour.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously. Strain over ice into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a piece of candied ginger or a lemon peel

Double Oaked Whiskey Sour.description: A little sour. A little sweet. A lot delicious.
Double Oaked Whiskey Sour.name: Double Oaked Whiskey Sour
Double Oaked Whiskey Sour.recipeInstructions: If using egg white, shake by itself in a shaker until frothy. Add remaining ingredients to the shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled glass

EFFEN Cucumber Bloody Mary.description: With the EFFEN Cucumber Bloody Mary, everyone wins! Whip up this classic cocktail with EFFEN Cucumber Vodka, tomato juice and Bloody Mary seasoning. Perfect for Sunday Funday sports!
EFFEN Cucumber Bloody Mary.name: EFFEN Cucumber Bloody Mary
EFFEN Cucumber Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions:
Build
ingredients in order listed and shake. Pour
into serving glass with ice. Garnish
with lime wheel and basil leaf and serve

Earl Grey & Blackberry Julep.description: We've doubled down on the derby day classic julep by using a home infused bourbon and adding fresh berries for a tangy kick. The unique combination of sweet bourbon and strong tea flavors create a drink that will keep you racing back for refills.
Earl Grey & Blackberry Julep.name: Earl Grey & Blackberry Julep
Earl Grey & Blackberry Julep.recipeInstructions: Lightly muddle the blackberries and mint leaves in the bottom of a julep cup or rocks glass. . Next add crushed ice and bourbon to cup. . Stir with bar spoon until some of the ice begins to melt and all ingredients are combined. . Finish with more crushed ice on top, garnish with a blackberry + mint sprig.

Early Times Hero's Special.description: Be the hero of happy hour with this crowd pleaser.
Early Times Hero's Special.name: Early Times Hero's Special
Early Times Hero's Special.recipeInstructions: Pour Early Times over ice in a tall highball glass. Add soda of choice. Stir. Garnish with desired fruit

Early Times Salute.description: Salute to good times with this Early Times favorite.
Early Times Salute.name: Early Times Salute
Early Times Salute.recipeInstructions: Shake ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon twist

Early Times Sweet Freedom.description: Enjoy the sweet freedom of an uncomplicated drink with Early Times Kentucky Whisky.
Early Times Sweet Freedom.name: Early Times Sweet Freedom
Early Times Sweet Freedom.recipeInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice

El Diablo.description: The El Diablo combines the sweetness of blackberry from the cassis with the bold flavor of tequila. This cocktail is becoming more popular but remains still somewhat forgotten. We say, don't put this baby in the corner.
El Diablo.name: El Diablo
El Diablo.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients, except ginger beer, in an ice-filled shaker and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge or a few blackberries

El Duelo.description: This tangy tamarind cocktail packs a savory punch.
El Duelo.name: El Duelo
El Duelo.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake hard so that some of the ice melts. Strain into a coupe glass

Elder-Peary Sangria.description: This is an easy-to-make sangria that combines late summer flavors for a very drinkable concoction that's perfect to share with friends. We've tried it with both pear juice and pear nectar, we prefer  nectar for the more fresh flavor and less sugar.
Elder-Peary Sangria.name: Elder-Peary Sangria
Elder-Peary Sangria.recipeInstructions: In a pitcher, combine white wine, St Germain, pear nectar juice, pear slices and blackberries. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Serve in glasses with ice

Elderflower Sparkler.description: The Elderflower Sparkler has just the right amount of floral, sweet and acidic notes make this cocktail unforgettable. With three simple ingredients, it’ll be the hit at any party!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz lime juice, strained of any pulp
Elderflower Sparkler.name: Elderflower Sparkler
Elderflower Sparkler.recipeInstructions: Add St-Germain and lime juice to a champagne glass. . Top with Prosecco and serve.

Electric Pink Fields.description: Tarragon not your thing? Try it again in this creme de cassis spiked variation of a Daiquiri. That subtle herbal touch is just what this sweet-tart cocktail needs to make it a fine sipper.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz. G.E. Massenez Creme de Cassis
Electric Pink Fields.name: Electric Pink Fields
Electric Pink Fields.recipeInstructions: In the bottom of your shaker, add the tarragon leaves and lime juice. . Lightly crush with a muddler.. Add ice 2/3 up the shaker.. Pour in rum and creme de cassis.. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail coupe.

Emerald City.description: Sweet and stunning this jewel tone cocktail is anything but average. Packed with bright flavors and bold color this sparkling drink will be sure to turn heads at your next party.
Emerald City.name: Emerald City
Emerald City.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients (except the 7-Up) into a cocktail shaker and shake to chill.. Pour into cocktail glass filled with small ice cubes and top with 7-Up.. Enjoy!

Endless Summer.description: This is the perfect drink for when you're not quite ready to let go of summer. Fresh citrus juices, a tequila to add a little bite, and then creme de cassis to balance it all out. We gaurantee you'll be sipping this into next season.
Endless Summer.name: Endless Summer
Endless Summer.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine all ingredients and shake until frosty and cold. Pour entire shaker contents to a rocks glass

Espolon Margarita.description: Looking to up your 'Rita game? Espolòn takes the classic margarita and gives it a twist. Mix Blanco with lime juice, then liven it up with fresh agave instead of the usual orange-flavored liqueur. Now sit back, relax, and enjoy a smooth drink with a lot more bite.
recipeIngredient:
2 parts Espolón Blanco
1 part Fresh Lime Juice
1/2 part Agave Nectar
Espolon Margarita.name: Espolon Margarita
Espolon Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Fill a shaker with ice . 
Add in ingredients and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass

Espresso Martini.description: The Espresso Martini is the perfect cocktail for a late night pick-me-up. The creaminess of the coffee liqueur balances the bitterness of the espresso for an all-around delicious drink.
Espresso Martini.name: Espresso Martini
Espresso Martini.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into a shaker filled with ice, and shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Strain into a martini glass

Extra Dry Fresh-Pressed Daiquiri.description:

<!--StartFragment-->

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-ideograph;
mso-pagination:none;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none">Don’t worry, you don’t
need a blender to make this daiquiri.  All you need is some really good
rum, a lime and some simple syrup. Brugal Extra Dry rum is our personal
favorite.  <p></p></p>

<!--EndFragment-->
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Brugal Extra Dry

1 oz fresh Lime Juice

3/4 oz Simple Syrup
Extra Dry Fresh-Pressed Daiquiri.name: Extra Dry Fresh-Pressed Daiquiri
Extra Dry Fresh-Pressed Daiquiri.recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker with ice, shake vigorously to combine. Strain into a glass full of ice. Garnish with a lime wheel

Fall Harvest Beer Cocktail.description: Try this beer cocktail alongside your traditional turkey dinner this holiday season. It's a fun mix of flavors but also packs a punch. Enjoy responsibly friends.
Fall Harvest Beer Cocktail.name: Fall Harvest Beer Cocktail
Fall Harvest Beer Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Combine bourbon, cider, lemon juice in a shaker with ice. Shake until chilled and pour into a fresh glass with ice. Top with Pumpkin beer

Fennel Fizz Cocktail.description: This fizzy wine concoction is the perfect cocktail after a long day!
recipeIngredient: 1 bottle Kim Crawford Chardonnay, well chilled
Fennel or Dill Fronds to garnish
Fennel Fizz Cocktail.name: Fennel Fizz Cocktail
Fennel Fizz Cocktail.recipeInstructions: In a small saucepan bring sugar, water, and fennel seeds to a boil. Simmer 15 min. Cool 30 mins or overnight, strain to remove seeds. Divide the wine between 5 ice filled glasses. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons fennel syrup to each glass, stir. Garnish with the fennel wedges and fronds. Add a splash of club soda and serve

Finlandia Finnish Line.description: A refreshing vodka tonic with a taste of grapefruit and zesty lime.
Finlandia Finnish Line.name: Finlandia Finnish Line
Finlandia Finnish Line.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add ingredients. Stir lightly. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge

Finlandia Finnish Mule.description: A fruity and Finnish take on the Moscow Mule.
Finlandia Finnish Mule.name: Finlandia Finnish Mule
Finlandia Finnish Mule.recipeInstructions: Build the ingredients in an ice-filled copper mug. Stir lightly. Garnish with ginger stalks, cucumber, and a lime wedge

Finlandia Herbarium.description: Create a fresh cocktail with a less ordinary herbal twist.
Finlandia Herbarium.name: Finlandia Herbarium
Finlandia Herbarium.recipeInstructions: Fill a pitcher with ice. Add the ingredients to the pitcher. Stir well. Garnish with additional herbs

Finlandia Oaks Lily.description: This horse race favorite is a fruity go-to all year long!
Finlandia Oaks Lily.name: Finlandia Oaks Lily
Finlandia Oaks Lily.recipeInstructions: Fill a stemless wine glass with crushed ice. Add in the ingredients. Stir. Add a straw. Garnish with blackberries and a lemon wedge

Finlandia Raspberry Lemonade.description: The sweet, fruity flavor of Finlandia Raspberry flavored vodka is perfect for this delicious Spring or Summer drink.
Finlandia Raspberry Lemonade.name: Finlandia Raspberry Lemonade
Finlandia Raspberry Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add ingredients. Stir lightly. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Fireball Shot.description: Does not get easier than this. Fireball has become quite the crowd favorite shooter as of late. We suggest chilling the bottle; the icy temperature and spicy cinnamon flavor complement each other quite nicely.
Fireball Shot.name: Fireball Shot
Fireball Shot.recipeInstructions: Pour chilled Fireball whiskey into a shot glass

Fireside.description: A refreshing grapefruit cocktail with a wintery addition of rosemary and maple syrup, the Fireside will keep you aglow all season long.
recipeIngredient: 2 sprigs Rosemary (remove the leaves of one sprig)
Fireside.name: Fireside
Fireside.recipeInstructions: In the bottle of a rocks glass, crush rosemary leaves into the maple syrup and salt. Fill the glass with ice and add Grey Goose. Top with grapefruit juice and stir well. Garnish with sprig of rosemary

Flaming Dr. Pepper.description: The Flaming Dr. Pepper shot tastes just like the soda but combines the extra thrill of fire brought to you by the 151 proof rum floated on top of this shot. It's quite strong due to the rum so we don't suggest tipping back more than 1 of these a night.
recipeIngredient:
3/4 oz Amaretto Liqueur
1/4 151 proof Rum
Light Beer
Flaming Dr. Pepper.name: Flaming Dr. Pepper
Flaming Dr. Pepper.recipeInstructions: Fill a shot glass with Amaretto liqueur and top with 1/4 oz of 151 proof rum. Put the shot glass into an empty pint glass then fill around the shot glass up to the rim with light beer. Light the rum on fire with a lighter or match. Blow out the flame and shoot back the drink

Food & Wine Zee Spotted Pig Bloody Mary.description: Bartender Anna Vanderzee suggests making the mix for this recipe one day in advance to allow the spices and horseradish to marry with the tomato juice.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup finely grated peeled fresh horseradish
Finely grated zest of 1 small lemon
Food & Wine Zee Spotted Pig Bloody Mary.name: Food & Wine Zee Spotted Pig Bloody Mary
Food & Wine Zee Spotted Pig Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions: In a pitcher, combine the horseradish, Worcestershire sauce, Sriracha, lemon zest, celery salt, kosher salt and 2 tsps ground pepper. Add the tomato juice and stir well. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 2 hours. Pour the tomato juice mixture into 8 ice-filled rocks glasses. Add 2 oz of vodka to each glass and stir. Garnish each drink with a pinch of ground pepper, a lime wedge and pickled vegetables

Foxy Aperol Spritz.description: A sparkling wine-based cocktail traditionally served in the northern part of Italy during "apertif hour". Essential to the spritz is an Italian bitter orange liqueur such as Aperol, which is in the same family as Campari but a little less bitter and a little more refined. This Simple Aperol Spritz is fairly low in alcohol, luckily, because it goes down a little too easily! Cin cin!
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Aperol
3 oz Dry Prosecco
1 oz Club Soda
Foxy Aperol Spritz.name: Foxy Aperol Spritz
Foxy Aperol Spritz.recipeInstructions: Build in an ice-filled glass. Stir until well mixed. Garnish with an orange wheel or if you're feeling extra Italian, a green olive!

Frangelico Frizzante.description: Frangelico, typically used in creamy, wintery cocktails, is also the base for a great summery, spritzy cocktail: the Frangelico Frizzante.
Frangelico Frizzante.name: Frangelico Frizzante
Frangelico Frizzante.recipeInstructions: Build over ice in a cocktail glass. Stir. Garnish with a lime wedge

Frank's Way.description: Enjoy Sinatra Select the way Frank would.
Frank's Way.name: Frank's Way
Frank's Way.recipeInstructions: Add ice to a rocks glass. Pour in Sinatra Select

Frankenbride Bellini.description: It's scary how perfect this freaky take on a Bellini is for kicking off your Halloween weekend festivities. The Basic Witches give this simple recipe two broomsticks up.
Frankenbride Bellini.name: Frankenbride Bellini
Frankenbride Bellini.recipeInstructions: Cut and core a fresh kiwi then blend into a puree using a blender. Combine 1/2 oz of kiwi puree with vodka and stir together. Pour kiwi and vodka mixture into a champagne flute. Top with a Prosecco. Garnish with 3 blackberries on a pick across the top of the glass

Franny & Joe.description: Frangelico combined with cold brew coffee is a match made in heaven. This hazelnut liqueur adds a distinct and delicious flavor to the coffee. Serve this at your next brunch as an unexpected crowd pleaser.
Franny & Joe.name: Franny & Joe
Franny & Joe.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir. Pour contents into an ice-filled stemless wine glass. Add creamer as desired

French Manhattan.description: Kentucky meets France in Chambord's take on the classic Manhattan.
French Manhattan.name: French Manhattan
French Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a cherry

French Martini.description: Originally created for Chambord's worldwide promotion, the key ingredient to this drink is the Chambord liqueur. The unique feature for this drink is that it was created specifically for a liqueur, which means substituting it would leave a bland taste.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Vodka
1/4 oz Chambord Raspberry Liqueur
1/4 oz Pineapple Juice
1 Twist Lemon Peel to garnish
French Martini.name: French Martini
French Martini.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into shaker with ice, shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Pour into martini glass and enjoy

Frenchie Negroni.description: A simple composition of equal parts ingredients. St-Germain softens the bitterness by adding fruity and refreshing notes to this classic aperitif.
Frenchie Negroni.name: Frenchie Negroni
Frenchie Negroni.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add each ingredient . Garnish with an orange wedge

Fresh Paloma.description: Mexico's most popular cocktail was created by a legendary barman in Tequila, Mexico, and it's fast become a favorite across the land. Meaning "dove," a paloma is simple, refreshing, and packed with el Jimador flavor.
Fresh Paloma.name: Fresh Paloma
Fresh Paloma.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add el Jimador, grapefruit soda, and salt. Garnish with a lime wedge. Relax!

Frostbite.description: Made in Minnesota, there's one thing UV Vodka knows for sure: this is one kind of frostbite you'll 100% enjoy.
Frostbite.name: Frostbite

Fros\u00e9 Vos\u00e9.description: An icy treat to beat the heat, this refreshing take on a blended cocktail is up for anything.
Fros\u00e9 Vos\u00e9.name: Frosé Vosé
Fros\u00e9 Vos\u00e9.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and one cup of ice in a blender. Blend. Garnish with fresh fruit

Frozen Cucumber Gin & Tonic.description: This refreshing frozen cocktail is perfect for those sweltering summer days! Using tonic water ice cubes (you literally just freeze tonic water in an ice cube tray!) helps to add a little extra flavor and keep it icy cold without watering it down. Using regular ice cubes, in combination with the tonic ice cubes, helps add to the slush factor.
recipeIngredient: ½ cup tonic water ice cubes
Frozen Cucumber Gin & Tonic.name: Frozen Cucumber Gin & Tonic
Frozen Cucumber Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: To a blender add gin, lime juice, tonic water, and cucumber. Blend well to pulverize the cucumber. Add tonic water and regular ice cubes. Blend until slushy with no large ice chunks

Frozen Peach & Chambord Mezcal Margarita.description: Although gin is my truest love, I have been fixated on both tequila and Mezcal lately. There is something about margaritas and tequila-based cocktails that beckon the arriving of summer, and this one is hard to resist.
recipeIngredient: Generous drizzle of Chambord black raspberry liqueur, for garnish
Frozen Peach & Chambord Mezcal Margarita.name: Frozen Peach & Chambord Mezcal Margarita
Frozen Peach & Chambord Mezcal Margarita.recipeInstructions: In a high-speed blender, combine the tequila, Mezcal, peach slices,  lime juice, and ice. As a general rule, use equal parts per volume of ice to liquids. Process until smooth, starting on the lowest setting and slowly increasing to the highest.. Taste for balance, adding agave nectar for additional sweetness.. Pour into a chilled cocktail glass and drizzle liberally with Chambord, adding a sprig of mint for garnish.

Frozen Rose Gin & Tonic.description: Summertime heat can be staggering, but this Frozen Rose Gin and Tonic is light, refreshing and has a perfect balance of rose and cucumber. It will surely cool you down.
Frozen Rose Gin & Tonic.name: Frozen Rose Gin & Tonic
Frozen Rose Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients into a blender. . Blend on high speed until smooth.. Serve with a fancy straw!

Frozen Ros\u00e9.description: Summer cocktail season is here and a frozen concoction keeps you cool and happy!! This Frozen Rose is sure to be a crowd favorite...an adult slush made to order!
Frozen Ros\u00e9.name: Frozen Rosé
Frozen Ros\u00e9.recipeInstructions: Pour the wine into a large (13 x 9 or larger) sheet pan with lips. Freeze for at least 8+ hours. . Bring the water to a boil. Add the sugar, reduce the heat to low, and stir until all of the sugar is dissolved. . Add the strawberries to the water/sugar, and give it a solid stir. Let that mixture sit for around 30 minutes to infuse the simple syrup with the flavor of the strawberries.. Strain the strawberry syrup through a sieve, but don't mash the strawberries through, just let it flow through naturally. Save the strained strawberries to put on some ice cream later, because that would be delicious. Oh, but the syrup: Chill the syrup for 30 minutes.. Add 3 ounces of strawberry syrup, 2½ ounces lemon juice, 1 cup of ice, and the frozen wine to a blender and blend until smooth. . Serve!

Frozen Sangria.description: This take on a sangria is a perfect poolside crowd pleaser!
recipeIngredient: Lemon or Orange Wheels, for garnish
Frozen Sangria.name: Frozen Sangria
Frozen Sangria.recipeInstructions: Pour sangria into an ice cube tray and freeze for at least 6 hours. It will never freeze completely due to the alcohol content, but once it's solid but still a bit soft when you push on it, it's ready. Pop the ice cubes into a blender and pour in the orange juice. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. You may have to stop the blender and push the ingredients down several times. Serve immediately

Frozen Watermelon Moscow Mule.description: This Frozen Watermelon Moscow Mule is the refreshing drink you’ve been looking for all summer. Crisp ginger beer and lime juice are blended with the subtle flavors of watermelon and spiked with vodka to create a smooth, blended cocktail that’s sure to keep you cool.
Frozen Watermelon Moscow Mule.name: Frozen Watermelon Moscow Mule
Frozen Watermelon Moscow Mule.recipeInstructions: In a blender, add watermelon, lime juice, vodka and 6 ounces ginger beer (1/2 bottle). . Blend until watermelon is incorporated. Add remaining ginger beer and blend until smooth.. Serve in copper mugs, ice optional.

Fruity Sangria.description: Knowing how to make a basic Sangria should be on everyone's to-do list. It's always a crowd-pleaser and it's the perfect pairing for spicy foods.
Fruity Sangria.name: Fruity Sangria
Fruity Sangria.recipeInstructions: Heat the orange juice and sugar over low heat to dissolve sugar. Combine all other ingredients in a pitcher. Let sit in the fridge for 1-2 hours. Serve in glasses filled with ice

Fuzzy Navel.description: This bright orange highball cocktail screams '80s. Well not really but that's when it became popular. The Fuzzy Navel is an easy-drinking libation for those that want something refreshing yet smooth.
Fuzzy Navel.name: Fuzzy Navel
Fuzzy Navel.recipeInstructions: Add ice to highball glass. Pour in peach schnapps followed by orange juice. Stir and garnish with orange

Game Day Peach Sour.description: Get game day ready with the Maker’s Mark Game Day Peach Sour. One part sour, one part sweet, this fruity twist on a classic bourbon sour will keep you happy no matter the score!
Game Day Peach Sour.name: Game Day Peach Sour
Game Day Peach Sour.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in a shaker. Shake
without ice. Pour
over ice in a glass

Garden Gazpacho Mary.description: We've picked some of our favorite garden flavors and created a summery twist on the classic bloody mary. Packed with fresh veggies like cucumber, red bell pepper and plum tomatoes, this drink is the perfect refreshing addition to your next backyard brunch party. For a spicy kick swap out the vodka for our Jalapeno & Cilantro Tequila.
Garden Gazpacho Mary.name: Garden Gazpacho Mary
Garden Gazpacho Mary.recipeInstructions: Seed, skin and crush the tomatoes, passing the pulp through a fine mesh strainer until you have 3/4 cup of juice.. Next seed both peppers, making sure to carefully wash your hands immediately after working with the jalapeno. . Drop all ingredients, except the vodka into a blender and blend until the vegetables look roughly chopped and combined. . Pour your mix into a pitcher and refrigerate overnight to fully integrate flavors. . To serve, place half a scoop of ice into the bottom of 5 pint glasses and pour in 1.5 oz of vodka into each. . Fill the remainder of the glass with your gazpacho mix and stir slowly to combine. . Serve with a lemon wedge and fresh vegetable garnish.

Gentleman's Manhattan.name: Gentleman's Manhattan
Gentleman's Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Fill a cocktail mixing glass halfway with cubed ice. Add all ingredients and stir for 10 seconds. Strain the liquid into the glass. Add 2 dark cherries on a pick and rest on side of glass to garnish

Gentleman's Sour.name: Gentleman's Sour
Gentleman's Sour.recipeInstructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with cubed ice. Add all ingredients and shake vigorously for 20-30 seconds. Fill a rocks glass halfway with cubed ice. Strain the liquid into the glass. Add lemon wedge to garnish

Ghostly Gin and Tonic.description: Looking to switch up your usual G & T? This drink should do the trick (or treat). Mix up this perfect Ghostly Gin and Tonic to celebrate all the hauntings of Halloween! It's scary delicious.
Ghostly Gin and Tonic.name: Ghostly Gin and Tonic
Ghostly Gin and Tonic.recipeInstructions: Take Mini Sour Gummy Worms and empty into ice cube tray . Fill with your favorite tonic water and freeze 8+ hours or overnight. Remove ice cubes and toss into your favorite glass. Add in more tonic Water and 2 Oz of Gin. Garnish with additional Gummy Worms and serve

Ghoulish Gin-ger Ale.description: This gory cocktail is bloody delicious! Feel free to substitute vodka in place of gin. (We even like whiskey!) This cocktail is essentially a Dirty Shirley but we've upped the scare-factor with the garnish. We made these creepy ice cubes by freezing gummy candies in an ice cube tray with water.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Gin
4 oz Ginger Ale
1 oz Grenadine Syrup
2-3 Dashes Cranberry Bitters
Ghoulish Gin-ger Ale.name: Ghoulish Gin-ger Ale
Ghoulish Gin-ger Ale.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass with ice combine gin and ginger ale. Gently pour grenadine around the inside edges of the glass and garnish with scary accessories. Serve with a straw or swizzle stick to stir grenadine before drinking

Gilded Elixir.description: Try this tart tequila cocktail that is sure to be a crowd pleaser!
Gilded Elixir.name: Gilded Elixir
Gilded Elixir.recipeInstructions: Muddle 4 tart apple slices. Add remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice. Strain over glass and top with champagne

Gimlet.description: Some believe the Gimlet cocktail was named after a British Royal Navy doctor that may have served this to his crew in order to ward off scurvy. The lime juice and gin combination makes a classically refreshing cocktail served up or down over ice, it always delights.
Gimlet.name: Gimlet
Gimlet.recipeInstructions: In a shaker filled with ice combine gin, lime juice, and simple syrup; shake until cold. Pour into a martini glass or rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a fresh wheel of lime

Gin Sling.description: The Gin Sling is a classic cocktail with just the right amount of bitters to go down smooth. This is the perfect drink to class up a happy hour in your home!
Gin Sling.name: Gin Sling
Gin Sling.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice, combine gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, vermouth, and bitters. . Strain into a highball glass filled halfway with ice.. Top with soda water. . Garnish and serve.

Gin and Juice.description: As the name Gin and Juice would suggest, this simple cocktail only contains two ingredients. No multi-step process here, just mix, enjoy and stay "laid back...sippin on gin and juice".
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Gin
2/3 oz Fruit Juice
Fresh Fruit garnish
Gin and Juice.name: Gin and Juice
Gin and Juice.recipeInstructions: In a shaker filled with ice combine gin and juice; shake until cold. Pour into a Collins glass with fresh ice. Garnish with fresh fruit

Gin and Tonic.description: The history of this drink dates back to the British occupancy of India. Soldiers were given quinine to fight malaria. The taste of the medicine on its own was not palatable so soldiers would commonly mix it with sugar, water, and some of their gin ration. The classic cocktail was born. A refreshing and light flavored drink, it's still one of the world's most common and popular cocktails.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Gin
4 oz Tonic Water
Fresh Lime Wedge
Gin and Tonic.name: Gin and Tonic
Gin and Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass halfway with fresh ice cubes and add 2 oz of gin. Rub the lime wedge around the rim of the glass and squeeze the lime into the glass. Fill glass with tonic and give a quick stir with a stirrer

Ginger Old Fashioned.description: Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum paired with a dash of bitters and a touch of sweetness is sure to be a pleaser for any party!
recipeIngredient: Dashes of Ginger Bitters, Angostura Bitters
Ginger Old Fashioned.name: Ginger Old Fashioned
Ginger Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass, add sugar cubes and dissolve with water and bitters. Add Sailor Jerry and stir. Add ice and continue to stir. Strain into a chilled old fashioned glass. Add fresh ice block and garnish with candied ginger

Ginger Spiced Negroni.description: A perfect ginger, wintery cocktail with a seasonal twist.
Ginger Spiced Negroni.name: Ginger Spiced Negroni
Ginger Spiced Negroni.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a mixing glass. Add some ice cubes and stir. Add more ice and repeat. Strain into a chilled old fashioned glass. Add a fresh ice black and garnish with candied ginger

Glen Groni.description: Perfect for a boozy brunch with friends, this twist on the classic Negroni will brighten up any gathering.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Glen Grant The Major's Reserve
1/2 oz Campari
1/2 oz Simple Syrup
1/2 oz Sweet Vermouth
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
1 oz Club Soda or Sparkling Wine
Glen Groni.name: Glen Groni
Glen Groni.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients, except club soda or sparkling wine, with ice for ten seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass. Top with club soda or sparkling wine

Gold Rush.description: An update to the classic Bees Knees cocktail, the Gold Rush substitutes bourbon for gin. Created in NYC's Milk and Honey Bar in the early 2000's, this cocktail is the perfect balance of sweet and tart, good for all seasons.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Bourbon
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
3/4 oz Honey Simple Syrup
Gold Rush.name: Gold Rush
Gold Rush.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake until cold (10-15 seconds). Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice

Grand Old Fashioned.description: The Old Fashioned is quite simply the drink that started it all. It is the OG cocktail. The preferred libation of drinkers in the know from the 19th century to today. Our version takes this drink from good to grand, with the addition of Grand Marnier's signature blend of cognac and orange.
Grand Old Fashioned.name: Grand Old Fashioned
Grand Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Combine Angostura bitters and Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge in a rocks glass.  Add ice and stir. Press orange peel across the top and on the edges of the rocks glass. Garnish with an orange peel and a brandied or maraschino cherry

Grape-A-Rita Sangria.description: Fruit makes drinks extra fancy. The Grape-A-Rita Sangria has fruit coming at you from all angles, what more could you ask for in a drink? #HAVEARITA
Grape-A-Rita Sangria.name: Grape-A-Rita Sangria
Grape-A-Rita Sangria.recipeInstructions: Mix Grape-A-Rita, red wine, and cranberry juice in a stemless wine glass. Add fruit. Enjoy!

Grape-Fruit-Mule.description: A twist on a favorite, The Ritas take the mule to a whole new level. #HAVEARITA
Grape-Fruit-Mule.name: Grape-Fruit-Mule
Grape-Fruit-Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a mule mug with ice. Add in ingredients and stir. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge. Enjoy!

Grapefruit Bourbon Cocktail.description: This bourbon cocktail is one even non-bourbon drinkers will enjoy. Mixed with freshly squeezed grapefruit juice and homemade basil syrup, this cocktail is sure to please.
Grapefruit Bourbon Cocktail.name: Grapefruit Bourbon Cocktail
Grapefruit Bourbon Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Combine syrup, bourbon, grapefruit juice, and bitters in glass.. Add ice and top off with club soda, stir.. Garnish with rosemary and grapefruit peel.

Grapefruit Margarita.description: Remember that really cool person you met that didn’t like margaritas? Yeah, me neither. It really doesn’t matter the time of day, a margarita is appropriate at all hours. If you’re not mixing up a grapefruit margarita this weekend, you might need to re-evaluate your priorities.
Grapefruit Margarita.name: Grapefruit Margarita
Grapefruit Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker, fill with ice, shake for 7-10 seconds.. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice. . Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

Grapefruit Soda.description: Brighten up your vodka soda with High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka
Grapefruit Soda.name: Grapefruit Soda
Grapefruit Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a pint glass with ice. Pour in High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka. Top with club soda. Gently stir. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge

Grasshopper.description: This cocktail, typically served up in a martini glass, is an adult-friendly mint chocolate surprise. Don't let the name bug you, it's only called Grasshopper for the green color. Next time, skip a decadent dessert and reach straight for this cocktail.
recipeIngredient:
3/4 oz Creme de Menthe Liqueur
3/4 oz White Creme de Cacao Liqueur
1/4 oz Heavy Cream
Grasshopper.name: Grasshopper
Grasshopper.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into chilled martini glass

Great White Wine Slush.description: Seeing a Great White? Scary. Sipping on a Great White? Definitely delicious. We've mixed up this frosty drink that is easy to make, and unlike it's namesake it is a delightful addition to any beach day.
recipeIngredient:
3 oz White Wine
2 oz Smirnoff Sourced Pineapple
2 oz Frozen Lemonade
1 oz Club Soda
Pineapple Wedge For Garnish
1 Scoop of Crushed Ice
Great White Wine Slush.name: Great White Wine Slush
Great White Wine Slush.recipeInstructions: Pour wine, Smirnoff Sourced and frozen lemonade into a blender with crushed ice. Blend mixture until smooth but still slightly slushy.. Pour into a wine or martini glass. Top with soda water and garnish with a wedge of pineapple.

Grey Goose Espresso Martini.description: For a smooth pick me up, the Grey Goose Espresso Martini is an excellent digestif to follow a festive meal. Grey Goose Vodka compliments the delicate sweetness of the coffee liqueur, which is perfectly balanced with espresso.
recipeIngredient: 1 part Single Origin Finest Quality Espresso
Grey Goose Espresso Martini.name: Grey Goose Espresso Martini
Grey Goose Espresso Martini.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients together in a shaker. Shake vigorously. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with salted dark chocolate powder

Grey Goose L'Orange Le Grand Fizz.description: An elegant blend of Grey Goose L'Orange Vodka, St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur, soda water and lime for a refreshing summer cocktail.
Grey Goose L'Orange Le Grand Fizz.name: Grey Goose L'Orange Le Grand Fizz
Grey Goose L'Orange Le Grand Fizz.recipeInstructions: Build in an oversized cabernet wine glass with lots of ice. Add Grey Goose L'Orange Vodka and St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur. Add fresh orange juice. Top with chilled soda water. Stir. Garnish with orange wedges and a Grey Goose stirrer

Grey Goose Le Citron Le Grand Fizz.description: An elegant blend of Grey Goose Le Citron Vodka, St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur, soda water and lime for a refreshing summer cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 parts Grey Goose Le Citron Vodka
Grey Goose Le Citron Le Grand Fizz.name: Grey Goose Le Citron Le Grand Fizz
Grey Goose Le Citron Le Grand Fizz.recipeInstructions: Build in an oversized cabernet wine glass with lots of ice. Add Grey Goose Le Citron Vodka and St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur. Add fresh lemon juice. Top with chilled soda water. Stir. Garnish with lemon wedges and a Grey Goose stirrer

Grey Goose Le Fizz.description:
Enjoy during the holidays over a toast or counting down to the New Year. 
The ultimate celebratory cocktail. An elegant and refreshing combination of Grey Goose vodka, elderflower liqueur and freshly squeezed lime, charged with chilled soda water and served in a classic flute glass. 
The rich flavor of Grey Goose vodka gives the cocktail its body, while St-Germain elderflower liqueur offers an intriguing alternative to Champagne's distinctive floral notes. Freshly squeezed lime provides a touch of acidity, with chilled soda adding the all-important effervescence.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 parts Grey Goose Vodka
1 part St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur
1/4 of a Lime
2 parts Chilled Soda Water
Grey Goose Le Fizz.name: Grey Goose Le Fizz
Grey Goose Le Fizz.recipeInstructions: Add Grey Goose and St-Germain into a cocktail shaker. Squeeze lime juice into shaker, then top with ice. Shake vigorously. Fine strain into a chilled flute and top with soda water

Grey Goose Le Grand Fizz.description: An elegant blend of Grey Goose Vodka, St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur, soda water and lime for a refreshing summer cocktail.
Grey Goose Le Grand Fizz.name: Grey Goose Le Grand Fizz
Grey Goose Le Grand Fizz.recipeInstructions: Build in an oversized cabernet wine glass with lots of ice. Add Grey Goose Vodka and St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur. Squeeze fresh lime and discard. Top with chilled soda water. Stir and garnish with lime wedges and a Grey Goose stirrer

Greyhound.description: Gone as fast as a...you got it. Tito's Handmade Vodka and fresh grapefruit juice partner up for this classic cocktail.
Greyhound.name: Greyhound
Greyhound.recipeInstructions: Fill a glass with ice. Pour in Tito's Handmade Vodka. Fill the rest of the glass with the grapefruit juice. Stir. Garnish with a slice of fresh grapefruit

Grilled Summer Peach Margaritas.description: This frozen summer cocktail brings together two summer staples: fresh peaches and the grill. The result is a smoky, herbaceous riff on a frozen margarita, where the char on the peaches matches perfectly with the finish of smoky mezcal.
recipeIngredient: 1-2 sprigs basil or mint leaves, plus more for garnish
Grilled Summer Peach Margaritas.name: Grilled Summer Peach Margaritas
Grilled Summer Peach Margaritas.recipeInstructions: Bring a gas grill to medium heat.. Place the peach halves face down and grill for about 4 to 5 minutes, until char marks develop. Carefully flip them over for another 4 to 5 minutes. Set aside to cool completely.. While waiting for the peaches to cool, make a quick salted herb rim by pulsing the sea salt and herb sprigs in a food processor, until incorporated.. Pour the salted herb mix on to a plate. Prep two cocktail glasses with the salted herb rim by running a slice of lime along the glass rims and lightly dipping them into the salt.. Combine the tequila, mezcal, lime juice, dry curaçao, agave nectar, and grilled peach halves in a blender.. Without adding ice quite yet, purée the ingredients until smooth.. Now add the ice, about an equal amount in volume as the puréed mixture. Blend until frothy, adding more ice if necessary.. Pour into prepped cocktail glasses, garnish with fresh herbs, lime wheels, and peach slices.. CHEERS!

Guava Lemonade Cocktail.description: The Guava Lemonade Cocktail is the perfect way to chill out after a long, hot day.
Guava Lemonade Cocktail.name: Guava Lemonade Cocktail
Guava Lemonade Cocktail.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker add Deep Eddy Lemon Vodka, guava nectar, and blackberry simple syrup and top with ice cubes.. Shake until you have achieved cocktail perfection (that's 30 seconds and not a nanosecond more).. Strain into a chilled glass filled with crushed ice.. Garnish with fresh blackberries on a cocktail stick and serve with a Blackberry Chia Popsicle.

Guayabita Daiquiri.description: Chances are you're no stranger to the daiquiri (neither was Hemingway). The writer's love affair with the quintessential Cuban cocktail began at El Floridita, and while he was single handedly involved in the trial and error of the many iterations that stemmed from the original, none have been as sweet (in a good way) than the Guayabita—which adds guava marmalade to the rum and lime juice mix.
recipeIngredient: 2 parts HAVANA CLUB Añejo Blanco rum
Guayabita Daiquiri.name: Guayabita Daiquiri
Guayabita Daiquiri.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with lime wheel

Gummy Bear Shot.description: Recreate your favorite childhood flavors with this fun shot that tastes just like an actual gummy bear. We don't suggest having a handful of these, one will do just fine.
Gummy Bear Shot.name: Gummy Bear Shot
Gummy Bear Shot.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass

HENDRICK'S & Tonic.description: Embrace the strange. Cuddle the ironic. Consider a cucumber. In your Hendrick's and tonic.
HENDRICK'S & Tonic.name: HENDRICK'S & Tonic
HENDRICK'S & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with good cubed ice. Combine all ingredients and five a gentle stir. Garnish with three thinly sliced rounds of cucumber

Half And Half.description: The Black and Tan is a classic beer cocktail where a pale ale and stout beers are layered in a pint glass to show the light and dark combination this drink's name suggests.
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Pale Ale Beer (traditionally Bass English Pale Ale)
Half And Half.name: Half And Half
Half And Half.recipeInstructions: Pour 6 oz of lager beer into a pint glass. Over the back of a large spoon gently pour 6 oz of stout beer into the glass

Halftime Royal Vanilla.description: Gear up for the second half with the Halftime Royal Vanilla.
Halftime Royal Vanilla.name: Halftime Royal Vanilla
Halftime Royal Vanilla.recipeInstructions: Mix 2 cups of Crown Royal Vanilla together with 5 cups of orange soda (or your soda of choice) into a punch bowl. Add in your favorite sliced fruit and mint

Hand-Shaken Daiquiri.description: The Shaken Daiquiri is a true classic, dating back to the 1800s. Highlighting the versatility of Appleton Estate Reserve Blend, this refreshing cocktail is best served neat in a coupe glass.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz Appleton Estate Reserve Blend Rum
Hand-Shaken Daiquiri.name: Hand-Shaken Daiquiri
Hand-Shaken Daiquiri.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, stir rum, fresh lime juice, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel and serve

Harvey Wallbanger.description: The Harvey Wallbanger is said to have been a marketing concoction from the Italian liqueur company Galliano that used a cartoon of a goofy surfer in one of their campaigns. Mixed with the ingredients of a screwdriver this is a sweet and tasty cocktail that became incredibly popular in the 60s and 70s.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Galliano Liqueur
3 oz Orange Juice
Harvey Wallbanger.name: Harvey Wallbanger
Harvey Wallbanger.recipeInstructions: Pour vodka and orange juice into a highball glass filled with ice. Gently float Galliano on top. Garnish with orange and serve with a straw or stirrer

Havana Cafe.description: A stirred drink when you need a spirited pick-me-up. This concoction with HAVANA CLUB Añejo Clásico, cold brew coffee and sweet vermouth will drum up memories of all things Cuba.
recipeIngredient: 2 parts Havana Club Anejo Clasico Rum
Havana Cafe.name: Havana Cafe
Havana Cafe.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Stir all ingredients vigorously with plenty of ice until very cold. Strain into a rocks glass with an ice sphere. Garnish with a lemon peel

Havana Especial.description: This cocktail can be traced back to 1935, found in the classic La Floridita Cocktail book. It captures the traditional Caribbean rum and pineapple combination, with the Cuban fascination of Maraschino liqueur during that era.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 parts HAVANA CLUB Añejo Blanco rum
Havana Especial.name: Havana Especial
Havana Especial.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain over a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with a pineapple leaf

Havana Mule.description: The Buck, or Mule, has been enjoyed across the Caribbean for nearly as long as rum has been produced in the region. It specifically calls for the combination of ginger ale or ginger beer with citrus and dark rum.
Havana Mule.name: Havana Mule
Havana Mule.recipeInstructions: Combine Havana Club, lime juice, guava nectar, and syrup in a mug. Stir well. Add ice to mug . Top with ginger beer. Garnish with a lime wheel

Heavy Punch.description: Don't let the fruity stuff in this Heavy Punch fool you. It brings out the best in our 92 proof spiced rum - hints of cinnamon, vanilla & nutmeg.
Heavy Punch.name: Heavy Punch
Heavy Punch.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Strain over crushed ice in a hurricane glass. Garnish with fresh grated nutmeg

Hendrick's Gin & Tonic.description: The Gin & Tonic is a Hendrick's signature, served always with a cucumber garnish and never a perfunctory lime.
recipeIngredient:
2 parts Hendrick's Gin
3 parts Tonic Water
Slices of Cucumber
Hendrick's Gin & Tonic.name: Hendrick's Gin & Tonic
Hendrick's Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a high ball glass with cubed ice. Combine Hendrick's and tonic water and stir gently. Garnish with three thinly sliced rounds of cucumber

Hibiscus Margarita.description: We’ve put a spring spin on the classic margarita by creating a simple syrup infused with the tangy floral flavors of hibiscus tea. Not only does this twist harmonize perfectly with the classic margarita flavors, but you are also left with a beautiful fuchsia cocktail perfect for any fiesta.
Hibiscus Margarita.name: Hibiscus Margarita
Hibiscus Margarita.recipeInstructions: Measure all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.. Shake for 10 seconds.. Strain mixture into a margarita glass, and top with club soda.. Serve over ice in glass rimmed with citrus salt.

High Noon Vodka Soda.description: You can't go wrong with High Noon Vodka and a little club soda and lime!
High Noon Vodka Soda.name: High Noon Vodka Soda
High Noon Vodka Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a pint glass with ice. Pour in High Noon Original Vodka and club soda. Gently stir. Garnish with a lime wedge

Holiday Honey.name: Holiday Honey
Holiday Honey.recipeInstructions: Pour Korbel into a champagne flute. Top with Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey. Garnish with a raspberry

Holiday Sparkler.description: Make this festive cocktail with a great twist on a classic holiday champagne drink!
Holiday Sparkler.name: Holiday Sparkler
Holiday Sparkler.recipeInstructions: Mix vodka and pomegranate juice in a champagne flute. Top off drink with a splash of champagne

Honey Bourbon Lemonade.description: A refreshing porch-sipper, the Honey Bourbon Lemonade is as easy to mix up as it is to drink. Before adding the fresh mint garnish, roll the mint tightly and twist to release the fragrant aromas.
Honey Bourbon Lemonade.name: Honey Bourbon Lemonade
Honey Bourbon Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Add honey bourbon and lemonade to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake 5-10 seconds and pour into a highball glass with fresh ice. Garnish with fresh mint

Honey I'm Good Paloma.description: A sweeter version of the popular paloma, this recipe calls for honey simple syrup that adds another dimension. We say, nah nah honey you're good, you could have another and you probably should....
recipeIngredient: 2 oz Fresh Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice
Honey I'm Good Paloma.name: Honey I'm Good Paloma
Honey I'm Good Paloma.recipeInstructions: In a shaker, combine lime juice, grapefruit juice, tequila and honey simple syrup. Add ice and shake 5-10 seconds until cold. Strain drink into glass over fresh ice and garnish with fresh grapefruit and lime slices

Hoppy Ever After.description: At first glance you might think a hoppy brew, and fruity cocktail have nothing in common, but as the old saying goes, opposites attract. In this Better Together cocktail, flavors combine to create a unique beer cocktail that will make even the most skeptical hops lover swoon.
recipeIngredient: Session IPA: Try Founders All Day IPA
Hoppy Ever After.name: Hoppy Ever After
Hoppy Ever After.recipeInstructions: Slowly pour equal parts beer and The Peach Belle into a large stemless wine glass full of ice. . Garnish with a slice of fresh peach.

Hoppy Holidays Beer Cocktail.description: Break into the liquor cabinet for some delicious liqueurs to mix into your winter beer. This drink should be served over a single ice cube or without ice in a classic cocktail glass. The flavors are sweet and incredibly seasonal.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz UFO Gingerland Beer
1/2 oz Domaine de Canton Liqueur
1/2 oz Grand Marnier
Hoppy Holidays Beer Cocktail.name: Hoppy Holidays Beer Cocktail
Hoppy Holidays Beer Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Combine beer and liqueurs in an empty shaker. Swirl ingredients light to mix together then poor into a glass with a single ice cube. Garnish with cinnamon and an orange peel

Hornitos Beermosa.description: Score big with your friends with the Hornitos Beermosa—this refreshing cocktail combines Hornitos Plata Tequila with your favorite beer, a winning combo!
Hornitos Beermosa.name: Hornitos Beermosa
Hornitos Beermosa.recipeInstructions:
Fill
a large pitcher with orange juice, DeKuyper Triple Sec Liqueur and Hornitos
Plata Tequila. Slowly
pour lager into pitcher. Stir
to mix. Fill
pint glasses with ice and add Beermosa

Hornitos Midori Margarita.description: Turn up the heat on the run-of-the-mill margarita with a smooth but powerful blast of melon flavor. Hornitos Plata Tequila and Midori Melon Liqueur make the perfect teammates in this colorful cocktail!
Hornitos Midori Margarita.name: Hornitos Midori Margarita
Hornitos Midori Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Shake
all ingredients with ice and strain over fresh ice in a tall or margarita
glass. Garnish
with a lime wheel on the rim

Hornitos\u00ae Margarita.description: A refreshing, classic, simple cocktail that is always a crowd pleaser!
Hornitos\u00ae Margarita.name: Hornitos® Margarita
Hornitos\u00ae Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in a shaker. Strain
into a margarita glass. Garnish
with a lime wedge and serve. Salt
rim optional

Horse's Neck.description: The Horse's Neck cocktail gets its name from the long, spiral lemon peel twisted around the inside of the glass. Try it with Old Forester Bourbon.
Horse's Neck.name: Horse's Neck
Horse's Neck.recipeInstructions: In an ice filled Collins glass, combine bourbon, bitters. Top with ginger ale. Peel a generous lemon peel, express a light squeeze of oil over the drink, and tuck the peel into the cocktail, winding through the ice

Horseshoe Margarita.description: Fresh, simple ingredients let Herradura Silver shine in this classic.
Horseshoe Margarita.name: Horseshoe Margarita
Horseshoe Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake hard so that some of the ice melts. Strain over fresh ice in a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Hot Cointreau Mulled Cider.description: A warm, spiked Cointreau cider, perfect for the colder temps and keeping warm next to a fire with family and friends during the holidays.
Hot Cointreau Mulled Cider.name: Hot Cointreau Mulled Cider
Hot Cointreau Mulled Cider.recipeInstructions: Add cinnamon sticks, anise, cloves, oranges, apple, and apple cider to a pot. Bring to a boil. Cover and remove from heat. Add Cointreau and steep for 20 minutes. Pour into mugs and garnish with a cinnamon stick or with a slice of apple or orange

Hurricane.description: Made famous by Pat O'Brien's French Quarter Bar in New Orleans, a couple of these strong drinks might have you convinced you're as fluent in French as the locals.
Hurricane.name: Hurricane
