Hurricane.recipeInstructions: Combine rums, lime juice, orange juice, passion fruit syrup, and grenadine in a shaker over ice; shake for 15-to 20 seconds. Pour into a Hurricane glass over fresh ice and garnish with fresh orange wheel and straw

Irish Car Bomb.description: No longer a politically correct term as the name, Irish Car Bomb, references a dark time in Ireland's history, this bomber style shot is still quite popular stateside, especially on St. Patrick's Day. As veterans will tell you, drink it quickly or you're left with a curdled class of beer, whiskey, and irish cream.
recipeIngredient:
1/2 oz Irish Cream Liqueur
1/2 Jameson Irish Whiskey
1 Guinness Beer
Irish Car Bomb.name: Irish Car Bomb
Irish Car Bomb.recipeInstructions: Add Irish Cream Liqueur and Jameson to shot glass, layering Irish Cream on the bottom. Pour Guinness into pint glass 3/4 of the way and let settle. Drop shot glass into Guinness and drink quickly. Don't be too aggressive on the tilt you don't want the shot glass hitting your teeth

Irish Flag Shot.description: The Irish Flag Shot is everything you would want in a festive drink and more. Baileys, Orange Liqueur and Green Crème de Menthe make this quick drink go down a little too smooth, and just might leaving you wanting more.
Irish Flag Shot.name: Irish Flag Shot
Irish Flag Shot.recipeInstructions: Pour the crème de menthe into the shot glass.. Slowly float the Bailey's Irish Cream over the creme de menthe by pouring it over the back of a bar spoon. . Using the back of the bar spoon again, float the orange liqueur over the Bailey's Irish Cream.

Island Mimosa.description: Tropical drink season is upon us, though we'd argue that there's never a bad time for a tropical drink... we are The Ritas, after all. Try the Island Mimosa with a Pine-Apple-Rita. You can thank us later. #HAVEARITA
Island Mimosa.name: Island Mimosa
Island Mimosa.recipeInstructions: Add frozen pineapple chunks to glass or mug to act as ice. Mix in remaining ingredients and stir. Enjoy!

Jack & Coke.name: Jack & Coke
Jack & Coke.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass 3/4 of the way with cubed ice. Pour in Old No. 7. Top with Coca-Cola

Jack Honey and Lemonade.description: Perfect sipping on a hot summer day (or night).
Jack Honey and Lemonade.name: Jack Honey and Lemonade
Jack Honey and Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in ingredients. Stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Jack Honey on the Rocks.description: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey has the bold character of Jack Daniel's Old No. 7 paired with rich honey and a nutty finish.
Jack Honey on the Rocks.name: Jack Honey on the Rocks
Jack Honey on the Rocks.recipeInstructions: Add ice to a rocks glass. Pour over Tennessee Honey

Jack Rye on the Rocks.description: A rye whiskey from Jack Daniel's could only be crafted one way, but there's no wrong way to enjoy Jack Daniel's Tennessee Rye.
Jack Rye on the Rocks.name: Jack Rye on the Rocks
Jack Rye on the Rocks.recipeInstructions: Add ice cubes to a cocktail glass. Pour in Tennessee Rye

Jack's Honey Cider.name: Jack's Honey Cider
Jack's Honey Cider.recipeInstructions: Slowly warm Winter Jack and tea separately. Pour both into a mug and top with Jack Daniel's Tennessee Honey. Stir and sip slowly

Jack's Way.description: Enjoy Winter Jack the way Jack would.
Jack's Way.name: Jack's Way
Jack's Way.recipeInstructions: Slowly warm Winter Jack and pour into your favorite mug. Garnish with a cinnamon stick

Jack-O-Blast Shot.description: Put some pumpkin spice in your life, Captain.
Jack-O-Blast Shot.name: Jack-O-Blast Shot
Jack-O-Blast Shot.recipeInstructions: Add Jack-O-Blast into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a shot glass

Jager Bomb.description: The classic version of this boilermaker (a shot dropped inside another drink) was with made with Jagermeister and beer. The modern version that's now more popular calls for Jagermeister dropped into a glass half full of Red Bull or another similar energy drink. Bottoms up!
Jager Bomb.name: Jager Bomb
Jager Bomb.recipeInstructions: Fill a shot glass with Jagermeister. Pour a half can of energy drink like Red Bull into a pint glass. Drop the shot in and drink immediately

Jalisco Tea.description: Kick up your ice tea with Reposado tequila, lemon juice and simple syrup. This refreshing cocktail will be the perfect addition to any spring or summer party.
recipeIngredient:
1
part Sauza® Signature Blue Reposado Tequila
Jalisco Tea.name: Jalisco Tea
Jalisco Tea.recipeInstructions:
Build
in Collins glass. Top
with ice tea. Gently
stir. Garnish
with a lemon wedge

Jameson Whiskey Sour.description: Sour mixes are the easy way out. This is the 19th Century way to make a whiskey sour, and it still stands tall over 200 years later. The key is to find the right balance of citrus and sugar, but if you follow the recipe you’re in good hands.
recipeIngredient:
60ml of Jameson Irish Whiskey
4 dashes freshly-squeezed lemon juice
1 bar spoon of granulated sugar
1 splash sparkling water
Jameson Whiskey Sour.name: Jameson Whiskey Sour
Jameson Whiskey Sour.recipeInstructions:
Dissolve the sugar with lemon juice and sparkling water in a mixing glass. Add whiskey and fill with ice
. Stir well
. Strain into a sour glass
. Garnish with a cherry

Jerry Loves Ginger.description: This signature drink has the spice of the rum and the freshness of ginger all wrapped into one cocktail.
Jerry Loves Ginger.name: Jerry Loves Ginger
Jerry Loves Ginger.recipeInstructions: Add Sailor Jerry to an empty highball glass. Fill with ice. Top with ginger beer and garnish with candied ginger

Jim Beam Black Manhattan.description: Keep it classy and sportsman-like with a Jim Beam Black, Manhattan. An earthy, herbal flavor emerges when the bitters, Jim Beam Black and sweet vermouth are mixed together.
recipeIngredient:
2
½ parts Jim Beam Black Bourbon Whiskey
Jim Beam Black Manhattan.name: Jim Beam Black Manhattan
Jim Beam Black Manhattan.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in a 3-piece shaker. Shake
vigorously to chill. Strain
into chilled martini glass. Garnish
with a cherry

Jim Beam Black Whiskey Smash.description: Make the winning call with a Jim Beam Black Whiskey Smash. Toffee-caramel flavor and oaky vanilla notes pair well with the bright citrus flavor of lemon. Game day worthy!
recipeIngredient:
2
parts Jim Beam Black Bourbon Whiskey
Jim Beam Black Whiskey Smash.name: Jim Beam Black Whiskey Smash
Jim Beam Black Whiskey Smash.recipeInstructions:
Place
the mint, lemon, and sugar in a cocktail shaker. Muddle
together until the sugar has dissolved and the lemon has expressed its juices. Add
the whiskey, cover, and shake for 30 seconds. Transfer
mixture to an Old Fashioned glass. Top
with crushed ice and garnish with a sprig of mint

Jim Beam Citrus Highball.description: Make a game day decision and whip up a Jim Beam Citrus Highball, a classic cocktail, perfect for any sporting event!
recipeIngredient:
1
part Jim Beam Black Extra Aged Bourbon Whiskey
Jim Beam Citrus Highball.name: Jim Beam Citrus Highball
Jim Beam Citrus Highball.recipeInstructions:
In an
ice-packed Collins glass, add the Jim Beam Black Extra Aged Bourbon Whiskey and soda. Garnish
with a lemon twist

Jim Beam\u00ae & Ginger Ale.description: It's all about ginger this summer. Add ginger ale to your Jim Beam for a refreshing cocktail to beat the heat.
Jim Beam\u00ae & Ginger Ale.name: Jim Beam® & Ginger Ale
Jim Beam\u00ae & Ginger Ale.recipeInstructions:
Build
over ice in a tall highball glass. Add a lemon wedge. Enjoy!

Jimarita Pitcher.description: Got friends comings over? Why not make a pitcher!
Jimarita Pitcher.name: Jimarita Pitcher
Jimarita Pitcher.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into a 2 quart pitcher. Mix well. Pour into salt-rimmed margarita glasses. Garnish each with a lime wedge

Jingle Juice Punch.description: Large batch punches are ideal for entertaining. You can prep most ingredients ahead of time and then mix right before company arrives. Letting guests serve themselves means you have more time to mingle.
recipeIngredient: 750 ml bottle of Bacardi Tangerine Rum
Jingle Juice Punch.name: Jingle Juice Punch
Jingle Juice Punch.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl and serce immediately. Garnish with fresh sliced fruit, cranberries, and maraschino cherries. Serve in cups over ice

John Daly.description: Named for the golfer and his penchant for a good drink, this cocktail is essentially an alcoholic version of an Arnold Palmer, which means it's delicious. If you want to go off-script, substitute the vodka for bourbon.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 oz Vodka
2 oz Lemonade
2 oz Iced Tea
John Daly.name: John Daly
John Daly.recipeInstructions: Fill a large highball glass with ice. Add vodka, tea, and lemonade. Gently stir. Garnish with a lemon slice

Jungle Juice.description: A common term used for any large-batch alcoholic punch, this may bring back memories of college parties or not (you get what we mean).  The key to a good jungle juice is masking the flavor of any cheaper alcohol you use and not making it too sweet. We also like to add a little fruit, just to class it up.
recipeIngredient: 2 gallons of Orange or Mixed Fruit Juice
Jungle Juice.name: Jungle Juice
Jungle Juice.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in large bowl or pitcher. Add fruit to garnish

Kahlua Caramel Affogato.description: The Kahlua Caramel Affogato brings a summer vibe to this delicious adult treat.
Kahlua Caramel Affogato.name: Kahlua Caramel Affogato
Kahlua Caramel Affogato.recipeInstructions: Scoop gelato into a coffee mug or rocks glass. Pour in 1 part of Kahlua and 1 part hot, fresh espresso. Drizzle caramel sauce and sprinkle espresso beans on top for garnish. Serve immediately!

Kahlua Coconut Milk White Russian.description:
A non-dairy version of the White Russian replaces heavy cream with coconut milk
to make it vegan. It's the perfect after-dinner drink to serve with (or as)
dessert.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Vodka
1 oz Kahlua
1 oz Full-Fat Coconut Milk
Kahlua Coconut Milk White Russian.name: Kahlua Coconut Milk White Russian
Kahlua Coconut Milk White Russian.recipeInstructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour Kahlua into the glass. Pour vodka into the glass. Add coconut milk

Kamikaze.description: When this shooter is done right no chaser is required. Dating back to the days of disco, the Kamikaze shooter allowed for the best kind of saturday night fever.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Vodka
1 oz Cointreau or Triple Sec Liqueur
1 oz Rose's Lime Juice
Kamikaze.name: Kamikaze
Kamikaze.recipeInstructions: Combine vodka, triple sec, and lime juice in a shaker over ice; shake vigorously for 10-15 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass or into two shot glasses

Kentucky Bourbon Stout.description: This Kentucky Bourbon Stout is a Southern twist on the boilermaker cocktail!  Enjoy this bourbon stout by mixing Kentucky bourbon and coffee liqueur with a rich coffee stout.
Kentucky Bourbon Stout.name: Kentucky Bourbon Stout
Kentucky Bourbon Stout.recipeInstructions: Pour bourbon and coffee liqueur into a highball or tulip glass.  . Slowly pour stout into glass. . Serve immediately.

Kentucky Mule.description: The ultimate summer drink, as refreshing as the copper mug you sometimes see it served in, this American take on the Russian classic replaces vodka with Wild Turkey bourbon, for those who want a much more flavorful Mule.
Kentucky Mule.name: Kentucky Mule
Kentucky Mule.recipeInstructions: Add Wild Turkey, ginger syrup, lime juice and bitters into shaker filled with ice. Shake, then strain over ice into highball glass. Top with splash of soda water. Garnish with lime and mint sprig

Ketel Botanical Cucumber & Soda.description: For a deliciously fresh taste experience, and a drink that has 40% fewer calories than a glass of white wine, try Ketel One Botanical Cucumber and Mint with soda.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz Ketel One Botanical Cucumber and Mint
Ketel Botanical Cucumber & Soda.name: Ketel Botanical Cucumber & Soda
Ketel Botanical Cucumber & Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a stemmed white wine glass with ice. Mix in Ketel One Botanical Cucumber and Mint and soda. Garnish with a cucumber slice and a sprig of mint

Ketel Botanical Grapefruit and Soda.description: For a deliciously fresh taste experience, and a drink that has 40% fewer calories than a glass of white wine, try Ketel One Botanical Grapefruit and Rose with soda.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz Ketel One Botanical Grapefruit and Rose
Ketel Botanical Grapefruit and Soda.name: Ketel Botanical Grapefruit and Soda
Ketel Botanical Grapefruit and Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a stemmed white wine glass with ice. Mix in Ketel One Botanical Grapefruit and Rose and soda. Garnish with a slice of grapefruit

Ketel Botanical Peach and Soda.description: For a deliciously fresh taste experience, and a drink that has 40% fewer calories than a glass of white wine, try Ketel One Botanical Peach and Orange Blossom with soda.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz Ketel One Botanical Peach and Orange Blossom
Ketel Botanical Peach and Soda.name: Ketel Botanical Peach and Soda
Ketel Botanical Peach and Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a stemmed white wine glass with ice. Mix in Ketel One Botanical Peach and Orange Blossom and soda. Garnish with a peach slice

Ketel One Bloody Mary.description: A classic brunch cocktail, the Bloody Mary is almost a meal in itself. Garnish with anything from celery to bacon to lobster claws, but ground yourself first with this delicious base.
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Ketel One Bloody Mary Base
Ketel One Bloody Mary.name: Ketel One Bloody Mary
Ketel One Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass. Shake with ice and strain into a collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a celery stalk, olive, lemon wedge, or bacon (or more!)

Ketel One Ultimate Martini.description: It doesn't get much more classic than the martini. Keep things crisp and simple with this Ketel One recipe.
Ketel One Ultimate Martini.name: Ketel One Ultimate Martini
Ketel One Ultimate Martini.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon

Kickoff Crown & Cola.description: Get ready to kick off your next tailgate with a classic Crown & Cola.
Kickoff Crown & Cola.name: Kickoff Crown & Cola
Kickoff Crown & Cola.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in Crown Royal Vanilla. Top with cola . Garnish with a lime wedge

Kir Royal.description: Part sweet, part dry, try this fun cocktail.
Kir Royal.name: Kir Royal
Kir Royal.recipeInstructions: Pour Chambord into a champagne flute. Top with Korbel

Knob Creek Lion\u2019s Tail.description: Being on the sidelines has its perks with the Knob Creek Lion’s Tail, the combination of Knob Creek Bourbon Whiskey, lime juice and simple syrup will soon become your favorite game day drink!
Knob Creek Lion\u2019s Tail.name: Knob Creek Lion’s Tail
Knob Creek Lion\u2019s Tail.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and stir. Pour
into a chilled glass. Garnish
with a lime twist

La Fortuna.description: Lime, agave, and pomegranate accentuate the crispness of Herradura Silver.
La Fortuna.name: La Fortuna
La Fortuna.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake hard so that some of the ice melts. Strain over fresh ice into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Lavender Mind Eraser.description: The Lavender Mind Eraser is the perfect cocktail for easy outdoor entertaining on the patio to help guests take it easy throughout the summer.
Lavender Mind Eraser.name: Lavender Mind Eraser
Lavender Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass with ice, pour in Kahlua and one dash lavender bitters. Add vodka, careful not to mix too heavily. Add one more dash of lavender bitters. Top with club soda

Le Poire Le Grand Fizz.description: An elegant blend of Grey Goose Le Poire Vodka, St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur, soda water and lime for a refreshing summer cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 parts Grey Goose Le Poire Vodka
Le Poire Le Grand Fizz.name: Le Poire Le Grand Fizz
Le Poire Le Grand Fizz.recipeInstructions: Build in an oversized cabernet wine glass with lots of ice. Add Grey Goose Le Poire Vodka and St-Germain Elderflower Liqueur. Add fresh lime juice. Top with chilled soda water. Stir. Garnish with pear slices and a Grey Goose stirrer

Lemon Beani-tini.description: Here’s something new to do with your easter candy-  Take those extra jelly beans and infuse them with your favorite vodka.  Adding lemon juice and coconut milk makes for a cocktail thats refreshing and appeals to those with a sweet tooth.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz toasted coconut flakes for garnish
Lemon Beani-tini.name: Lemon Beani-tini
Lemon Beani-tini.recipeInstructions: Pour infused vodka, lemon juice & coconut milk into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.. Shake to combine. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with toasted coconut flakes

Lemon Drop Martini.description: Pretty much the adult version of one of our childhood candy store favorites. Tart yet sweet, the Lemon Drop is typically drank as a shot or straight up in a martini glass. Sugar the rim of your glass for an added kick of sweetness.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Cointreau or Triple Sec Liqueur
1/2 Fresh Lemon Juice
Lemon Drop Martini.name: Lemon Drop Martini
Lemon Drop Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice; shake until cold 10-15 seconds. Strain into two shot glasses or a martini glass

Lemon Palmer.description: Turn the classic Arnold Palmer into a simple cocktail that's easy to make and even easier to sip.
Lemon Palmer.name: Lemon Palmer
Lemon Palmer.recipeInstructions: Fill a pint glass with ice. Pour in the ingredients. Gently stir. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Lemonade Spritzer.description: A light low-calorie cocktail, this Lemonade Spritzer has less than 120 calories. Ideal for daytime drinking this recipe is quick and easy to mix up a large batch for entertaining.
Lemonade Spritzer.name: Lemonade Spritzer
Lemonade Spritzer.recipeInstructions: Fill a wine glass 1/4 of the way with ice cubes. Add white wine, soda, lemonade. Garnish with a fresh lemon wedge

Linebacker's Apple Cider.description: Though a linebacker could probably take down this batch recipe on his own, this is meant to be enjoyed with the whole team!
recipeIngredient: 3 cups of Crown Royal Regal Apple
Linebacker's Apple Cider.name: Linebacker's Apple Cider
Linebacker's Apple Cider.recipeInstructions: Add apple cider, cinnamon sticks, star anise, whole cloves, oranges, and lemons into a slow-cooker. Turn the heat on low and cook for 6-7 hours. Before serving, take out all of the whole spices, oranges and lemons. Pour whisky in. Stir. Add additional oranges, lemons, and cinnamon sticks for garnish

Loco & Coco.description: All cocktails should taste this good. Mix up some Loco & Coco and sip on something special.
Loco & Coco.name: Loco & Coco

Loconut Rocks.description: Captain Morgan LocoNut doesn't need much–just add ice!
Loconut Rocks.name: Loconut Rocks
Loconut Rocks.recipeInstructions: Combine Captain Morgan LocoNut into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass with ice

London Mule.description: A modern take on the classic 1950's cocktail, the London Mule mixes gin with spicy ginger beer and fresh lime juice.
London Mule.name: London Mule
London Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill Mason glass with ice. Pour in gin and ginger beer. Garnish with lime and fresh ginger

Long Island Iced Tea.description: Many claim to be the creators of this young-at-heart staple (all with slightly differing ingredient lists), but this version is the real deal. And while the name of this classic cocktail is misleading, very few actually liken the taste to a real iced tea. One thing we know for sure is that this cocktail has certainly made a name for itself outside of Long Island.
recipeIngredient:
1/2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Silver Tequila
1/2 Gin
1/2 White Rum
1/4 oz Cointreau or Triple Sec Liqueur
1/4 oz Fresh Lemon Juice
Cola (preferably not diet)
Lemon wedge
Long Island Iced Tea.name: Long Island Iced Tea
Long Island Iced Tea.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients except cola to ice-filled shaker; shake for 5-10 seconds. Pour contents, including ice, into pint glass. Top with splash of cola and gently stir. Garnish with a cherry and citrus wedge.

Lychee Martini.description: This lychee martini is a classy uptown cocktail with a nod to Halloween with it's 'eyeball' popsicle and bloody rim. But these fun touches also add to the fragrant flavor of this easy drink.
Lychee Martini.name: Lychee Martini
Lychee Martini.recipeInstructions: Put one of the raspberries into the middle of one of the lychee so the end of the berry is facing outward (ie you can't see the open part). . Press a short popsicle stick into the other end of the lychee then sit on a plate or baking sheet and freeze for at least 2 hours until frozen (you can also do the day before). . When ready to make drink, put some ice in your glass to chill it. . Crush the rest of the raspberries on a plate to form a paste. . Put the remaining lychee in a cocktail shaker or small bowl and add the 1/2tbsp syrup from the can. . Muddle/crush the lychee to release the juices. . Add the gin/vodka and vermouth and shake/stir to mix. . Discard the ice from the glass and dip the rim of the glass in the mashed raspberries to give a red rim to the glass. You can dab on extra by hand. . Put the frozen lychee 'popsicle' in the glass then strain the lychee martini into the glass and enjoy!

Madras.description: The Madras is an easy drink to mix and serve whenever you have guests around. Perfect for every season, we love how quick this vodka cocktail is to mix up. For a spicy twist try infusing vodka with jalapeno to give this drink a little kick in the patchwork shorts.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Vodka
3 oz Cranberry Juice
1 oz Orange Juice
Fresh Lime Wedge
Madras.name: Madras
Madras.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass over ice combine vodka and juices. Stir and serve with a fresh lime wedge

Mai Tai.description: Made popular through Elvis Presley's film Blue Hawaiian, the Mai Tai is a classic tropical drink synonymous with Tiki Culture. This recipe calls for a unique ingredient Orgeat, an almond syrup, that adds a little extra sweetness.
recipeIngredient: Fresh Orange and Lime to Garnish
Mai Tai.name: Mai Tai
Mai Tai.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a shaker with ice, shake vigorously until cold about 10 seconds. Strain into a collins glass over fresh ice and enjoy!

Major's Punch.description: The perfect citrus and sparkling party punch taken up a notch with an unexpected Single Malt Scotch twist.
recipeIngredient:
7 1/2 oz Glen Grant The Major's Reserve
7 1/2 oz Aperol
5 oz Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice
5 oz Fresh Squeezed Grapefruit Juice
2 1/2 oz Simple Syrup
5-10 oz Soda Water
Major's Punch.name: Major's Punch
Major's Punch.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl and mix well. Add ice. Garnish with lemon wheels. Let sit for one minute and stir again before serving in cocktail glasses

Maker\u2019s Mark Purple Stallion Julep.description: Sweet and colorful, the Purple Stallion Julep is a tasty change on a classic drink. This bourbon and schnapps drink is perfect for sitting back and watching any game!
Maker\u2019s Mark Purple Stallion Julep.name: Maker’s Mark Purple Stallion Julep
Maker\u2019s Mark Purple Stallion Julep.recipeInstructions:
Muddle
together 1/3 cup fresh blueberries, DeKuyper Blueberry Schnapps and simple
syrup. Add
the bourbon, stir well and top with lots of crushed ice. Garnish
with fresh mint

Mango Margarita.description: The Mango Margarita is one of the most popular variations of this crowd-favorite cocktail. The smooth fruitiness of mango is a delicious addition. We always sip this cocktail on the rocks with a salted rim.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Cointreau or Triple Sec Liqueur
Mango Margarita.name: Mango Margarita
Mango Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in an ice filled shaker and shake for 5-10 seconds. Strain into an ice filled rocks glass

Manhattan.description: The original classic cocktail, perfect for any occasion.
Manhattan.name: Manhattan
Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Fill a mixing glass with all the ingredients and add ice. Stir gently for 10-15 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry

Maple Bourbon Old Fashioned.description: We substituted maple syrup for sugar in this seasonal take on an old fashioned. It will give the drink a more smooth and earthy flavor.
Maple Bourbon Old Fashioned.name: Maple Bourbon Old Fashioned
Maple Bourbon Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass combine 3 dashes of bitters and maple syrup. Add whiskey and a large ice cube and stir. Garnish with a twisted orange rind and serve

Maple Negroni.description: This cocktail is a twist on the classic negroni. The only difference in the two is the maple syrup that has been added and of course the bacon garnish. This is a great cocktail to make for Campari beginners because it balances the bitterness.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 gin
1 ounce of Camapri
1 ounce of Vermouth
1 teaspoon of Pure Maple Syrup
1/2 cup of Ice
Maple Negroni.name: Maple Negroni
Maple Negroni.recipeInstructions: In a shaker add gin, Campari, vermouth, maple syrup, and ice. Shake mixture for 20 seconds. Strain mixture into serving glass. Garnish with Bacon and Orange Peel

Martinique.description: A variation on the French Martini, this recipe replaces pineapple for the more exotic, Carribbean flavor of mango. Chambord is one of our favorite cocktail additions -- when we restock our bar, we always make sure a bottle of this is on the list.
Martinique.name: Martinique
Martinique.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine all ingredients and shake until frosty and cold. Strain into a martini glass

Melon Madness.description: Made with juicy honeydew and 100% agave, this Melon Madness makes it easy to score cool points with your friends. Are you game?
recipeIngredient: 2 parts Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
Melon Madness.name: Melon Madness
Melon Madness.recipeInstructions:
Add ingredients to blender with ice and blend
till smooth. Pour into glass and serve. Garnish with honeydew melon

Mercy.description: Inspired by the conclusion of All Out War in Robert Kirkman's The Walking Dead, this cocktail is aptly named Mercy. It's a smooth, fruity, and refreshing tasting cocktail.
Mercy.name: Mercy
Mercy.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine Ketel One Vodka, dry vermouth, juice of half of a Meyer lemon, organic agave nectar, and orange bitters with ice. Shake vigorously until the sound of the ice disappears. Pour into a martini glass using a cocktail strainer. Zest and rim the glass with the peel of the Meyer lemon. Garnish with a lemon peel and mint sprig

Mexican Mule.description: You've heard of The Moscow Mule—well, this mule's got way more kick. Swap that vodka for Espolon Blanco, and mix with ginger beer and lime juice. Garnish and go. You've just brought “the party" to your next dinner party.
Mexican Mule.name: Mexican Mule
Mexican Mule.recipeInstructions:
Add ingredients to mixing glass, then add ice. 
Shake and strain into a mule mug or rocks glass. 
Top with ginger beer. 
Garnish with lime wheel or wedge

Mezcal Antiguo Fashioned.description: We've taken the classic Old Fashioned south of the boarder with this 'nuevo' twist. The Mezcal Antiquo Fashioned swaps the bourbon or rye found in a typical Old Fashioned for smokey mezcal and resposado tequila. Garnish this drink with a charred jalapeno and you've got a refined fiesta in a glass.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Fresh Squeezed Blood Orange Juice
Mezcal Antiguo Fashioned.name: Mezcal Antiguo Fashioned
Mezcal Antiguo Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.. Pour in tequila, mezcal, agave, blood orange juice and your dash of bitters.. Stir ingredients with a bar spoon to combine.. Strain into a rocks glass over large ice sphere or cube.. Garnish with charred jalapeno and slice of blood orange.

Mezcal Michelada.description: Looking for a way to take your brunch game to the next level? Give the Mezcal Michelada a try. This spicy, smokey and tangy beer cocktail is the perfect compliment to any breakfast. Beer, lime, hot sauce and mezcal, what more is there to say?
Mezcal Michelada.name: Mezcal Michelada
Mezcal Michelada.recipeInstructions: Fill glass with ice.. Pour the lime juice, mezcal and hot sauce.. Fill to top with beer.. Stir gently with bar spoon to combine.. Garnish with a pinch of salt and a lime wheel.. Enjoy.

Michelada.description: A mexican-style beer cocktail with a little kick and a dash of lime. A perfect sipping drink for street tacos or Sunday brunch.
recipeIngredient: 1 bottle of cold Mexican Lager Beer (Corona, Tecate, Modelo Especial, etc)
2 dashes of Tabasco Sauce or other hot sauce
Michelada.name: Michelada
Michelada.recipeInstructions: Rim an empty pint glass with equal parts black pepper, cayenne pepper, and celery salt. In the same chilled pint glass, combine all ingredients except the beer including hot sauce to your liking. Add beer slowly and stir. Garnish with fresh lime wedge

Midnight Rum Runner.description: This take on the classic Rum Runner gets an upgrade with the use of Luxardo Cherry syrup in place of grenadine. Mixing the liquors together ahead of time makes this tropical tasting cocktail easy to transport to your next party.
recipeIngredient: 1 ¼ oz Luxardo Cherry Syrup (from the jar)
Midnight Rum Runner.name: Midnight Rum Runner
Midnight Rum Runner.recipeInstructions:
Combine the above ingredients in a glass bottle or jar and set aside.. Once mixed store in a cool dark place of the fridge for up to 1 month. . 
When ready to serve combine 1 part above mixture, ½ part orange juice, ½ part pineapple juice over ice. Stir and enjoy.

Midori Sour.description: A fruity and refreshing take on the whiskey sour. The Midori Sour is the perfect combination of sweet and sour. Lower on alcohol volume than other cocktails this is an easy sipper that's still big on flavor.
Midori Sour.name: Midori Sour
Midori Sour.recipeInstructions: Pour ingredients into a shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously for 5-10 seconds. Strain into a highball glass and garnish with cherry

Midsummer Mimosa.description: Make the mimost of your next brunch with this elevated twist on a classic, bubbly orange cocktail.
Midsummer Mimosa.name: Midsummer Mimosa
Midsummer Mimosa.recipeInstructions: Combine Hendrick's Midsummer Solstice and orange juice in a flute glass. Top with sparkling wine. Garnish with orange slice

Midsummer Spritz.description: Watch your cocktail blossom as Hendrick's Midsummer Solstice captures the essence of summer in every bubble. Mix up a batch and enjoy with friends.
Midsummer Spritz.name: Midsummer Spritz
Midsummer Spritz.recipeInstructions: Combine Hendrick's Midsummer Solstice, elderflower liqueur, and lemon juice in a cocktail glass over ice. Gently stir. Top with soda water. Garnish with orange and cucumber slice

Mimosa.description: Mimosas have certainly gained their fame as your favorite brunch cocktail but we can assure you that they are good for any occasion.  The ratio of orange juice to Champagne is always subject to opinion but make sure both ingredients are chilled for the most refreshing outcome.  Feel free to add a teaspoon of Grand Marnier if you want to make your Mimosa a little more complex.  Last but not least, make sure you're never left brunching without one.  Enjoy.
Mimosa.name: Mimosa
Mimosa.recipeInstructions: Chill your Champagne and orange juice.. In a Champagne flute pour 2 oz of Champagne.. Top off with 1 oz of orange juice.. Add a teaspoon of Grand Marnier for an extra touch. (optional). Gently stir and garnish with a fresh orange slice.. Enjoy.

Mint Julep.description: While Mint Juleps will always have a strong association with Derby Day, it's perfectly acceptable to enjoy them throughout the year. Mint was first added to alcohol in London around 1800; the idea eventually found its way to the American south where it was added to bourbon, the rest was history. This simple cocktail with fresh mint over crushed ice creates a drink guaranteed to refresh.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Bourbon
3/2 oz Simple Syrup
7 Large Mint Leaves
Mint Julep.name: Mint Julep
Mint Julep.recipeInstructions: Muddle 6 mint leaves and simple syrup in base of shaker. Add bourbon and ice then shake. Strain cocktail over old fashioned glass with with crushed ice. Top with additional crushed ice then add remaining mint leaf  to garnish and serve

Minty Fresh.description: This bubbly cocktail features fresh mint and lime juice for a drink that's reminescent of a mojito but classy enough to sip on New Year's Eve.
Minty Fresh.name: Minty Fresh
Minty Fresh.recipeInstructions: In the base of a cocktail shaker, combine fresh mint, sugar and lime juice. Muddle together, then add ice and cachaca, and shake until frosty and cold. Strain into a champagne flute, then fill the glass with cava

Minty Mind Eraser.description: This Mind Eraser with Dry Lavender Soda and mint is the perfect cocktail for a romantic night in.
Minty Mind Eraser.name: Minty Mind Eraser
Minty Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Pour in Kahlua. Pour in vodka and top with Dry Soda. Garnish with mint and enjoy!

Minty Spritz.description: This minty spritz is twist on the insanely popular Aperol Spritz. A low-alcohol cocktail means you can enjoy more than one and not overindulge. We love this classic aperitif for the holidays because of the bright, bold colors and distinctive flavor.
Minty Spritz.name: Minty Spritz
Minty Spritz.recipeInstructions: Pour Prosecco in wine glass filled with ice. Add Aperol then top with club soda. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint

Mist and Cola.description: A simple combination of Canadian Mist and cola results in a classic drink.
Mist and Cola.name: Mist and Cola
Mist and Cola.recipeInstructions: Fill a lowball glass with ice. Pour in Mist and cola . Garnish with a maraschino cherry

Mist and Ginger.description: For a little bite with your Canadian Mist, add ginger ale and enjoy.
Mist and Ginger.name: Mist and Ginger
Mist and Ginger.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in ingredients. Garnish with a maraschino cherry or a lemon peel, if desired

Mist and Orange.description: Add orange soda as a fruity compliment to your Canadian Mist.
Mist and Orange.name: Mist and Orange
Mist and Orange.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in ingredients. Garnish with a maraschino cherry or a lemon peel

MoTito.description: Refreshing and bright, the MoTito is a drink that has a name that's easy to remember and fun to say. Not to mention easy to make and drink.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 oz Simple Syrup or 2 tsp of Sugar
MoTito.name: MoTito
MoTito.recipeInstructions: Gently crush mint leaves between your fingers and add to a cocktail shaker. Fill the shaker with ice, Tito's Handmade Vodka, simple syrup (or sugar), and lime juice. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a rocks glass. Top with soda water

Mojito.description: The perfect drink to cool you down, this traditional Cuban highball drink has easily become one of the most popular cocktails around. Fresh muddled mint and lime make up the classic version but there seem to be more variations of Mojitos out there nowadays than we can count. Some prefer to strain this cocktail before serving but tradition says leave the mint leaves right where they are.
Mojito.name: Mojito
Mojito.recipeInstructions: Add lime juice, mint leaves, and simple syrup into the base of a shaker and muddle. Add rum and ice then shake until well chilled. Pour into collins glass and fill with crushed ice, top with club soda then garnish with fresh mint

Molegroni.description: The Molegroni is inspired by one of my favorite dishes on the planet, mole.  Dark, bitter, savory, its a a highly complex sauce made from nuts, bread, chiles, fruit, cinnamon, spices, and chocolate, and is typically made from over 20 ingredients! Built on the bitter backbone of the Campari, this drink has the 5 major flavors found in a traditional mole: chile, sour, sweet, spice, and the "thickener" from the walnuts.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Campari
1 oz Cinzano Rosso Vermouth
1 oz Black Walnut Bourbon Liqueur
1/4 oz Ancho Reyes
1/4 oz Vida Del Maguey Mezcal
3 drops Bittermans Mole Bitters
Molegroni.name: Molegroni
Molegroni.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice. Garnish with Cinnamon Stick, Dried Chile Pepper, Orange Slice with a dash of McCormick Cocoa Chile Blend

Moscato Lemonade.description: Summer means lemonade and we think it's best when it's pretty in pink! We've got a Moscato Lemonade perfect for prepping ahead for an easy-breezy day in the backyard with friends. You won't believe how quick and delicious it is!
recipeIngredient: 1 750ml bottle (or 3 1/4 cups) of The Naked Grape Moscato
Moscato Lemonade.name: Moscato Lemonade
Moscato Lemonade.recipeInstructions:
Pop ice into a pitcher. 
Drop in lemon and strawberry slices. Fill with The Naked Grape Moscato and pink lemonade, adjusting mix to taste. Garnish glasses with lemon and strawberry slices if you're feeling fancy. Optional: add a splash of strawberry vodka for an extra kick of strawberry-flavored goodness

Moscow Mule.description: This cocktail seems to be quite the mixology hotshot as of late but the Moscow Mule has actually been around for quite some time, 1941 to be exact. Simple to make and a certified crowd-pleaser, you often see this cocktail served in its signature frosty copper mug.  The Moscow Mule is perfectly balanced as is, however there's nothing wrong with mixing things up. The sturdy foundation of ginger beer, lime and vodka make it easy to add in some of your favorite flavors like we did with our Citrus Marmalade Mule. Swapping out regular ginger beer for for a diet version makes this a "low-cal" Moscow Mule that packs a punch with out all the calories.
Moscow Mule.name: Moscow Mule
Moscow Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill highball glass or copper mug with ice, add vodka and lime juice then top with ginger beer. Gently stir with bar spoon. Garnish with wedge of lime

Mounds Martini.description: This easy dessert martini tastes just like a Mounds bar in a glass! A decadent chocolate and coconut rim makes it extra special.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 oz. Crème de Cacao (Tempus Fugit recommended)
Semisweet chocolate chips and sweetened flaked coconut, for rim
Mounds Martini.name: Mounds Martini
Mounds Martini.recipeInstructions: To rim glass, melt chocolate chips in the microwave, stirring until smooth. . Swirl the edge of a martini glass in the melted chocolate to coat it. . While the chocolate is still warm, press the rim of the glass into a plate of sweetened flaked coconut so that it sticks. . Place the glass in the fridge for a few minutes to let the rim harden.. Combine crème de cacao, coconut rum, and milk in a shaker with ice and shake until chilled. . Strain into the prepared glass and enjoy!

Mountain Dew Drop-In.description: This 'totally rad' combo of melon liqueur, lemon-lime soda, and light beer results in a bubbly bomb drink with a flavor reminiscent of Mountain Dew.
recipeIngredient:
1/2 Pint Glass Of Light Beer
1/2 Pint Glass of 7-Up Lemon Lime Soda
1.5 oz Midori Melon Liqueur
Mountain Dew Drop-In.name: Mountain Dew Drop-In
Mountain Dew Drop-In.recipeInstructions:
Fill your pint glass half way full with the light beer
. Next, fill the rest of the glass with the 7-Up. (Make sure to leave about an inch or so of room in the glass for when the shot goes in). Fill a standard sized shot glass with the Midori Melon Liqueur and then drop entire shot glass into the pint glass and consume immediately.

Movie Mind Eraser.description: The Movie Mind Eraser is the perfect drink to enjoy with friends during a night in, or when you're all getting ready together for a night out! Be sure to let the layers settle and enjoy through a straw.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Kahlua
1 part Absolut Vodka
1 part Club Soda
Splash of Fever Tree Ginger Beer
Splash of Ginger Ale
Movie Mind Eraser.name: Movie Mind Eraser
Movie Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour Kahlua into the glass. Add a splash of ginger beer. Pour vodka into the glass. Add club soda and then top cocktail with a splash of ginger ale

Mulled Red Wine.description: The warm winter cousin to sangria, this crowd pleaser is great to make in large batches on a snowy day. Seasonal spices like cinnamon and cloves make this mulled wine perfect to sip on by the fire.
Mulled Red Wine.name: Mulled Red Wine
Mulled Red Wine.recipeInstructions: Slice your orange into rounds and stud the rind with your cloves. Drop into a non-aluminum sauce pan with the 2 cinnamon sticks.. Pour the rest of your ingredients into the pan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. (Careful not to boil). Reduce the heat to and allow to simmer for up to 3 hours. . Serve in coffee mugs with a slice of orange.

Muted Boulevardier.description: A little seasoning added to this classic cocktail makes for smooth sipping.
recipeIngredient: 1 dropper Old Forester Sea Salt & Black Pepper Tincture
Muted Boulevardier.name: Muted Boulevardier
Muted Boulevardier.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in mixing glass. Stir with ice. Strain into coupe. Garnish with an orange twist

NOLET's Silver Gin & Tonic.description: Simple in creation, but complex in depth and flavor. Real botanicals of rose, peach and raspberry bloom when combined with tonic and ice.
NOLET's Silver Gin & Tonic.name: NOLET's Silver Gin & Tonic
NOLET's Silver Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice. Add NOLET'S Silver Gin. Top with tonic. Add lemon twist

NOLET\u2019S Silver Dutch Mule.description: Ginger adds just the right spice to warm up this cool NOLET'S Silver Dutch Mule.
NOLET\u2019S Silver Dutch Mule.name: NOLET’S Silver Dutch Mule
NOLET\u2019S Silver Dutch Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a cocktail or wine glass with ice. Add a grapefruit wheel. Add NOLET'S Silver and ginger beer. Garnish with a sprig of mint

NOLET\u2019S Silver Lavender G&T.description: This elevated floral gin and tonic recipe tastes as beautiful as is looks.
NOLET\u2019S Silver Lavender G&T.name: NOLET’S Silver Lavender G&T
NOLET\u2019S Silver Lavender G&T.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients, except tonic water, to a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail or wine glass over fresh ice. Top with tonic water. Garnish with fresh lavender sprigs

Negroni.description: Although we don't know for sure the origin of this drink it's said to be traced back to a little cafe in Florence, Italy. The Negroni is essentially a stronger version of the classic Americano.The gin mixed with Campari and vermouth combine for a robust herbal flavor perfect for sipping.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Gin
1 oz Campari
1 oz Sweet Vermouth
Orange Peel Garnish
Negroni.name: Negroni
Negroni.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice stir for 5 seconds then strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice. Garnish with an orange peel

Negroni Di Aquila.description: So if you’re like me, you don’t just settle for two brunch cocktails. I can’t take credit for this particular drink, since it’s actually a recipe from one of my favorite bars in Chicago, but I kid you not it changed my life! And I’m pretty positive it will do the same for you, which is why I’m sharing it.
Negroni Di Aquila.name: Negroni Di Aquila
Negroni Di Aquila.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a rocks glass filled with ice, and stir. . Garnish with an orange twist.

New Amsterdam Spiced Cider.description: Try this simple recipe for spiced cider with New Amsterdam Vodka. The perfect drink for some winter fun.
New Amsterdam Spiced Cider.name: New Amsterdam Spiced Cider
New Amsterdam Spiced Cider.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients into a Collins glass filled with ice. Stir to combine and chill. Garnish with an apple slice

Nimrod The Ice Breaker.description: Try this scotch cocktail, perfect for the colder months!
recipeIngredient: ½ oz of Preserved Citrus Peel Syrup*
Nimrod The Ice Breaker.name: Nimrod The Ice Breaker
Nimrod The Ice Breaker.recipeInstructions: Stir all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain over one large ice cube. Garnish with preserved citrus peel

North Beach.description: This refreshing and balanced cocktail is inspired by our home, San Francisco. Named for the neighborhood that is known for his Italian heritage and fresh take on classics, it’s a simple yet inspired sipper that’s perfect for summer.
North Beach.name: North Beach
North Beach.recipeInstructions: Rinse a rocks glass with Campari. Add cubed ice and other ingredients to glass and stir. Garnish with a twist

Old Cuban.description: The Old Cuban cocktail is typically served in a champagne coupe. It's a classy drink that combines fresh mint, rum, and champagne; what's not to love.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Aged Rum
1 oz Sparkling Wine
1 oz Lime Juice
1/2 Simple Syrup
2 dashes of Angostura Bitters
6 Mint Leaves
Old Cuban.name: Old Cuban
Old Cuban.recipeInstructions: In the base of cocktail shaker muddle mint leaves, lime juice, simple syrup, and bitters. Add ice and rum and shake until cold. Strain into a champagne coupe and top with sparkling wine

Old Fashioned.description: This cocktail has always been a classic but recently regained popularity from the show Mad Men and overall resurgence of American whiskey. The Old Fashioned is a great introduction into spirit-forward classic cocktails and mixology techniques. Tap into your inner Don Draper and give it a try.
Old Fashioned.name: Old Fashioned
Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In an Old Fashioned glass add sugar cube, bitters, and splash of whiskey muddle until blended. Add one large ice cube and remaining whiskey, stir until sugar is mostly dissolved. Garnish with orange twist

Old Fashioned Bourbon Float.description: Inspired by the Thanksgiving Day Parade, we wanted to create a 'float' of our own that fit in with the flavors of the season. The combination of a classic old fashioned with rich vanilla bean ice cream is the perfect sweet treat to cap off your holiday meal.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Bourbon or Rye Whiskey
1 tsp Syrup from the jar of Luxardo Cherries
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
2 Dashes Orange Bitters
3 Scoops Vanilla Ice Cream
2 Luxardo Cherries For Garnish
Old Fashioned Bourbon Float.name: Old Fashioned Bourbon Float
Old Fashioned Bourbon Float.recipeInstructions: Combine bourbon, bitters, and syrup from the Luxardo Cherry jar into a mixing glass.. Stir to combine. Fill a tall collins will three scoops of vanilla bean ice cream. Pour mixed ingredients over top of ice cream. Top with two Luxardo Cherries and a dash of orange bitters

Old Forester 10-Second Julep.description: It doesn't get much easier than this thanks to Old Forester.
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Old Forester Mint Julep Bourbon Cocktail
Old Forester 10-Second Julep.name: Old Forester 10-Second Julep
Old Forester 10-Second Julep.recipeInstructions: Pack a Collins glass with crushed ice. Pour Old Forester Mint Julep over the ice. Garnish with 3 generous sprigs of mint

Old Forester Bourbon Alexander.description: This creamy variation is soft on the palate with bright coconut and nutmeg notes.
Old Forester Bourbon Alexander.name: Old Forester Bourbon Alexander
Old Forester Bourbon Alexander.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in shaker. Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into coupe glass. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg

Old Forester Ruby.description: This bright drink combines Old Forester, ginger, and raspberry flavors.
Old Forester Ruby.name: Old Forester Ruby
Old Forester Ruby.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lemon peel

Old Pal.description: A rye whisky twist on the classic Negroni cocktail--drier instead of sweet. Harry MacElhone of Harry's Bar in Paris credited his “old pal" with the inspiration for this deliciously friendly drink.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Forty Creek Barrel Select
1 oz Campari
1 oz Dry Vermouth
Old Pal.name: Old Pal
Old Pal.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in mixing glass and stir with ice for 20 seconds. Strain ingredients into rocks glass over one large ice cube. Garnish with orange peel

Olivette.description: In this lighter version of the classic gin Martini, St-Germain provides the perfect balance of flavors: the botanicals of the gin, the wine notes of the vermouth, and the fruity notes of St-Germain.
Olivette.name: Olivette
Olivette.recipeInstructions: In a chilled mixing glass filled with ice, add ingredients. Stir well. Pour into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a green olive

Orange Blossom.description: Looking to add some sparkle and zest to your mimosas? Try the Orange Blossom for a fresh twist on this brunch staple.
Orange Blossom.name: Orange Blossom
Orange Blossom.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker except the La Marca. Shake and strain into a champagne flute while simultaneously pouring in the La Marca. Garnish with a twist of orange peel

Orange Crush.description: A citrus twist on the Cosmopolitan, the Orange Crush is a highball drink that has a bright, refreshing flavor without any alcohol aftertaste.
recipeIngredient:
Juice of 2 Medium-Sized Oranges
1.5 oz Vodka
1 oz Orange Liqueur
Lemon Lime Soda
Orange Crush.name: Orange Crush
Orange Crush.recipeInstructions: Pour first three ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice. Top with lemon-lime soda and garnish with a slice of orange

Orange and Black Sangri-Ahhh!.description: The base of this drink couldn't be easier to make. Orange soda and white wine are a tasty combination to mix with any fruity vodka. The real magic happens in the presentation leaving the cool orange and black layered effect.
Orange and Black Sangri-Ahhh!.name: Orange and Black Sangri-Ahhh!
Orange and Black Sangri-Ahhh!.recipeInstructions: Combine white wine, orange soda, and lemon juice in a pitcher. Use food coloring to dye vodka black (5 drops of each blue and red food coloring, 4 drops of green )  and set vodka aside. In a glass with ice pour in 4-5 oz of orange sangria base. Turn a spoon over and slowly pour one shot of vodka (1 1/2 oz) over the back of the spoon on top of your drink. Serve with a gummy worm garnish

Orchard Twist.description: Harvest time brings the delightful crisp and ripe flavor of apples! Take advantage of this fall gift with a Jim Beam® Orchard Twist…a cocktail to impress your friends and your palate. Combine premium apple-infused bourbon and cranberry juice with a splash of soda. Garnish with lime and enjoy as a holiday cocktail or a simple fall drink.
Orchard Twist.name: Orchard Twist
Orchard Twist.recipeInstructions: Pour Jim Beam Apple and cranberry juice into a rocks glass filled with ice. Add splash of club soda. Garnish with lime wedges

Palm Tree Punch.description: Drizly has officially launched in Tampa and we couldn't resist mixing up a custom cocktail for this fabulous city. Meet the Palm Tree Punch, mild tropical flavors combine with vodka for an easy sipping cocktail. Just add sunshine.
Palm Tree Punch.name: Palm Tree Punch
Palm Tree Punch.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake until cold then pour into a collins glass. Garnish with a fresh lime wheel. Enjoy!

Palmyra.description: One of the newer additions to the cocktail world, the Palmyra is No. 9 Park's mark on the mixologist world. It takes a little more effort than your run-of-the-mill vodka and [insert mixer], but the end product proves that mint and lime are clearly soulmates.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 oz Mint Simple Syrup (See recipe section)
Palmyra.name: Palmyra
Palmyra.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake for 15-20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with two mint leaves tucked into a lime wedge to look like a bird taking flight on the edge of the glass

Paloma.description: The bitter flavor or grapefruit mixed with the bold flavor of tequila equal a surprisingly easy-drinking cocktail. In Mexico, the Paloma is actually preferred over margaritas! A traditional Paloma is made with grapefruit soda but we like this version that calls for fresh grapefruit juice. You won't be let down.
Paloma.name: Paloma
Paloma.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to an ice-filled collins glass. Stir to combine

Parisian Daiquiri.description: In this classic cocktail, St-Germain adds complexity to compliment the perfect flavor balance of sweet, sour, and spirit.
Parisian Daiquiri.name: Parisian Daiquiri
Parisian Daiquiri.recipeInstructions: Fill a shaker with ice. Add ingredients to shaker. Shake well. Strain into a coupe glass

Peach Basil Gin & Tonic.description: There is something so crisp and delicious about a classic Gin & Tonic and this little twist takes this classic to an entirely new level. It’s like the best flavors of summer decided to get together and have a pool party…but the pool is gin…and it’s amazing.
Peach Basil Gin & Tonic.name: Peach Basil Gin & Tonic
Peach Basil Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Place a quartered ripe peach and a few large basil leaves in your shaker..  Add a splash of your favorite gin and muddle together.. Add 2oz of gin to the shaker and top with crushed ice. Cap and shake vigorously for 15 seconds to chill.. Fine strain (or cheese cloth) into a coupe glass and top with 3oz of tonic (or seltzer for a lower calorie treat).. Float a basil leaf to garnish and enjoy.

Peach Berry Chill.description: Oh, the weather outside is frightful... frightfully hot, that is. Cool off with this tart treat. The Peach Berry Chill is a frosty, fruity concoction equally perfect for a summertime party or an unusually annoying Tuesday. (We won’t tell.)
recipeIngredient: 2 oz. Pinnacle Ruby Red Grapefruit Flavored Vodka
Peach Berry Chill.name: Peach Berry Chill
Peach Berry Chill.recipeInstructions: Thoroughly blend ½ C frozen blueberries, 2 oz. Malibu Original Coconut Rum, and ½ C ice, then pour into a glass.. Rinse blender, then blend 1 C frozen peaches, 1 C ice, ½ C water, and 2 oz. Pinnacle Ruby Red Grapefruit Flavored Vodka. If you’d like a sweet drink, add 1 tbsp sugar before blending.. Carefully pour this mixture on top of the blended blueberries for a layered look..  Garnish with fresh fruit and enjoy.

Peach Moscato Slush.description: Picture this: a freshly-blended Moscato Peach Slush rests flawlessly in your hand as you recite your favorite anecdote to a raptured crowd consisting of your all-time favorite backyard barbecue guests. Okay, we can't guarantee that'll happen—but at least you'll have a perfectly sweet and slushy beverage to sip!
Peach Moscato Slush.name: Peach Moscato Slush
Peach Moscato Slush.recipeInstructions:
Blend
together Moscato, frozen peaches, and powdered sugar. . Pour
into chilled glasses and scoop off any excess foam that forms at the top.. If desired, garnish with freshly-sliced limes.

Peach Paloma.description: A tasty tequila paloma is always a perfect cocktail for an afternoon delight. Hornitos® Plata Tequila is given a tart twist with fresh, ruby-red grapefruit juice. Club soda adds a bubbly twist to this cocktail, while fresh rosemary emits a floral sweetness.
recipeIngredient:
½
part Fresh Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice
Peach Paloma.name: Peach Paloma
Peach Paloma.recipeInstructions:
Build
in order over ice in a tall glass. Stir once before adding soda and once
after. Garnish
with a lime wedge or grapefruit wedge and a rosemary sprig (optional)

Pear & Ginger Sparkler.description: This champagne cocktail is a fresh take on a mimosa. Serve it at brunch or a holiday party. Adding the juice last enables the alcohol to rise and the drink to miz itself as you pour.
recipeIngredient:
4 oz Dry Sparkling Wine or Brut Champagne
1 1/2 oz Pear Juice
1/2 oz Domaine de Canton Ginger Liqueur
Pear & Ginger Sparkler.name: Pear & Ginger Sparkler
Pear & Ginger Sparkler.recipeInstructions: In a Champagne glass, combine Domaine de Canton and sparkling wine. Top with pear juice. Optional: Garnish with fresh pear

Peppermint White Russian.description: A perfect end to a chilly night, we love this Winter take on the White Russian. Leave one of these out for Santa and he'll grand your entire wish list.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Half and Half or Whole Milk
Peppermint White Russian.name: Peppermint White Russian
Peppermint White Russian.recipeInstructions: In an old fashioned glass with ice combine Kahlua, Vodka and Peppermint Schnapps. Top with half and half

Perfect Old Fashioned.description: This drink lives up to its name.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Old Forester Perfect Old Fashioned Syrup
Perfect Old Fashioned.name: Perfect Old Fashioned
Perfect Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in mixing glass. Stir with ice. Strain over large ice cube in double old fashioned glass. Garnish with a lemon and orange peel

Pina Colada.description: We sure like Pina Coladas, but maybe not getting caught in the rain. This summery favorite is simple enough to make and almost too easy to enjoy. Just add tropical island getaway.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Light Rum
1 oz White Rum
1 1/2 oz Coconut Cream
3 oz Pineapple Juice
Fruit to garnish
Pina Colada.name: Pina Colada
Pina Colada.recipeInstructions: In a blender combine all ingredients and 1 cup of ice, blend until smooth. Serve in a glass with fruit garnish and straw

Pina Punch.description: This tropical tequila cocktail combines the fruity flavors of pineapple and blueberry with Sauza®, bringing that warm beach vibe to wherever you are.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila

1 part DeKuyper® Blueberry

1/2 part Simple Syrup

1/2 part Lime Juice

2 parts Pineapple Juice
Pina Punch.name: Pina Punch
Pina Punch.recipeInstructions:
Combine all
ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into glass over ice and
serve

Pineapple Fizz.description: Take your cocktail game to the next level with this pineapple infused SKYY recipe that will be sure to be a party pleaser!
Pineapple Fizz.name: Pineapple Fizz
Pineapple Fizz.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker. Add ice. Shake. Strain into a glass and top with soda water

Pineapple Mezcal Smash.description: A blend of smoky and sweet makes this cocktail easy to enjoy year-round. Make sure you have fresh mint on hand - it kicks this cocktail up a notch.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz. crushed pineapple (a can is fine!)
Pineapple Mezcal Smash.name: Pineapple Mezcal Smash
Pineapple Mezcal Smash.recipeInstructions: Muddle simple syrup, a little mint, and crushed pineapple as desired in the bottom of your glass. Add mezcal and 1/4 c. crushed ice, stir. Add pineapple juice and stir again. Top off with crushed ice

Pineapple Mule.description: A fruit forward twist on the mule cocktail that is the perfect summer refreshment.
Pineapple Mule.name: Pineapple Mule
Pineapple Mule.recipeInstructions: Add vodka, pineapple juice, lime juice, and simple syrup into a pitcher. Add ice and mix well. Pour into glasses. Add the ginger beer and garnish

Pineapple Poolboy.description: Pineapple Poolboy is equal parts fruity and refreshing and the little kick of fizz elevates it from just your average mixed drink to a beautifully bubbly boozy beverage!
Pineapple Poolboy.name: Pineapple Poolboy
Pineapple Poolboy.recipeInstructions: In a shaker, combine coconut rum, pineapple juice, and the juice from half of a lime freshly squeezed. Shake well. Pour over ice in a tumbler. Top with 1 shot of 7UP, stir to combine. Garnish with a lime peel or wedge and enjoy!

Pink Starburst Martini.description: Everyone's favorite Starburst flavor (pink, duh) is now in drink form. A refreshing strawberry Starburst inspired martini is the perfect cocktail for any and all celebrations.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 ounces strawberry flavored seltzer or sparkling water
Pink Starburst Martini.name: Pink Starburst Martini
Pink Starburst Martini.recipeInstructions: Add vodka and strawberry kiwi juice to a shaker filled with ice.. Shake vigorously until well combined.. Pour mixture into martini glass and top with 1.5 ounces of strawberry flavored seltzer water.. Garnish with pink starburst.

Pinnacle Home Team Punch.description: What better way to cheer on your home team than with a Pinnacle Home Team Punch! This refreshing cocktail brings together premium Pinnacle Vodka and the island flavors of DeKuyper Blue Curacao. Go team!
Pinnacle Home Team Punch.name: Pinnacle Home Team Punch
Pinnacle Home Team Punch.recipeInstructions:
Add
the vodka and Blue Curacao to a tall glass filled with ice. Fill
with lemon-lime soda and top with lemonade. Stir
and serve

Pinnacle Red Zone.description: Get in the zone with this refreshing cocktail for your next sporting event! Premium Pinnacle vodka paired with cranberry juice and the juicy peach flavor of DeKuyper Peachtree Scnhapps.
Pinnacle Red Zone.name: Pinnacle Red Zone
Pinnacle Red Zone.recipeInstructions:
Add
ingredients to an ice-filled shaker. Shake
and strain into a tall glass filled with ice. Garnish
with apple slices

Pinnacle Sour Apple Highball.description: Assemble the winning team with Pinnacle Original Vodka and DeKuyper Pucker Sour Apple Schnapps—the Sour Apple Highball will be a winner no matter who you’re cheering for!
recipeIngredient:
1
part DeKuyper Pucker Sour Apple Schnapps
Pinnacle Sour Apple Highball.name: Pinnacle Sour Apple Highball
Pinnacle Sour Apple Highball.recipeInstructions:
Build
over ice. Stir
gently. Serve

Pinot Grigio Agua Fresca.description: If you want something refreshing, we can't think of anything better than a delightful combination of fresh watermelon, white wine, and a dash of lime. This classic beverage with a twist is easy to make and perfect for a blazing summer afternoon. You're welcome.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2
cups The Naked Grape Pinot Grigio
Pinot Grigio Agua Fresca.name: Pinot Grigio Agua Fresca
Pinot Grigio Agua Fresca.recipeInstructions:
In a
blender or food processor, puree watermelon and water together in small
batches.. Press
pulpy mixture through a sieve, or fine mesh strainer, into a large punch bowl.. Once
finished, mix in the Pinot Grigio and fresh lime juice.. Chill
until ready to serve. Garnish with fresh lime slices.

Pinot Grigio Sangria Verde.description: A refreshing Sangria Verde is just what this party calls for. And your punch bowl will look extra fruity fresh with your favorite green treats taking a dip in the crisp Pinot  Grigio.
recipeIngredient:
1 box
The Naked Grape Pinot Grigio
Pinot Grigio Sangria Verde.name: Pinot Grigio Sangria Verde
Pinot Grigio Sangria Verde.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients, except pansies, together in a punch bowl.. Let
chill for 2-4 hours.. Garnish
with pansies (not only are they beautiful, but they're 100% safe to eat!)

Pistachio Shot.description: When we first heard "pistachio shot" we weren't sold, but we gave it a try. And then we gave it another try. Because it was so good. Easy to make, easier to drink. You get where we're going.
recipeIngredient:
1/2 oz Bailey's Irish Cream Liqueur
1/4 oz Creme de Menthe
1 1/2 oz Creme de Cacao Liqueur
Pistachio Shot.name: Pistachio Shot
Pistachio Shot.recipeInstructions: Pre-chill all ingredients in the freezer. In a cocktail shaker with no ice, combine all ingredients and shake vigorously. Strain into a shot glass

Platinum Margarita.description: There's nothing better than a fresh citrus forward margarita!
Platinum Margarita.name: Platinum Margarita
Platinum Margarita.recipeInstructions: Rub the rum of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass. Garnish and serve over ice

Plundering Pumpkin.description: Spiced rum, pumpkin beer, and ginger ale? Scary good.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
Plundering Pumpkin.name: Plundering Pumpkin
Plundering Pumpkin.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in an ice filled glass. Stir to combine

Polish Mule.description: Taste the Moscow Mule in his Polish version - Sobieski 100% Pure Rye Polish vodka, simply combined with ginger beer and lime juice.
Polish Mule.name: Polish Mule
Polish Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill your copper mug (or any glass) with ice cubes. Add Sobieski Vodka and lime juice. Top up with ginger beer. Garnish (or not) with lime

Pom Holiday Sparkler.description: This easy Champagne cocktail can take you through the entire holiday season. The colors are bright and merry, and the bubbles make any party pop.
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Brut Rosé Champagne or Dry Rose Sparkling Wine
Pom Holiday Sparkler.name: Pom Holiday Sparkler
Pom Holiday Sparkler.recipeInstructions: In a Champagne flute, combine Champagne and orange bitters. Fill glass with pomegranate juice. Twist the orange over the top of the glass them drop the peel into the drink

Pomegranate Blitz.description: It's game time with Crown Royal's Pomegranate Blitz, a batch cocktail to please the entire team.
recipeIngredient: 2 750 ml bottles of Prosecco or Sparkling White Wine
Pomegranate seeds, lime slices and fresh mint leaves
Pomegranate Blitz.name: Pomegranate Blitz
Pomegranate Blitz.recipeInstructions: Using a pitcher or punch bowl, mix Crown Royal Deluxe, pomegranate juice, pomegranate syrup and lime juice . Add in a handful of pomegranate seeds, a couple slices of lime, and some mint leaves . Fill lowball glasses with ice. Pour punch in about half way. Top with Proescco. Garnish with pomegranate seeds, lime slices, and mint leaves

Pomegranate Whiskey Sour.description: This beautiful beverage is as delicious and refreshing as it looks. The classic holiday fruit, pomegranate, gets mixed into this classy cocktail for a drink that everyone will enjoy.
Pomegranate Whiskey Sour.name: Pomegranate Whiskey Sour
Pomegranate Whiskey Sour.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice. Shake until cold then strain into an old fashioned glass with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel

Pomegranate and Lemon White Wine Spritze.description: The holidays are an indulgent time of year for all of us. It can help to have a few low-calorie cocktails in your arsenal. Try freezing ice cubes with fresh pomegranate seeds for an unexpected twist.
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Dry White Wine (pinot grigio, sauvginon blanc)
Pomegranate and Lemon White Wine Spritze.name: Pomegranate and Lemon White Wine Spritzer
Pomegranate and Lemon White Wine Spritze.recipeInstructions: In a wineglass with ice, combine white wine, soda and pomegranate juice. Squeeze a lemon wedge in the glass and stir gently. Enjoy

Prairie Bee\u2019s Knees.description: The phrase “bee's knees" was prohibition-era slang for “the best." With Prairie Organic Gin, lemon and honey joining flavorful forces, you simply can't go wrong with this simple, clean and classic cocktail.
Prairie Bee\u2019s Knees.name: Prairie Bee’s Knees
Prairie Bee\u2019s Knees.recipeInstructions:
Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add Prairie Organic Gin, lemon juice and honey
in a shaker. Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass

Prairie Blinded by the Sound.description: Crafted with cucumber and grapefruit flavors, this summer favorite is best sipped on a sunny porch or at the end of the dock with your feet in the water.  The light and crisp front end is expected, but the addition of Aperol adds a little depth for the finish.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Prairie Cucumber Flavored Organic Vodka
Prairie Blinded by the Sound.name: Prairie Blinded by the Sound
Prairie Blinded by the Sound.recipeInstructions:
Combine Prairie
Organic Cucumber Flavored Vodka, lemonade, Aperol and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with soda water. Garnish with
grapefruit swath

Prairie Bootlegger.description: Ever have trouble deciding between a gin 'n' tonic or a mojito? Then this drink is for you. Tart lime and sweet herbal flavors come together in the most delightful way. Try it with Prairie Organic Vodka or Gin.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 oz Prairie Organic Vodka (or Prairie Organic
Gin)
Prairie Bootlegger.name: Prairie Bootlegger
Prairie Bootlegger.recipeInstructions:
Fill highball glass with ice. Add Prairie Organic Vodka, lime juice and simple
syrup. Top with soda water. Garnish with lime wedge

Prairie Cool Cucumber.description: Put a new twist on the old standby with Prairie Cucumber Vodka. You'll be surprised about how well the light cucumber flavor and lemon will complement each other. Enjoy the perfect amount of zest and sparkle while visiting with friends. You'll make it your new go-to group cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Prairie Cucumber Flavored Organic Vodka
Prairie Cool Cucumber.name: Prairie Cool Cucumber
Prairie Cool Cucumber.recipeInstructions:
Combine Prairie
Organic Cucumber Flavored Vodka and juice from lemon wedges in shaker with ice. Shake and strain into
a highball glass over ice. Top with Sparkling
Water. Garnish with a lemon
wheel

Prairie Gin & Tonic.description: This quintessential cocktail is both incredibly refreshing and easy to make.
Prairie Gin & Tonic.name: Prairie Gin & Tonic
Prairie Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a lowball glass with ice . Add Prairie Organic Gin. Top with tonic water and stir. Garnish with fresh lime wedge

Prairie Grapefruit Negroni.description: Prairie's playful take on the classic Italian cocktail. The bitter/sweet grapefruit compliments the Compari in a subtly delicious way that will make you smile and say, “One more, please!"
Prairie Grapefruit Negroni.name: Prairie Grapefruit Negroni
Prairie Grapefruit Negroni.recipeInstructions:
Combine Prairie Organic Gin, Compari, sweet vermouth
and grapefruit juice in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and Strain into a lowball glass filled
with ice. Garnish with freshly sliced grapefruit or zest

Prairie Jalapeno Cucumber Mule.description: Jalapeño heat mixed with refreshing cucumber and bubbly ginger beer, this spicy little number is the perfect vacation from your regular Moscow Mule, without having to go too far outside the city limits.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz Prairie Organic Cucumber Flavored Vodka
Prairie Jalapeno Cucumber Mule.name: Prairie Jalapeno Cucumber Mule
Prairie Jalapeno Cucumber Mule.recipeInstructions:
Slice jalapeño and remove seeds, if desired. Muddle jalapeño in bottom of shaker. Add Prairie Organic Cucumber Vodka and ice to cocktail
shaker. Shake and strain into lowball glass filled with ice
cubes. Top off with ginger beer and stir before serving. Garnish with cucumber

Prairie Lemonade.description: Don't let the simplicity of this cocktail fool you. Prairie Cucumber Flavored Organic Vodka adds a smooth and delicate finish to the refreshing taste of fresh lemon and club soda. Just one sip and you'll be feeling fancy.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Prairie Cucumber Flavored Organic Vodka
Prairie Lemonade.name: Prairie Lemonade
Prairie Lemonade.recipeInstructions:
Fill highball glass with ice. Add Prairie Cucumber Flavored Organic Vodka and
lemonade. Top with club soda and stir. Garnish with a fresh lemon wedge

Prairie Mule.description: Zesty and refreshing, the mule's distinctive taste is matched only by its one-of-a-kind look—always served in a mug.  This drink is the perfect marriage of Prairie Organic Vodka, ginger beer, and lime with a charming hint of mint.
Prairie Mule.name: Prairie Mule
Prairie Mule.recipeInstructions:
Pour Prairie Organic Vodka and lime juice into a
chilled mug. Add ice and ginger beer. Stir to combine. Top with fresh mint. Garnish with lime wedge

Prairie Organic Gimlet.description: This Organic Gimlet is easy to make, ridiculously refreshing, and the perfect blank canvas to add in your favorite flavors, from spicy to sweet.
Prairie Organic Gimlet.name: Prairie Organic Gimlet
Prairie Organic Gimlet.recipeInstructions:
Combine all ingredients in cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a lowball glass filled
with ice. Garnish with lime slice or zest for a punch of
color

Prairie Salty Dog.description: After you've tried one, you'll never say, “hold the salt" again. Tall, gorgeous, salty, and tart, this classic cocktail is made with the best ingredients: Prairie Organic Vodka (or gin) grapefruit juice, basil leaves and salt.
Prairie Salty Dog.name: Prairie Salty Dog
Prairie Salty Dog.recipeInstructions:
Coat rim of highball glass with coarse salt. Fill glass with ice. Pour ¼ vodka over ice. Muddle basil leaves with 1 oz grapefruit juice
and add to glass. Add remaining grapefruit juice to glass

Prairie Switchel.description: An uplifting drink with a refreshing twist. Switchel, also called Haymaker's Punch, was mixed centuries ago by hard working colonial farmers and prairie homesteaders when they were breaking a sweat. We've updated it here with fresh lavender, honey and our smooth organic vodka. Enjoy!
Prairie Switchel.name: Prairie Switchel
Prairie Switchel.recipeInstructions:
Fill glass with ice. In cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh ginger and
lavender flowers. Add Prairie Organic Vodka, apple cider vinegar
and honey . Shake well and strain into glasses. Top off with sparkling water or tonic. Garnish with the remaining lavender sprigs

Prickly Pink Margarita.description: Tickled pink by the uniquely vibrant prickly pear, this Sauza® margarita is an easy way to add a little color to your day.
recipeIngredient: 1 part Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
Prickly Pink Margarita.name: Prickly Pink Margarita
Prickly Pink Margarita.recipeInstructions:
Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice and
shake. Strain into glass and serve. Garnish with prickly pear slice and lime
wedge (optional)

Pumpkin Russian.description: If "The Dude" drank Starbucks he would give this cocktail two thumbs up. It's so easy to make a seasonal craze into a cocktail classic. It hopefully goes without saying, but let your PSL cool down before mixing it into this drink.
Pumpkin Russian.name: Pumpkin Russian
Pumpkin Russian.recipeInstructions: Order a tall PSL however you like it. Sneak a few sips to tide you over, then pour the rest into an ice cube tray enough to make 4 or 5 cubes. Once frozen put ice cubes into a rocks glass. Add vodka and Kahlua. Finish with a milk or heavy cream. Stir and enjoy

Purple Haze.description: This tart and tasty purple haze drink adds a touch of class and sophistication to any sporting event. DeKuyper Pucker Grape Schnapps, Pinnacle Vodka and lemon-lime soda combine to make sweet and zesty cocktail.
Purple Haze.name: Purple Haze
Purple Haze.recipeInstructions:
Add
ingredients to an ice-filled shaker. Shake
and strain into a chilled martini glass

Quarterback Deluxe Mule.description: With Crown Royal calling the plays, you know you can expect victory with the Quarterback Deluxe Mule. First down!
Quarterback Deluxe Mule.name: Quarterback Deluxe Mule
Quarterback Deluxe Mule.recipeInstructions: Combine Crown Royal Deluxe and lime juice in a shaker. Add ice. Shake well. Strain into a mug over fresh ice. Top with ginger beer. Garnish with a lime wheel and mint leaves

Ramos Gin Fizz.description: With a recommended shake time of 12 minutes, this cocktail is not for the weak. Test your mixology muscles with this frothy spin on the classic Gin Fizz.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz.	gin (London Dry or Old Tom)

1	oz.	heavy cream

1	oz.	simple syrup

1/2	oz.	fresh squeezed lemon juice

1/2	oz.	fresh squeezed lime juice

1	egg white

3	dashes	orange blossom water
1 oz. Club Soda

1	drop	vanilla extract, (optional)
Ramos Gin Fizz.name: Ramos Gin Fizz
Ramos Gin Fizz.recipeInstructions: Fill shaker with all ingredients (except the club soda) and dry shake for 10 seconds with no ice.. Next add a handful of small ice cubes and shake again for several minutes.. Continue shaking for up to 12 minutes, and or until you can no longer hear the ice inside.. Pour into a chilled Collins glass and slowly top with club soda until the frothy head rises just above the rim of the glass.. Serve with a straw.

Raspberry Mule.description: The Moscow Mule is one of the most popular, easy-drinking vodka cocktails around. This version adds the bright flavors of raspberry and delivers a festive holiday sipper.
Raspberry Mule.name: Raspberry Mule
Raspberry Mule.recipeInstructions: In a collins glass with ice, combine vodka, Chambord, and lime juice. Top with ginger beer and garnish with mint and lime. Stir gently with straw before enjoying

Red Hot Honey.description: Sweet and spicy come together in this shot.
Red Hot Honey.name: Red Hot Honey
Red Hot Honey.recipeInstructions: Combine in a shot glass. Enjoy!

Red Shandy.description: A new take on a summer classic, mix High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit with your favorite beer to make a fun and fruity shandy.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka
1 oz Fresh Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice
Red Shandy.name: Red Shandy
Red Shandy.recipeInstructions: Pour High Noon Ruby Red Grapefruit Vodka and ruby red grapefruit juice into a pint glass. Top off with your beer of choice. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge

Red, Red Rita.description: Enjoy this margarita recipe which combines fresh, juicy blood oranges with Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Sauza® Signature Blue Silver Tequila
1 part Blood Orange Juice

1/2 part Lime Juice

1/2 part Simple Syrup

1 Blood Orange Wedge
Red, Red Rita.name: Red, Red Rita
Red, Red Rita.recipeInstructions:
Combine all
ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into glass over ice and
serve

Red, White, and Ros\u00e9.description: As easy as it is delicious. Grab some bitters and bring the bubbles because your cocktail glass just got an upgrade.
Red, White, and Ros\u00e9.name: Red, White, and Rosé
Red, White, and Ros\u00e9.recipeInstructions: Pour vodka into a glass with ice. Top with club soda and a dash of bitters. Garnish with grapefruit twist

Reese's Cereal Milk White Russian.description: Reese's lover's will swoon over this delightful peanut butter and chocolate flavored White Russian. The secret to the flavor? Reese's Puff's cereal milk.
recipeIngredient: 1 Cup Half & Half or Whole Milk
Reese's Cereal Milk White Russian.name: Reese's Cereal Milk White Russian
Reese's Cereal Milk White Russian.recipeInstructions: Fill your glass with ice. . Add the Kahlua, then the vanilla vodka. . Slowly add the cereal milk. . Garnish with Reese's Cup. (optional). Enjoy!

Reversed Manhattan.description: If you want to like Bourbon drinks but often find them too "Bourbon-y", this is the drink for you. It’s also a great low alcohol alternative; there’s less alcohol, but just as much flavor.
Reversed Manhattan.name: Reversed Manhattan
Reversed Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Add vermouth, whiskey, and bitters to a mixing glass with ice. . Stir about 40 times, until the ice is half-melted. . Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

Rhubarb Mint Julep.description: Add rhubarb syrup to your Early Times mint julep and put a little spring in your step.
Rhubarb Mint Julep.name: Rhubarb Mint Julep
Rhubarb Mint Julep.recipeInstructions: Muddle the mint leaves with the rhubarb syrup in a cocktail glass. Add the crushed ice until the glass is mostly full. Add in the Early Times Bottled-In-Bond Bourbon and a splash of water. Garnish with fresh mint sprigs and strips of rhubarb
