River Boyne Fizz.description: A refreshing cocktail inspired by the mythic and winding River Boyne in Ireland.
River Boyne Fizz.name: River Boyne Fizz
River Boyne Fizz.recipeInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into an ice filled glass. Top with soda. Garnish with fresh rosemary

River Parallel.description: Different flavors run parallel in this complex, yet simple to make, cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 2 oz Old Forester 1897 Bottled in Bond
2 droppers Old Forester Smoked Cinnamon Bitters
River Parallel.name: River Parallel
River Parallel.recipeInstructions: Combine first three ingredients in mixing glass. Stir with ice . Strain into chilled rocks glass which has been rinsed with absinthe.  Garnish with a lemon peel

Rojo Rye Do.description: Balance is key in every relationship, and just as important in a good cocktail. The smooth rich flavors of a summery red sangria balance out the tang of a whiskey sour in this ‘Better Together’ combination. The perfect harmony of flavor in this cocktail is a match made in mixology heaven.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Rye Whiskey
2.5 oz Sour Mix
1 cup Malbec
.5 oz Brandy
.5 oz Orange Liqueur
2 oz Pink Grapefruit Juice
2 oz Pineapple Juice
Rojo Rye Do.name: Rojo Rye Do
Rojo Rye Do.recipeInstructions: Fill a tall collins glass with ice and begin to pour in the whiskey sour.. Leave about an inch of room at the top.. Next slowly pour red sangria to layer on top of the whiskey sour. . Do not mix. Garnish with luxardo or dried cherries.

Rojo Whiskey Sour.description: The Rojo Whiskey Sour is an enhanced whiskey sour. Sours emerged as staple cocktails during prohibition when whiskey became the (defacto?) alcohol of choice to be smuggled into major cities. The red wine helps to balance the sour and cut the flavor of alcohol and quickly became a staple metropolitan cocktail
Rojo Whiskey Sour.name: Rojo Whiskey Sour
Rojo Whiskey Sour.recipeInstructions: Mix whiskey and sour mix in a cocktail shaker with ice, shake until cold. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice then top with a floater or red wine. Serve as is

Rosarita.description: Rose? How about Rosarita? This lovely pink hue cocktail brings together the sweetness of pineapple juice with the zesty flavor of lemon juice, combined with gold tequila, this will be your new go to for Sunday brunch!
Rosarita.name: Rosarita
Rosarita.recipeInstructions:
Shake
on the rocks. Fine
strain on the rocks. Top
with club soda, optional

Rose Limonade.description: If spring were to have a flavor this would be it. The blend of bubbly rosé and fresh lemonade with a hint of floral lavender makes the Rosé Limonade the perfect cocktail for sipping on a bright spring day.
Rose Limonade.name: Rose Limonade
Rose Limonade.recipeInstructions:
Fill a tall collins glass with small ice cubes. . Next, pour in fresh lemonade
followed by the lavender simple syrup. . Once settled, fill remainder of glass
with rosé.. Garnish with fresh lemon slice.

Rosita.description: The Rosita cocktail combines basic ingredients for a drink that's big on flavor. Similar to a negroni, the campari, bitters, and vermouth enhance the smooth flavors in the reposado tequila.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Reposado Tequila
1/2 oz Sweet Vermouth
1/2 oz Dry Vermouth
1/2 oz Campari
1 dash Angostura Bitters
Rosita.name: Rosita
Rosita.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in an ice filled glass and stir for 15 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass filled with a few large ice cubes. Garnish with a lemon twist

Roy Rogers.description: This mocktail is a cousin of Shirley Temple. Combine cola soda, grenadine, cherry and you're in business. It also tastes pretty good with a little dark rum in there, but that's a whole nother thing...
Roy Rogers.name: Roy Rogers
Roy Rogers.recipeInstructions: In a highball glass combine ingredients over ice. Garnish with lemon peel and cherry

Royal Flush.description: The Royal Flush a cocktail even non-whiskey drinkers should venture a taste of. It's sweet but not too sweet and has the perfect balance of tartness from the cranberry juice.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Crown Royal
2 oz Peach Schnapps
1/2 oz Raspberry Liqueur
2 oz Cranberry Juice
Cherry for garnish
Royal Flush.name: Royal Flush
Royal Flush.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake until cold. Strain into a lowball filled with fresh ice, garnish with a cherry

Royal Old Fashioned.description: Dress up the classic Old Fashioned Recipe with Crown Royal Deluxe Whisky, simple syrup, and bitters.
Royal Old Fashioned.name: Royal Old Fashioned
Royal Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled.. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.. Garnish with an orange twist

Ruby Spritzer.description: This Patrón Ruby Spritzer cocktail makes for a wonderfully refreshing, jewel-toned drink perfect for the holiday season<del></del>
Ruby Spritzer.name: Ruby Spritzer
Ruby Spritzer.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice to chill. Strain into a champagne flute. Garnish with a lemon twist

Rum Old-Fashioned.description: Aged rum has a lot of flavor complexity, making it a worthy substitute for whiskey in one of the most classic cocktail recipes; the Old Fashioned. Look for a rum with 12 plus years of aging to ensure a mature flavor that won't disappoint.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Aged Rum
2 dashes of Angostura Bitters
1 Sugar Cube
Orange
Rum Old-Fashioned.name: Rum Old-Fashioned
Rum Old-Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Place sugar cube at the bottom of a rocks glass and add 2 dashes of bitters. Splash some rum into the glass to help muddle the sugar and bitters together. Add 2 large ice cubes and remaining rum. Stir with a bar spoon and garnish with an orange peel spritzed over the top then dropped into the drink

Rum Punch.description: Jessica shares that punch recipes like the Rum Punch should have five key elements; sour, bitter, sugar, water, and strong alcohol.  In this particular recipe she used an extra anejo rum from Venezuela. It has a rich sugar flavor with a hint of citrus, spice, and chocolate.
Rum Punch.name: Rum Punch
Rum Punch.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a punch bowl and stir to combine. Fill bowl with 2-3 scoops of cocktail ice. Float orange and lime wheels on top of the punch bowl for garnish. Serve in rocks glasses filled with ice and citrus slices

Rum Runner.description: As the story goes the Rum Runner was invented at a popular bar in the Florida Keys in the 1950s. The bartender had some extra inventory lying around and wanted to make room for new bottles on his shelves. He mixed them all together and the drink was born.
Rum Runner.name: Rum Runner
Rum Runner.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with two cups ice. Blend until smooth then serve in a hurricane glass with fruit garnish and a straw

Running Back Apple Mule.description: Go for the first down with this Crown Royal Apple mule.
Running Back Apple Mule.name: Running Back Apple Mule
Running Back Apple Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a copper mug or cocktail glass with ice . Add whiskey and apple cider. Stir to mix. Top with ginger beer and gently stir to combine. Garnish with apple slice and cinnamon stick

Rusty Nail.description: There's no danger in this drink we promise. Dating back to the 1930's the Rusty Nail is a simple old-school cocktail that became insanely popular back in the day. You don't see it around that much anymore but we've been known to enjoy it on #ThrowbackThursday.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Drambuie Scotch Liqueur
1 oz Scotch Whiskey
Rusty Nail.name: Rusty Nail
Rusty Nail.recipeInstructions: Pour both ingredients into a rocks glass with a large ice cube. Stir gently and enjoy

Rye And Ginger.description: Make the perfect cocktail simply with just 2 ingredients!
Rye And Ginger.name: Rye And Ginger
Rye And Ginger.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with crushed ice. Add rye whiskey and Schweppes Ginger Ale to the top. Enjoy!

Rye Ball.description: A simple character full of spice and sweet character.
Rye Ball.name: Rye Ball
Rye Ball.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients but soda in a cocktail shaker. Strain into highball glass with ice. Top with soda. Garnish with a lemon wheel

Rye Manhattan.description: An important staple in your bartending arsenal, the Manhattan is a classic cocktail traditionally made with Rye Whiskey.
Rye Manhattan.name: Rye Manhattan
Rye Manhattan.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass with ice, add Bulleit, vermouth, and bitters. Stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with brandied cherries

Sage Apple Old Fashioned.description: Since it can't be fall year round, might as well drink this seasonal riff on the classic old fashioned. The sage syrup and apple brandy pair nicely together to capture autumn in a rocks glass.
Sage Apple Old Fashioned.name: Sage Apple Old Fashioned
Sage Apple Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Combine apple brandy, sage syrup, and bitters into a mixing glass. . Fill with ice and stir for 15-20 seconds until chilled. . Strain into a rocks glass with one large ice cube. . Garnish with a sage leaf.

Salted Caramel Old Fashioned.description: This take on an old fashioned combines the distinct flavor of salted caramel with bourbon for the perfect fall cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 Piece of Salted Caramel Candy for garnish
Salted Caramel Old Fashioned.name: Salted Caramel Old Fashioned
Salted Caramel Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: In an Old Fashioned glass add Salted Caramel sauce, bitters and a splash of bourbon.. Stir to combine.. Place one large ice cube into glass and pour remaining bourbon over top.. Stir until the ice has begun to melt slightly and all ingredients are well combined.. Garnish with a salted caramel candy and a pinch of kosher salt.

Salty Dog.description: A delightfully floral twist on a classic cocktail, Hendrick’s Midsummer Solstice and fresh grapefruit juice pair up for your next backyard soiree or rooftop gathering!
Salty Dog.name: Salty Dog
Salty Dog.recipeInstructions: Salt the rim (optional) of a highball glass. Combine all ingredients over ice. Gently stir. Garnish with grapefruit slice

Sauza Watermelon Margarita.description: There's nothing like the taste of juicy watermelon to conjure up summertime memories of fun in the sun. Smooth Sauza Tequila meets sweet watermelon and a splash of fresh lime juice to create a tantalizing margarita that's cool and refreshing.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Sauza Silver Tequila
1 part Homemade Watermelon Juice
1/2 part Lime Juice
1/2 part Simple Syrup
1/2 part Triple Sec
Sauza Watermelon Margarita.name: Sauza Watermelon Margarita
Sauza Watermelon Margarita.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and puree until smooth. Serve in a salt-rimmed glass. Garnish with a lime or watermelon wedge

Sazerac.description: Originated in New Orleans, the Sazerac is known as the official drink of Louisiana. Typically served straight up, drinking this will transport you straight to NOLA.
Sazerac.name: Sazerac
Sazerac.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass place the sugar cube at the bottom, add bitters and splash of whiskey; muddle until mixed. Add the remaining whiskey and ice then stir. In a separate, chilled old-fashioned glass, add Absinthe and turn glass to coat the inside, pour out any excess. Strain stirred cocktail into the old-fashioned glass and garnish with lemon peel

Schweppes Moscow Mule.description: Make a fresh moscow mule that is sure to please the masses!
Schweppes Moscow Mule.name: Schweppes Moscow Mule
Schweppes Moscow Mule.recipeInstructions: Squeeze lime juice into a collins glass, and drop the squeezed lime into the glass. Add 2-3 ice cubes. Pour in vodka. Fill with Schweppes Ginger Ale. Serve with a stirring rod

Scooby Snack Shot.description: We're gonna be honest, we have no idea where this drink got its name. But it does have a creamy tropical flavor that's just fine with us.
Scooby Snack Shot.name: Scooby Snack Shot
Scooby Snack Shot.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously to mix thoroughly then strain into a shot glass

Seelbach.description: Originally crafted in 1917 and named after the famous Louisville hotel, this Cointreau classic was just recently rediscovered. Dark, bitter, and bubbly, this cocktail requires your full attention.
recipeIngredient:
1/2 oz
  Cointreau
1 oz Bourbon Whiskey
7 dashes Angostura Bitters

7 dashes
  Peychaud's Bitters
5 oz Champagne
Seelbach.name: Seelbach
Seelbach.recipeInstructions:
Combine
  everything but Champagne in a mixing glass with ice. Stir and strain into a
  chilled Coupee and top with Champagne. Garnish with an orange twist

Separatist Gimlet.description: Delightfully refreshing, this perfect and simple combination of citrus and Hendrick's works to create a sublime symphony of flavor.
Separatist Gimlet.name: Separatist Gimlet
Separatist Gimlet.recipeInstructions: Rinse glass with absinthe and discard contents. Combine other ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice and stir. Strain into a new glass

Serrano Margarita.description: The Serrano Margarita is a kicked-up version of our classic favorite. Serrano peppers add heat that pairs oh so well with the cool, fresh lime juice. A sugared rim on this cocktail helps cut the spice.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 oz Cointreau or Triple Sec Liqueur
Serrano Margarita.name: Serrano Margarita
Serrano Margarita.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila, agave nectar and serrano pepper and muddle to release the heat of the pepper. Prepare a glass by rubbing lime on the rim and dipping into a plate of sugar. Fill rimmed glass with ice. Shake cocktail to mix thoroughly, then pour through strainer into glass, over ice

Sex on the Beach.description: A classic drink to have in your cocktail arsenal. Created during, where else, spring break in Florida. This concoction was the winning original drink in a contest between local bartenders. And don't let the risque name fool you, this one's nothing but sweet.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Creme de Cassis
1/2 oz Peach Schnapps Liqueur
1/2 oz Orange Juice
1/2 oz Cranberry Juice
Sex on the Beach.name: Sex on the Beach
Sex on the Beach.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice then shake 5-10 seconds. Strain into a hurricane or highball glass with fresh ice. Garnish with fruit and enjoy

Shackleton On The Rocks.description: Keep it simple with this scotch classic!
Shackleton On The Rocks.name: Shackleton On The Rocks
Shackleton On The Rocks.recipeInstructions: Pour Shackleton whisky over one large ice cube. Stir softly for 5 seconds. Serve

Shamrock Shake Smash.description: This festive take on an ice cream float combines the classic smooth flavor of Guinness Stout with the funky (but familiar) McDonald's Shamrock Shake. It's like your very own pot of gold, no rainbow required.
recipeIngredient: 1 Bottle or Can of Guinness Beer
2-3 Scoops of McDonald's Shamrock Shake Frozen
Shamrock Shake Smash.name: Shamrock Shake Smash
Shamrock Shake Smash.recipeInstructions: Place your shake in the freezer to harden for about 30 minutes.. In a pint glass, pour a fresh Guinness 3/4 of the way to the lip of the glass.. Take your shake out of the freezer and use an ice cream scoop or large spoon to scoop 2 scoops into your beer.. Enjoy.

Shandy.description: A popular beer cocktail in Western Europe, a Shandy is half beer and half juice or fruity soda. You can adjust the amounts to your liking. Fresh squeezed citrus and hefeweizen; a match made in shandy heaven.
Shandy.name: Shandy
Shandy.recipeInstructions: Combine beer and lemonade in a pint glass. Garnish with fresh lemon wheel

Shark Attack Shots.description: No need to clear the beach for these sharks. The bite of coconut tequila combines with sugary sweet shark gummies in these tropical Jell-O shots. The only thing dangerous about these tasty treats is how easy they go down. Enjoy responsibly!
Shark Attack Shots.name: Shark Attack Shots
Shark Attack Shots.recipeInstructions: Prepare gelatin according to package. . Mix all remaining wet ingredients and pour into a pyrex dish, lined with plastic wrap to set. . Half way through setting place gummy shark candies about 1-2 inches apart across the top of the gelatin.. Return to the fridge to set the rest of the way. . When ready to serve, slice into squares around each of the sharks.. Place red life saver candies on top for decoration.

Shark Bite.description: This take on the classic Snake Bite beer cocktail combines two summertime favorites; a light beachy lager and dry sparkling cider. Typically half and half, you can play with the ratio until you get a flavor you like best. Remember to use ice cold ingredients straight from the cooler. Fins up friends!
recipeIngredient:
8 oz LandShark lager
8 oz Dry Cider
Shark Bite.name: Shark Bite

Sidecar.description: The first iconic Sidecar, made with Cointreau, traces its heritage back to 1920s London. A perfect balance between Cointreau, Cognac, and lemon, the Sidecar is a classic that has endured generation after generation. The final touch of a sugared rim provides a perfect balance of sweet and sour.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Cointreau
1 oz Remy Martin VSOP Cognac
1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice
Sidecar.name: Sidecar
Sidecar.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass. Wet rim with lemon and press into sugar. Shake vigorously with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

Silver Sling.description: Toss this holiday cocktail into the mix to enjoy savory flavors with a hint of sparkle.
Silver Sling.name: Silver Sling
Silver Sling.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass, add all ingredients except sparkling wine. Shake well and strain into a champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine. Garnish with orange peel

Simple Sour.description: A colorful, sour focused cocktail to pair perfectly with any Summer event.
Simple Sour.name: Simple Sour
Simple Sour.recipeInstructions: Add vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a pitcher. Add ice and mix until cold. Pour into glasses. Add the wine float and garnish

Singapore Sling.description: Hailing from Singapore, as the name suggests, this tropical drink is the perfect match for oppressively hot summer days. A sling is one of the earliest known terms for a cocktail.
recipeIngredient:
3/4 oz Gin
1/4 oz Grand Marnier
1/4 oz Luxardo Maraschino Cherry Liqueur
1/4 oz Herbal Liqueur
1 oz Pineapple Juice
1/2 oz Lime Juice
1 dash Bitters
Club Soda
Singapore Sling.name: Singapore Sling
Singapore Sling.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice, except the club soda. Shake until cold and pour into a highball over fresh ice. Fill with club soda. Garnish with fresh orange slice

Single Barrel Old Fashioned.description: A cocktail classic elevated to the top shelf.
Single Barrel Old Fashioned.name: Single Barrel Old Fashioned
Single Barrel Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients in a rocks glass. Muddle. Add ice . Stir. Garnish with an orange slice

Single Barrel Rye Boulevardier.description: A dry cocktail for a discerning palate.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Jack Daniel’s Single Barrel Rye
Single Barrel Rye Boulevardier.name: Single Barrel Rye Boulevardier
Single Barrel Rye Boulevardier.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass filled with ice, add the Campari, sweet vermouth and Jack Daniels Single Barrel Rye. Stir to combine. Add the orange peel

Skinny Margarita.description: Enjoy your margarita guilt free. This skinny margarita is less than 200 calories and includes all the fresh flavors you would find in a classic margarita.
Skinny Margarita.name: Skinny Margarita
Skinny Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice shake until cold. Pour mixture and ice into a salt rimmed glass and garnish with a fresh lime wedge

Slane Irish Coffee.description: A new take on the classic Irish Coffee.
Slane Irish Coffee.name: Slane Irish Coffee
Slane Irish Coffee.recipeInstructions: Preheat a 6 oz. Irish Coffee glass. Prepare double shot esspresso. Add boiling water to halfway point. Empty water from coffee glass. Add syrup and double espresso. Add whiskey. Stir to combine. Top with cream float. Garnish with orange dark chocolate shavings

recipeIngredient: 5 oz Lager (Guinness Blonde American Lager is recommended)
Smirnoff Ice Shandy.name: Smirnoff Ice Shandy
Smirnoff Ice Shandy.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a pint glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel

Smirnoff Original Moscow Mule.description: The owner of Smirnoff Vodka, a stranger with a crate of copper mugs, and a bartender walk into a bar and…..OK, the bartender and copper mugs were already there, but what Smirnoff owner John Martin helped concoct that day in 1941 was the taste of legends.  By mixing the over-stocked inventory of ginger beer with Smirnoff vodka over ice, the Original Moscow Mule was invented and poured into the iconic copper mug.  History was served.  With so punchline necessary.
Smirnoff Original Moscow Mule.name: Smirnoff Original Moscow Mule
Smirnoff Original Moscow Mule.recipeInstructions: Mix Smirnoff and ginger beer in a copper mug over ice. Add a squeeze of lime. Garnish with a lime wedge

Smoky Vanilla Mai Tai.description: This cocktail takes the classic combination of citrus rum from a Mai Tai and layers on smoky Mezcal with smooth, bitter vanilla.
Smoky Vanilla Mai Tai.name: Smoky Vanilla Mai Tai

Snow Day Sling.description: At first glance this drink may not seem like a snow day sipper but trust us it is. The Irish whiskey flavor and clove aroma combine with fresh fruit juices to deliver a cocktail that will cure even the worst case of winter blues and frozen fingers.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Jameson Whiskey
1/2 oz Mulled Wine
1/2 oz Domaine de Canton Ginger Liqueur
1 oz Pineapple Juice
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
1/2 Simple Syrup
Pineapple and clove to garnish
Snow Day Sling.name: Snow Day Sling
Snow Day Sling.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice, shake until shaker base is frosty and cold. . Strain into a collins glass over fresh ice and garnish with a fresh piece of pineapple and cloves.

So Gin Love.description: This bubbly marriage of floral elderberry liqueur, dry champagne, gin and tangy citrus bring a whole new meaning to love at first sight. The slightly rosy hue of the pink lemon makes this cocktail perfect for any blushing bride to sip on her big day.
recipeIngredient:
1.5 oz Elderflower Liqueur
5 oz Brut Champagne
2 oz Gin
1 Pink Lemon Juiced
.5 oz Simple Syrup
Splash of Club Soda
So Gin Love.name: So Gin Love
So Gin Love.recipeInstructions: In a stemmed champagne flute gently pour equal parts of both drinks. . Stir gently with a bar spoon, then allow to settle . Garnish with sage and a lemon twist.

Sobieski Cranberry.description: No time to prepare a Cosmopolitan? Mix Sobieski with cranberry, it will do the job!
Sobieski Cranberry.name: Sobieski Cranberry
Sobieski Cranberry.recipeInstructions: Fill you glass with ice cubes. Add all ingredients. Garnish (or not) with lime

Sobieski Orange.description: An essential drink that everyone loves and one of the best brunch drinks. Why complicate matters?
Sobieski Orange.name: Sobieski Orange
Sobieski Orange.recipeInstructions: Fill you glass with ice cubes. Add all ingredients. Garnish (or not) with an orange wedge

Sobieski Tonic.description: Back to basics. Keep it simple with this drink good for any occasion
Sobieski Tonic.name: Sobieski Tonic
Sobieski Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill your glass with ice cubes. Add all ingredients. Garnish (or not) with lime

Social Rosemary Paloma.description: Try this citrus-forward Kim Crawford paloma!
Social Rosemary Paloma.name: Social Rosemary Paloma
Social Rosemary Paloma.recipeInstructions: Mix Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanc with soda water and grapefruit juice. Combine rosemary syrup and wine mixture. Garnish with rosemary sprig

Sorbellini.description: Want to impress your friends at your next brunch get-together? Try serving a few options of fresh sorbet alongside the prosecco for a make-your-own bellini bar. You'll look like a total all star.
Sorbellini.name: Sorbellini
Sorbellini.recipeInstructions: In a champagne flute, add a teaspoon scoop of sorbet and top with sparkling wine

Sorbet Mimosa.description: This cocktail is the perfect combo of dessert paired with your favorite rosé!
Sorbet Mimosa.name: Sorbet Mimosa
Sorbet Mimosa.recipeInstructions: In a small saucepan bring the sugar and water to a boil. Simmer 5 minutes until dissolved. Cool and mix in the Kim Crawford Rosé. Freeze in a loaf pan, breaking up occasionally till frozen solid. Process in batches in a food processor till smooth then freeze again until firm. Scoop into coupe glasses and pour over Prosecco. Garnish with rosemary and serve immediately

Sour Patch Kids Vodka Martini.description: Sour Patch Kids inspire this tangy-sweet vodka martini with a bright-blue color and sugar rim that’s perfect for a fun Halloween drink.
Sour Patch Kids Vodka Martini.name: Sour Patch Kids Vodka Martini
Sour Patch Kids Vodka Martini.recipeInstructions: Rub the rim of a martini glass with lemon juice and dip in a shallow bowl of sparkling sugar.. Combine both vodkas, blue curaçao, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into prepared glass.. If desired, drop in a few Sour Patch Kids candies to garnish.

Sparkle Spumante.description: Ring in the new year with this bubbly and bright cocktail.
Sparkle Spumante.name: Sparkle Spumante
Sparkle Spumante.recipeInstructions: Chill all ingredients before assembling. Add peach schnapps, syrup and juice to a flute. Top with Barefoot Bubbly Moscato Spumante. Garnish with floated frozen raspberries

Sparkling Apple Kicker.description: Hit the extra point with this sparkling cocktail spiked with Crown Royal Apple.
Sparkling Apple Kicker.name: Sparkling Apple Kicker
Sparkling Apple Kicker.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add in whisky. Top with soda. Garnish with a lime wedge

recipeIngredient: 2 Apples, cored and sliced into match sticks
1/2 cup Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select
Sparkling Apple Sangria.name: Sparkling Apple Sangria
Sparkling Apple Sangria.recipeInstructions: Add the apples to a large pitcher, reserving about 1/2 cup for garnishing. Add the whiskey, apple cider, and chilled sparking wine. Stir. Fill the pitcher with ice. Pour the sangria into glasses filled with ice and top with sliced apple and pomegranate seeds

Sparkling Boulevardier.description: This classic cocktail gets dressed up for the holidays with some bubbles and a fragrant garnish. If you're looking to stick closer to tradition, skip the rosemary and add a Luxardo cherry.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Dry Sparkling Wine
1 oz Rye Whiskey
1 oz Campari
1 oz Sweet Vermouth
Fresh Rosemary Garnish
Sparkling Boulevardier.name: Sparkling Boulevardier
Sparkling Boulevardier.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass with ice, add rye whiskey, Campari, and sweet vermouth and stir with a bar spoon until chilled. Strain into a classic cocktail glass and top with sparkling wine. Garnish with rosemary

Sparkling Lemonade.description: Add some sparkle to your favorite summer drink.
Sparkling Lemonade.name: Sparkling Lemonade
Sparkling Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in lemonade. Top with Korbel. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Sparkling Peach.description: Make brunch shine with the Sparkling Peach cocktail and see your friends' faces brighten!
Sparkling Peach.name: Sparkling Peach
Sparkling Peach.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker expect La Marca. Shake and strain into a martini glass while simultaneously pouring in the La Marca. Garnish with a twist of lemon

Sparkling Resolution.description: Ring in the new year with good friends and good sips.
Sparkling Resolution.name: Sparkling Resolution
Sparkling Resolution.recipeInstructions: Pour Woodford Reserve and blueberry juice into a shaker with ice . Shake and strain into a champagne flute. Top with Korbel. Garnish with frozen blueberries

Sparkling Strawberry Julep.description: A fruit forward cocktail with a dry edge.
recipeIngredient: 8 Large, Ripe Strawberries, washed, hulled and cut into 1/4–inch pieces, plus extra slices for garnish
12 Fresh Mint Leaves, plus a sprig for garnish
8 oz Jack Daniel's Single Barrel "Barrel Proof"
1-inch Strawberry & Mint or Mint Ice Cubes
Sparkling Strawberry Julep.name: Sparkling Strawberry Julep
Sparkling Strawberry Julep.recipeInstructions: Muddle strawberries and mint and pour in pitcher. Stir together with honey, Barrel Proof and lemon juice. Pour into glass filled with ice (special ice cubes). Top with a splash of club soda. Garnish each glass with a strawberry slice and a sprig of mint

Sparkling Summer Lemonade.description: Spike one of summer's favorite drinks and add elderflower for a sparkling lemonade cocktail that is sure to please. This drink is light, refreshing and best served cold in a wine glass.
Sparkling Summer Lemonade.name: Sparkling Summer Lemonade
Sparkling Summer Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Add lemonade and elderflower liqueur to a wine glass.. Top with sparkling wine. Garnish with sliced lemon.

Spiced Caramel Apple Hot Toddy.description: This spiced caramel apple hot toddy is the perfect fall drink combining warm spices with sweet caramel and apples to create the ultimate cocktail for all season long.  With a little bourbon kick, this drink is sure to keep your blood warm and the ghosts and goblins away!
recipeIngredient: 1/8 Cup Fresh Orange Juice + 1 whole Orange Slice
Spiced Caramel Apple Hot Toddy.name: Spiced Caramel Apple Hot Toddy
Spiced Caramel Apple Hot Toddy.recipeInstructions: In a small saucepan combine apple cider, orange juice, 4 caramel candies, cinnamon stick, start anise, orange slice, and whole cloves, and simmer for 15 minutes until fragrant and caramels have melted stirring occasionally.. In two heat safe glasses, add 1 1/2 oz. of bourbon each.. Take the remaining caramels and add a splash of water to a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 30 seconds to 1 minutes until caramels are melted and smooth. (Alternatively you can melt on the stove.). Strain the warmed spiced caramel apple cider into each glass equally, stir with the bourbon, and garnish with an apple slice and drizzle the melted caramels over the rim of each glass.. Serve immediately.

Spiced White Russian.description:
