<!--StartFragment-->Spiced White Russians add some warm spices to
the mix to switch it up on cozy Friday
nights at home and remember why staying in is sometimes better than going out.
recipeIngredient:
2 parts Absolut Vodka
1 part Kahlua
1 part Infused Heavy Cream
Spiced White Russian.name: Spiced White Russian
Spiced White Russian.recipeInstructions: Place a large ice cube in each glass and pour in vodka and Kahlua. Gently pour in heavy cream mixture and garnish with a cinnamon stick

Spicy Cucumber & 7UP Vodka Spritzer.description: Here's the best part about this jalapeño margarita cocktail: it's pretty dang simple to throw together!<u></u>
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 inch wide slice of Cucumber, thinly sliced
1/2 inch wide slice of Jalapeño, thinly sliced
Spicy Cucumber & 7UP Vodka Spritzer.name: Spicy Cucumber & 7UP Vodka Spritzer
Spicy Cucumber & 7UP Vodka Spritzer.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle together the cucumber, jalapeño, and lime juice. Add vodka and ice and shake well. Strain into a glass. Add 7UP, top with ice, and stir. Garnish with a lime wedge and serve

Spicy Margarita.description: Bring a little heat to an iconic classic by adding jalapeno and cilantro to your Margarita. Your tastebuds may walk on fire, until the subtle sweetness of Cointreau washes over the flame.
Spicy Margarita.name: Spicy Margarita
Spicy Margarita.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain over ice into a chili salt rimmed rocks glass. Garnish with cilantro and jalapeno spiral

Spicy Paloma.description: Infusing alcohol on your own is easy and opens up endless opportunities for creating new flavors. One of the most simple and classic infusions uses jalapenos. A spicy tequila is quite versatile when it comes to mixology. Try adding some smoked paprika to the salt before rimming the glass to take this drink to the next level.
Spicy Paloma.name: Spicy Paloma
Spicy Paloma.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine tequila, grapefruit juice and lime juice. Shake until cold, then strain into a salt-rimmed collins glass and garnish with a lime wheel and jalapeno slices

Spiked Lemonade.description: This 1+1 drink makes for an easy, top shelf summer. Find yourself a rooftop with a view, add your friends and serve by the pitcher. With the perfect balance of fresh French fruit, lemon and cognac, no one can resist its taste.
Spiked Lemonade.name: Spiked Lemonade
Spiked Lemonade.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in Grand Marnier and lemonade. Garnish with a lemon wheel

Spring Fling Fizz.description: Combine a few of your favorite things for this perfectly sweet and tart spring cocktail.  A splash of bubbles and a fresh fruit garnish gives it that extra touch that will be your new easy to make refreshment for the warmer weather.
Spring Fling Fizz.name: Spring Fling Fizz
Spring Fling Fizz.recipeInstructions: Fill a wine glass with crushed ice. Place lemon juice, simple syrup and vodka into a cocktail shaker, shake to combine.. Pour mixed ingredients over your crushed ice. Follow with raspberry liqueur. Top with dry sparkling wine. Garnish with fresh berries. Enjoy

Spring Sangria Slush.description: Tiki drinks are making a big comeback, but gone are the sugary syrups-this time it's all about fresh flavors and unexpected hints of spice. The balance of tart pineapple, sweet Grenache, and slight hint of nutmeg will transport you to an island paradise in no time.
recipeIngredient: Half of a 750ml Bottle of Grenache Wine
Spring Sangria Slush.name: Spring Sangria Slush
Spring Sangria Slush.recipeInstructions: Combine the wine, fresh lemon juice, nutmeg and half of your pineapple juice in a quart freezer bag and zip close. . Squeeze bag gently for a few seconds to thoroughly combine contents, and then lay flat inside of freezer overnight (or 8 hours) until frozen. . Once frozen remove bag from freezer, and use your hands to break up the contents inside the bag until they resemble a slush.. Use a large spoon to scoop out the mixture into red wine glasses, fill 3/4 of the way with your wine mixture. . Next, combine remaining pineapple juice, vodka, and the frozen fruit chunks in a cocktail shaker and shake to mix. . Pour the juice, fruit and vodka mixture over the frozen wine into your glasses. . Garnish with additional frozen fruit and serve with a straw.

Spring Time Mind Eraser.description: The Spring Time Mind Eraser is my own personal spin on the traditional Kahlua cocktail. The combination of fizz, lime, and elderflower liqueur make this one of my all time favorite drinks.
recipeIngredient:
2 parts Absolut Vodka
2 parts Kahlua
2 parts Club Soda
Splash of Elderflower Liqueur
Spring Time Mind Eraser.name: Spring Time Mind Eraser
Spring Time Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Fill your glass with ice. Pour in Absolut Vodka and Kahlua. Top with Club Soda. Add a floater of elderflower liqueur. Stir ingredients with a bar spoon. Serve with a straw, cheers!

Spritz & Giggles.description: Fresh, fruity, and almost too easy to be called a cocktail. Cheers
Spritz & Giggles.name: Spritz & Giggles
Spritz & Giggles.recipeInstructions: Build all ingredients in a glass over ice. Garnish with an orange wedge and raspberries

Squat Goals Sangria.description: Heart-healthy pomegranate and açaí berry juices combine for a twist on sangria you can enjoy with your box buddies after a sweaty workout. Red wine is almost as good for your body as all those burpees and squats.
recipeIngredient: 1 Bottle Red Wine (Syrah or Malbec work nicely)
Squat Goals Sangria.name: Squat Goals Sangria
Squat Goals Sangria.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a pitcher and stir well to combine. . Refrigerate for at least 4-6 hours. . Serve over ice and garnish with apple, orange, blackberries and pomegranate seeds.

St-Germain Martini.description: Your girlfriend will love this one, and to be honest, so will you. A genuine, strong cocktail that tastes light and sweet, with the aroma and flavor of flowers. With just two ingredients, this sweet and sophisticated drink is a cinch.
St-Germain Martini.name: St-Germain Martini
St-Germain Martini.recipeInstructions: Add vodka and St-Germain to a mixing glass with ice. Stir about 40 times until the ice has half melted. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with lemon twist, and serve

St-Rita.description: A Margarita with St-Germain makes it an even more refreshing and delicious variation of this world-favorite tequila cocktail.
St-Rita.name: St-Rita
St-Rita.recipeInstructions: Run a lime wedge around the rim of a rocks glass and dip the rim of the glass in a shallow dish of salt (optional) . Fill the rocks glass with ice. Add in the ingredients. Garnish with a lime wedge

Statesman Old Fashioned.description: We're letting you in on a secret: the recipe for an old fashioned made officially for the Statesman.
Statesman Old Fashioned.name: Statesman Old Fashioned
Statesman Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients into a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir well . Strain into a double old fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a wide lemon peel with oils expressed over the cocktail

Statesman Shandy.description: Try this elevated take on a classic shandy.
Statesman Shandy.name: Statesman Shandy
Statesman Shandy.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in Collins glass.  Add ice. Stir. Serve with a straw . Garnish with a lemon peel

Statesman Tea Sling.description: A little English tea and some Kentucky bourbon make a fine team in the Statesman Tea Sling.
Statesman Tea Sling.name: Statesman Tea Sling
Statesman Tea Sling.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Empty entire contents into a Collins glass . Garnish with a lemon peel

Straw-ber-Rita Mojito.description: A cocktail that's both refreshing and bursting with flavor, the Straw-Ber-Rita Mojito is a great way to spring into warmer weather. #HAVEARITA
Straw-ber-Rita Mojito.name: Straw-ber-Rita Mojito
Straw-ber-Rita Mojito.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a highball glass or mason jar. Mix. Garnish with strawberries and spearmint. Enjoy!

Strawberry Basil Fizz.description: Capture the flavors of warmer weather with this fruity fizz. Fresh fruit muddled with garden fresh basil makes for a deliciously refreshing sipper. We love the Strawberry Basil Fizz, great for parties and outdoor entertaining.
recipeIngredient:
7 oz Ginger Beer
1.5 oz Vodka
3 Medium Strawberries
5 Basil Leaves
1 tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
Strawberry Basil Fizz.name: Strawberry Basil Fizz
Strawberry Basil Fizz.recipeInstructions: In a lowball glass, muddle strawberries and basil. Add ice, vodka and lemon juice and stir. Top with ginger beer

Strawberry Fros\u00e9.description: A fruity take on an already fun frozen drink perfect for summer.
recipeIngredient:
3
Dark Horse Rosé Wine Ice Cubes
Strawberry Fros\u00e9.name: Strawberry Frosé
Strawberry Fros\u00e9.recipeInstructions:
Combine ingredients except ice in
blender. Fill serving glass half full with
ice and pour into blender. Blend until smooth. Pour blended beverage into serving glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge or sliced strawberries

Strawberry Julep.description: Try this fan favorite bourbon cocktail with the freshest ingredients!
Strawberry Julep.name: Strawberry Julep
Strawberry Julep.recipeInstructions:
Muddle
strawberries, mint leaves, and simple syrup in mixing glass. Add
Maker's Mark® Bourbon Whisky and lemon juice. Fill with ice. Shake
well. Double strain into a rocks glass

Strawberry Tequila Sour.description: This cocktail is a great alternative to a traditional margarita and a great way to broaden your horizons with tequila. Using strawberries and tequila, this drink is a fun fiesta version of the classic gin sour.
Strawberry Tequila Sour.name: Strawberry Tequila Sour
Strawberry Tequila Sour.recipeInstructions: In a shaker add tequila, strawberries, agave nectar, lemon juice and egg white. Shake mixture for 20 seconds then add ice and shake again. Strain mixture into serving glass.. Garnish with Strawberry

Strawberry Whiskey Collins.description: If you are in the mood for something that tastes like warmer weather, sunshine, and being outside, then this Strawberry Whiskey Collins is for you! Even if you aren’t typically a whiskey drinker, this cocktail is definitely worth a try.
Strawberry Whiskey Collins.name: Strawberry Whiskey Collins
Strawberry Whiskey Collins.recipeInstructions: In a blender or food processor, grab a handful of strawberries (fresh or frozen) and blend until pureed.. Combine lemon juice, dash of simple syrup, whiskey, & ice, and shake until cold.. Pour a quarter inch of puree into the bottom of a rocks glass, add in the whiskey mixture, & top off with soda water.. Serve, sip, repeat!

Strawberry, Cucumber & Lime Infused Gin.description:
Fresh and tart, this infusion tastes like summertime in a jar. Sweet strawberries, cooling cucumber and tangy lime create a balanced infusion, perfect for anything from a gin & tonic to a seasonal twist on a Gin Fizz.


Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
Strawberry, Cucumber & Lime Infused Gin.name: Strawberry, Cucumber & Lime Infused Gin
Strawberry, Cucumber & Lime Infused Gin.recipeInstructions: Place sliced strawberries, lime rind and cucumber wheels into the bottom of a 1.5 Pint Mason Jar. . Fill the rest of the jar with a gin of your choice (we used Hendrick's) and seal with lid. . Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 3 days, shaking occasionally. . After 3 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused gin into a sealed jar.. Infusion will keep for several weeks refrigerated.

Strongbow Artisanal Blend Maple Mimosa.description: A delicious take on the traditional mimosa mixing unfiltered apple cider and rich maple flavor.
Strongbow Artisanal Blend Maple Mimosa.name: Strongbow Artisanal Blend Maple Mimosa
Strongbow Artisanal Blend Maple Mimosa.recipeInstructions: Fill a champagne flute with the unfiltered apple cider, dark maple syrup, and lemon juice . Top with Strongbow Artisanal Cider and 3 dashes of Angostura bitters. Garnish with a thin apple slice

Strongbow Artisanal Blend Mojito.description: The semi-sweet taste of Strongbow Artisanal blend and basil leaves balance the traditional sweetness of mojitos for the perfect party cocktail.
recipeIngredient:
3
oz Strongbow Artisanal blend, or to top

Lime
sugar for rim of glass
Strongbow Artisanal Blend Mojito.name: Strongbow Artisanal Blend Mojito
Strongbow Artisanal Blend Mojito.recipeInstructions:
Dip
the top of the glass in water and cover with lime/sugar mixture. In
a cocktail shaker, muddle mint, basil, sugar, and lime juice. Add ice
and rum, shake well. Strain into ice filled glass and top with Strongbow
Artisanal Blend. Garnish with mint sprig

Strongbow Cherry Blossom Sangria.description: You'll love this Strongbow spin on a Rosé-berry sangria featuring Strongbow Cherry blossom hard cider.
Strongbow Cherry Blossom Sangria.name: Strongbow Cherry Blossom Sangria
Strongbow Cherry Blossom Sangria.recipeInstructions:
In the bottom of a pitcher, roughly muddle the strawberries with the sugar and lemon juice. Add in the Strongbow Cherry Blossom, Rosé, and grape juice. Stir together. Add the fruit
and mint and then fill with ice to chill. Garnish with a sprig of

lemon verbena and extra berries

Strongbow Gold Apple Sweater.description: The Strongbow Gold Apple sweetness blends perfectly with the bright and fragrant flavors of Elderflower and nutmeg to excite your tastebuds.
Strongbow Gold Apple Sweater.name: Strongbow Gold Apple Sweater
Strongbow Gold Apple Sweater.recipeInstructions: Stir brandy, elderflower liqueur, and bitters in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a coupe glass. Top with Strongbow Gold Apple. Grate nutmeg on top and use a lighter to torch the tips of the rosemary sprig. Place in coupe glass as a garnish, serve smoldering

Stylish White Russian.description: The Stylish White Russian is a modern twist on the classic cocktail that has always been loved. Sweet, boozy and now with less calories, this skinny drink will leave you guilt free and of course asking for seconds.
Stylish White Russian.name: Stylish White Russian
Stylish White Russian.recipeInstructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour Kahlua into the glass. Add a splash of Diet Coke. Pour vodka into the glass. Add almond milk. Sprinkle a little cinnamon on the milk and garnish with Luxardo maraschino cherry

Summer Cherry Punch.description: George Washington was quite fond of cherries, so it seems appropriate to celebrate Independence Day with a seasonal cherry punch. This recipe uses brandy which was a popular beverage in Colonial times and Merlot which adds depth to the cherry flavor.
recipeIngredient: 9 oz Merlot (I used Chateau St Michelle 2014 Merlot)
Summer Cherry Punch.name: Summer Cherry Punch
Summer Cherry Punch.recipeInstructions: Wash and stem cherries. . Place cherries, lemon juice and sugar in the bottom of a large pitcher or jar that holds at least 10 cups of liquid. . Muddle cherries with a wooden spoon until they are finely mashed. . Add in brandy, merlot and bitters and stir. . Refrigerate at least 4 hours, or even better, overnight. . Strain mixture through a fine mesh sieve. . Return to the refrigerator until ready to serve. . Garnish a 10oz glass with a fruit skewer. . Serve straight up with a generous splash of sparking water.

Sunrise.description: The vibrant and fruity colors paired with Hornitos Reposado Tequila is the perfect way to start the day cheering for your favorite team!
Sunrise.name: Sunrise
Sunrise.recipeInstructions:
Combine
all ingredients in a mixing glass. Add ice. Shake and strain into a chilled
cocktail glass. Garnish
with an orange twist

Sunset Sangria.description: Give your senses a push in the hammock with this juicy Sunset Sangria!
Sunset Sangria.name: Sunset Sangria
Sunset Sangria.recipeInstructions: Place wine, juices, lemonade and vodka in a large pitcher with sliced oranges and lemons. Cover and chill for 4 to 6 hours. Add 8 ounces club soda or lemon lime soda if desired before serving. Serve over ice with an orange and lemon slice in the glass

Sweet Corn and Strawberry Smash.description: Sweet corn lends a delicate, earthy and unexpected flavor to your drinks. And when juicy strawberries are in season they make for the perfect sidekick to sweet corn in this refreshing rum smash cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 2-3 drops Bitter Tears “Scarlet" strawberry chili bitters*
Sweet Corn and Strawberry Smash.name: Sweet Corn and Strawberry Smash
Sweet Corn and Strawberry Smash.recipeInstructions: In the bottom of a mixing glass, muddle together strawberry slices, lime juice and simple syrup.. Add corn kernels and muddle until broken up (some kernels will remain whole).. Add rum and bitters.. Fill glass with ice and shake hard for about 30 seconds.. Double strain into a rocks glass, fill glass with crushed ice, and add strawberry garnish.

Tabernacle Crush.description: This light and refreshing cocktail is as reminiscent of the American South as it is of the South of France.
recipeIngredient: 6-8 smaller basil leaves, plus more for garnish
1 1/2 ounces gin (Old Tom if you've got it)
Tabernacle Crush.name: Tabernacle Crush
Tabernacle Crush.recipeInstructions: In a tall glass, muddle the peach with the basil leaves (reserve some to garnish) and the lemon juice. Add the gin, Lillet and simple syrup. Add ice cubes and top with club soda. Garnish with basil

Tanqueray & Tonic.description: Try this Tanqueray infused classic with a touch of citrus.
Tanqueray & Tonic.name: Tanqueray & Tonic
Tanqueray & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Muddle lime wedges in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add Tanqueray. Fill with crushed ice and top with tonic water. Shake and strain into a highball glass. Garnish with a lime slice

Team Captain.description: Gather ‘round and take a knee–this cocktail is made by the Captain but perfect for the team.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
Team Captain.name: Team Captain
Team Captain.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in an ice filled glass. Stir to combine. Garnish with a lime wedge

Tennessee Mule.description: The fiery spice of ginger with the smoothness of Jack.
Tennessee Mule.name: Tennessee Mule
Tennessee Mule.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass 3/4 of the way with cubed ice. Pour in Old No. 7 . Add ginger beer and a squeeze of lime. Stir. Add lime wedge to garnish

Tequila Manhattan.description: Dark, bold and mysterious, this black Manhattan cocktail recipe is a delicious variant of the classic version. Sweet vermouth comes together with whiskey-barrel aged anejo tequila for an uncompromising taste.
Tequila Manhattan.name: Tequila Manhattan
Tequila Manhattan.recipeInstructions:
Stir
all ingredients with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish
with a flamed lemon peel

Tequila Old Fashioned.description: A remix on the old classic, this whiskey-barrel aged tequila old fashioned is potently delicious and bold, adding a modern allure to any occasion. Perfect for kicking back after work.
recipeIngredient:
1
½ parts Hornitos® Black Barrel® Tequila
Tequila Old Fashioned.name: Tequila Old Fashioned
Tequila Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions:
Combine
simple syrup, Hornitos® Black Barrel™ Tequila, amaro, and bitters. Add
ice and stir. Strain
over fresh ice and garnish with an orange peel

Tequila Sunrise.description: A prohibition-era cocktail invented in Tijuana, Mexico, this fruity cocktail is just as delicious at sunset, we promise.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Blanco Tequila
4 oz Orange Juice
1 teaspoon Grenadine
Fresh Orange Slice
Tequila Sunrise.name: Tequila Sunrise
Tequila Sunrise.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass with ice add tequila then orange juice. Float the grenadine on top and garnish with fresh orange

The 13th Floor.description: Turn your luck around with this citrus forward cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Ketel One Oranje Flavored Vodka
0.25 oz Bulleit Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
The 13th Floor.name: The 13th Floor
The 13th Floor.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into an ice filled rocks glass. Garnish with orange slices

The Artist.description: Impress your friends with this artistic cocktail.
The Artist.name: The Artist
The Artist.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist

The Black Rose.description: This is hands down the best drink I have ever created. No joke. It is sweet, bright, herbacious and packs a punch. It's got a great flavor profile that allows just enough of the bourbon come through, but it's not an overwhelmingly 'stong' bourbon taste. I can't stop making it.
The Black Rose.name: The Black Rose
The Black Rose.recipeInstructions: Muddle berries in a shaker. . Pour in juice from one lemon, alcohol and simple syrup. . Shake with ice. . Strain (if desired, for berry seeds), and pour into glass with ice. . Garnish with rosemary sprig and serve.

The Brave Bull.description: A take on a classic Kahlua cocktail, this includes a combination of Kahlua and tequila, garnished with a lime and sugar-spice rim for a fiery kick.
The Brave Bull.name: The Brave Bull
The Brave Bull.recipeInstructions: Use a lime wedge to lightly wet the rim of a rocks glass. Dip the rim into the sugar-spice mix and rotate slowly to coat entire rim. Fill glass with ice cubes. Add the Kahlua and tequila

The Cascade Crush.description: Not a drink to end the day, but one to complement it.
The Cascade Crush.name: The Cascade Crush
The Cascade Crush.recipeInstructions:
Fill
tumbler with crushed ice. Pour
in Cascade Blonde whiskey and lemonade. Garnish
with an orange wedge

The Cherry on Top.description: This is a Mind Eraser with a cherry on top! I put my own twist on it by garnishing the cocktail with a few moonshine cherries. Not only do I love the color the cherries add to the drink, but they remind me of summers going to farmers markets with my mom!
The Cherry on Top.name: The Cherry on Top
The Cherry on Top.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add Kahlua and Absolut Vodka to glass. Once settled, carefully layer the club soda on top until glass is full. Place three moonshine cherries on a swizzle stick and drop into glass

The Churchill Martini.description: A quirky and complicated man, Winston Churchill was known for his love of libations. When asked how he would like his gin martini prepared he replied “I would like to observe the vermouth from across the room while I drink my martini." Served chilled and neat, this drink contains nothing more than gin and ice in close proximity to a bottle of vermouth. Wacky and unique just like it's name sake.
recipeIngredient:
2.5 ounces Plymouth Gin
1 scoop of ice
1 cocktail olive to garnish
The Churchill Martini.name: The Churchill Martini
The Churchill Martini.recipeInstructions: Add gin to a mixing glass full of ice and stir to combine.. While stirring glance occasionally at a bottle of vermouth from across the room.. Pour into a chilled glass.. Garnish with a single cocktail olive.

The Dirt-y Martini.description: We've pulled inspiration right from our own garden to put a fresh twist on the classic Dirty Martini. When picking your pickles, think outside of the box. Go for hearty produce with unique flavors like the natural sweetness found in beets or the peppery snap of radish. Swapping out the olive brine for tangy homemade pickle juice brings a complex and earthy flavor to this simple cocktail.
recipeIngredient:
2.5 oz Vodka
.5 oz Dry Vermouth
.5 oz Homemade Pickle Brine
The Dirt-y Martini.name: The Dirt-y Martini
The Dirt-y Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass full of ice. Stir with a bar spoon to chill. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with homemade pickles and serve

The Elderflower Aperol Spritz.description: Sweet, fruity, and floral, Elderflower liqueur is an ideal compliment to the bittersweet citrus and herb flavor of Aperol, and when the two are mixed together with crisp and bubbly Prosecco the result is dangerously refreshing! Bright, light, summery, and super simple to make, the Elderflower Aperol Spritz is sure to be your new go-to cocktail for brunch with friends.
The Elderflower Aperol Spritz.name: The Elderflower Aperol Spritz
The Elderflower Aperol Spritz.recipeInstructions: Fill a large wine glass or rocks glass with ice. . Pour all ingredients over ice and stir. . Garnish with an orange wheel or wedge if desired.

The Fire Starter.name: The Fire Starter
The Fire Starter.recipeInstructions: Pour into a chilled shot glass

The Ford's Gin Bee's Knees.description:
The Bee's Knees is a Prohibition era cocktail whose namesake was a popular phrase meaning "the best". Essentially it is a gin sour with honey but, because of the exchange of flavors between the ingredients it becomes much more than its components. The 
combination of jasmine and honey is as old as the hills and the jasmine flower botanicals used in Fords Gin ensure this cocktail sings.
The Ford's Gin Bee's Knees.name: The Ford's Gin Bee's Knees
The Ford's Gin Bee's Knees.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. . Add ice and shake vigorously.. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.. Garnish with a lemon twist.

The Ford's Gin Bramble.description: Legendary London bartender Dick Bradsell created the Bramble in 1984 whilst working at Fred's Bar in London's lively Soho neighborhood. It was intended to be a quintessentially British cocktail inspired by British flavors. The Bramble rapidly became the go-to gin drink in many bartenders' repertoire and arguably propelled gin cocktails back into the limelight. Perhaps the only true "modern classic" cocktail.
The Ford's Gin Bramble.name: The Ford's Gin Bramble
The Ford's Gin Bramble.recipeInstructions: Add gin, lemon juice and simple syrup to a cocktail shaker. . Add ice and shake until chilled.. Strain over crushed ice into a rocks glass. . Drizzle blackberry liqueur over top. . Finally, garnish with blackberry and lemon wedge.

The Ford's Negroni.description: The ultimate aperitivo, the Negroni was reportedly created in 1919 by a bartender at Caffe Casoni in Florence, Italy for Count Camillo Negroni when he requested his regular drink, the Americano, be strengthened by replacing the soda water with gin. The combination of gin, sweet vermouth and Campari can be a challenge to the uninitiated but once converted few ever turn away from this most assured blend of flavors.
The Ford's Negroni.name: The Ford's Negroni
The Ford's Negroni.recipeInstructions: Measure ingredients into a mixing glass.. Fill with ice and stir using barspoon until well chilled.. Strain over fresh ice into rocks glass.. Garnish with an orange slice.

The Franklin.description: Ready for a refresh? Then try the Franklin: created with fresh green juice, blood oranges, red pears and Art in the Age's Rhubarb Tea it will have you transported to it's namesake in the heart of Los Angeles, Franklin Village. Where green juice is king but so is their love of crafted spirits!
recipeIngredient: 1.5 oz Art in the Age's Spirit: Rhubarb Tea
The Franklin.name: The Franklin
The Franklin.recipeInstructions: Juice your choice of veggies and fruit. Pour 1 shot of Art in the Age into your glass . Mix in about 1/2 cup of juiced veggies & fruit (if you prefer it greener, add more) . Fill the rest of the glass with Perrier. Add a slice of pear for garnish

The Grey Goose Martini.description: The perfect, elegant cocktail to enjoy with friends and family at a distinguished holiday party. The martini is perhaps the world's most iconic cocktail. Our version is stirred, never shaken. Stirring avoids over-dilution of the martini cocktail, establishes a perfectly clear liquid without air bubbles, and ensures a smoother mouth feel. Served dry, but not too dry, with 5 parts vodka to 1 part vermouth, a dash of orange bitters, and then garnished with a twist of lemon. Grey Goose has more taste than other vodkas because it's built from the ground up to express the nature of its ingredients, not to remove them. This means it will stand up perfectly to the vermouth.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 part Noilly Prat Original French Dry Vermouth
The Grey Goose Martini.name: The Grey Goose Martini
The Grey Goose Martini.recipeInstructions: Build ingredients in a mixing glass. Top with cubed ice and stir. Fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon peel

The Grigio Gorl.description: Introducing The Grigio Gorl, a sinuous blend of Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, tequila, grapefruit, simple syrup, club soda, and lime that will leave you wondering...who is she?
recipeIngredient: 2 ounces Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano
The Grigio Gorl.name: The Grigio Gorl
The Grigio Gorl.recipeInstructions: Place grapefruit wheel on side of rocks glass and hold in place with ice. In a cocktail shaker combine Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, grapefruit juice, simple syrup, tequila, and lime. Shake well. Strain into prepared glass. Adjust to taste. Top with club soda

The Last Word.description: First created in the Prohibition era, the Last Word's simple recipe of equal parts Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, Green Chartreuse, Junipero Gin and fresh lime juice belies the subtlety of this sweet-tart-herbal creation. Two men are credited with this cocktail's fame - its creator, vaudevillian Fred Fogarty, who allegedly first combined the four ingredients at the Detroit Athletic Club in 1921, and Seattle bartender Murray Stetson, who revived the Last Word at the Zig Zag Café in the early 2000s.
The Last Word.name: The Last Word
The Last Word.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry

The New Irish Breakfast.description: With flavors reminiscent of fresh baked banana bread, this Jameson infusion is great on the rocks, or as an unexpected addition to any classic whiskey cocktail. For this recipe we've decided to keep it simple, adding just a few ounces of fresh squeezed orange juice really kicks it up a notch.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz banana-infused Jameson Irish Whiskey

1- 2 oz fresh squeezed orange juice
The New Irish Breakfast.name: The New Irish Breakfast
The New Irish Breakfast.recipeInstructions: In a shaker combine banana-infused whiskey and orange juice, shake until cold.. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over a large icecube. . Garnish with a pinch of black sugar sprinkles.

The North Fork Iced Tea.description: This version of the Long Island Iced Tea is warmed up with a fall-flavored theme. Subbing barrel-aged gin, honey-infused vodka, and aged rum makes for a richer flavor profile. All of these flavors marry perfectly with sparkling cider. The result is a crisp, bright, cozy cocktail that is still deceptively on the strong side.
recipeIngredient: 1 apple, sliced roughly into eighths or large chunks
1 to 1 1/2 ounces cinnamon-honey syrup (see recipe notes)
Fresh apple slices and cinnamon sticks, for garnish
The North Fork Iced Tea.name: The North Fork Iced Tea
The North Fork Iced Tea.recipeInstructions: In a mixing tin, muddle the apple chunks, expressing as much juice as possible.. Add the Old Tom gin, tequila, vodka, rum, dry curaçao, lemon juice, cinnamon-honey syrup, and a couple dashes of bitters.. Fill the tin with ice and shake well. Taste for balance and adjust accordingly, adding a little more lemon juice or simple syrup if necessary.. Carefully double-strain and divide the mixture into two collins glasses filled with fresh ice.. Finish each cocktail with sparkling cider.. Garnish with an apple slice and a cinnamon stick.

The Old Pal.description: This cocktail is a cousin of the Negroni. The rye gives this drink some sweetness paired with the complex flavors of Campari and smoothed out with dry vermouth. If you like Boulevardiers and Negronis give this a try.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Rye Whiskey
3/4 oz Dry Vermouth
3/4 oz Campari
Lemon
The Old Pal.name: The Old Pal
The Old Pal.recipeInstructions: In a mixing glass, combine rye, vermouth and Campari. Stir with a bar spoon, then strain into an empty cocktail glass. Garnish with a fresh-cut lemon wheel or twist of lemon peel

The Pace Chaser.description: Bananas are a post-gym favorite, so why not sweeten the deal with a little whiskey shooter? The quirky combo of chocolate protein powder, almond butter, and home-infused whiskey will set the pace for a great night.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Banana Infused Irish Whiskey (We chose Jameson Irish Whiskey)
The Pace Chaser.name: The Pace Chaser
The Pace Chaser.recipeInstructions: Slice a fresh banana into 2-3 pieces making sure that they can stand straight when placed on a flat surface (you don't want your whiskey spilling out). . Using a melon baller gently carve out the interior of the banana leaving the entire peel and about ¼" of banana at the bottom to retain the liquid. . Before you fill, swipe one side of the banana with almond butter and roll in chocolate protein powder. . Fill banana shooter with whiskey and serve.

The Real Housewife.description: Oops, did I do that? Introducing the Raspberry Lemon Drop aka “The Real Housewife," a campy concoction of Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, lemon juice, and raspberry that's just begging to be sipped, sloshed, and ultimately slung in a rival's face. While we don't actually suggest tossing such an exquisite drink in anyone's face, it's fun to turn up the drama every once in a while.
recipeIngredient:
4 ounces Electric Sky
Pinot Grigio Italiano
Lemon Slices for even more drama
The Real Housewife.name: The Real Housewife
The Real Housewife.recipeInstructions: Prepare cocktail glass with raspberry sugar rim. In a cocktail shaker with ice, add Electric Sky Pinot Grigio Italiano, lemon, simple syrup, and raspberries. Shake vigorously (also relieves stress). Strain and pour into prepared glass. Garnish with lemon and raspberries, if you're feeling dramatique

The Rebel.description: The Ritas love rebels - they're known to spice things up. Add some heat to your Lime-A-Rita with jalapeno-infused tequila and rebel a little. #HAVEARITA
The Rebel.name: The Rebel
The Rebel.recipeInstructions: Run a lime wedge around the rim of a highball glass. Rim the edge with chill salt. Fill glass with ice and add Lime-A-Rita and tequila. Garnish with 2 slices of jalapeno and a lime wedge. Enjoy!

The Royal Sunburn.description: This cocktail incorporates both some light and fresh spirits with some more heavy flavors. The dark rum and absinthe give depth, while the aperol and lemon liquor add a lovely sweetness. When blended together, they combine perfectly to create an interesting, fruity, full-bodied, boozy summer cocktail - sure to help beat the heat!
recipeIngredient: .5 oz Lemon Liquor (I used Etrog, but a limoncello would also work)
4 Dashes Blueberry Cardamon Bitters (or any berry or fig bitters will work)
1.5 oz Green Juice (any fresh pressed green juice will work)
The Royal Sunburn.name: The Royal Sunburn
The Royal Sunburn.recipeInstructions: In a blender add ice, Rum, Aperol, Lemon Liquor, lime juice, green juice, simple syrup, bitters. Blend until combined and frothy. In a chilled rocks or collins glass, coat the inside of the glass with an absinthe rinse. Pour frozen cocktail into rocks glass after the absinthe rinse. Garnish with broubon or luxardo cherries and dried orange wheel. Add 2 more dashes of bitters on top

The Shackleton Highball.description: Add a citrus twist to make this a perfect scotch cocktail!
The Shackleton Highball.name: The Shackleton Highball
The Shackleton Highball.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with cubed ice. Stir with bar spoon for 10 seconds until glass starts to frost. Drain excess water and add Shackleton whisky. Stir for 10 seconds, adding ice as needed. Top with soda and softly stir for 5 seconds. Garnish with lemon oils by rubbing twist around the rim of the glass

The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.description: This classic and easy-to-make cocktail is elevated by the addition of St-Germain, making it an even more invigorating beverage.
The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.name: The St-Germain Gin & Tonic
The St-Germain Gin & Tonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in St-Germain, followed by the gin. Top off with tonic water. Garnish with lime wedges. Add fresh basil (optional)

The St-Germain Royal.description: Simple, classic and elegant. What is there not to love about a glass of champagne with a touch of French elderflower liqueur?
The St-Germain Royal.name: The St-Germain Royal
The St-Germain Royal.recipeInstructions: Pour St-Germain into a champagne flute. Top with Champagne. Garnish with a strawberry

The St-Germain Spritz.description: Light and refreshing, this elegant French spritz is a perfect low alcohol cocktail and can be enjoyed for any occasion, including brunch, aperitif, and dinner.
The St-Germain Spritz.name: The St-Germain Spritz
The St-Germain Spritz.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in St-Germain, followed by the sparkling wine, and finishing with the sparkling water. Stir gently. Garnish with a lemon twist

The Stroke of Midnight.description: A twist on the traditional champagne toast, the Stroke of Midnight is the perfect cocktail to celebrate the New Year.
The Stroke of Midnight.name: The Stroke of Midnight
The Stroke of Midnight.recipeInstructions: Pour Cointreau into a champagne glass. Add in champagne. Top with grenadine. Garnish with an orange twist

The Suburban.description: This complex cocktail dates back to the pre-prohibition era where it was first mixed at the original Waldorf Astoria Hotel. The unique mix of two spirits (Dark Rum and Rye Whiskey) along with Port Wine and a few kinds of bitters makes this deep, mysterious drink a real treat to enjoy.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 ounces rye whiskey 
1/2 ounce dark rum
1/2 ounce port
1 dash Orange bitters
1 dash Angostura bitters
The Suburban.name: The Suburban
The Suburban.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into an old-fashioned glass or cocktail glass . Serve with an orange peel

The Wrong Uber.description: Introducing “The Wrong Uber," an intoxicating mix of bourbon, lemon juice and a homemade cherry pinot noir syrup. After a few of these you'll hop into any black car...hopefully it's going somewhere fun! Your cocktail is arriving now...
The Wrong Uber.name: The Wrong Uber
The Wrong Uber.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker with ice combine bourbon, lemon juice, Cherry Pinot Noir Syrup, and simple syrup. Strain and pour into a glass filled with ice. Garnish with lemon rind and fresh cherries, if desired

Thomas Collins.description: Just like SKYY Vodka's origins, this is a fresh take on a classic that's sure to please a crowd. Intended to be batched for a group serving in a punch bowl, this recipe can also be enjoyed as an individual serving.
Thomas Collins.name: Thomas Collins
Thomas Collins.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients in a punch bowl and stir. Serve in rocks glasses with cubed ice and top each glass with tonic water. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Tipperary.description: The Green Chartreuse gives this cocktail a wonderful herby black licorice flavor that coats the palate and the sweet vermouth pulls in a matching warm sweetness. Depending on the kind of Irish Whiskey you use it'll either add more sweetness (blends) or an earthy aspect (single malts/pot still) that adds another dimension to the cocktail, giving it a bit more depth.
recipeIngredient:
1 oz Irish Whiskey
1 oz Green Chartreuse
1 oz Sweet Vermouth
Tipperary.name: Tipperary
Tipperary.recipeInstructions: Stir ingredients together with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass

Tito's All Time Favorite.description: An all time favorite for a reason, this classic combo is both simple and refreshing and good for any time!
Tito's All Time Favorite.name: Tito's All Time Favorite
Tito's All Time Favorite.recipeInstructions: Fill a glass with ice. Pour in Tito's Handmade Vodka. Fill the rest of the glass with sparkling water. Stir. Garnish with a lemon or a lime

Tito's Berry Infusion.description: This berry infusion from Tito's is a fun way to add a little sweetness to some of your favorite Tito's cocktails.
Tito's Berry Infusion.name: Tito's Berry Infusion
Tito's Berry Infusion.recipeInstructions: Put berries directly into a bottle of Tito's Handmade Vodka. Hint: you may have to drink a little to make room for the berries. Seal and place out of direct sunlight. Shake or stir every so often and test after 15-24 hours for desired flavor. When flavor is strong enough, strain and discard the fruit. Mix with lemonade, iced tea, or soda water

Tito's Classic Gimlet.description: A little tartness from the lime and sweetened with simple syrup, the Tito's gimlet is a balanced drink with a classic vibe. A true staple for any home bartender.
recipeIngredient: 1 oz Simple Syrup or 1 tsp Sugar
Tito's Classic Gimlet.name: Tito's Classic Gimlet
Tito's Classic Gimlet.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

Tito's Cucumber Infusion.description: For an easy infusion that is great for drinks like Tito's Gimlet or a Tito's and soda, just grab a bottle of the good stuff and a cucumber!
Tito's Cucumber Infusion.name: Tito's Cucumber Infusion
Tito's Cucumber Infusion.recipeInstructions: Slice cucumber and drop into a glass container. Fill with Tito's Handmade Vodka. Let sit for 1-2 days. Strain when the infusion has reached the desired flavor

Tito's Hair Of The Dog.description: Recovering from a fun night out? Try Tito's Hair of the Dog cocktail. All garnishes are optional, but why hold back?
recipeIngredient: 3-4 oz Bloody Mary Mix (your favorite or your own recipe!)
Tito's Hair Of The Dog.name: Tito's Hair Of The Dog
Tito's Hair Of The Dog.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, Bloody Mary mix, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a highball glass. Garnish with whatever you'd like! Go wild - try celery stalks, olives, dill pickles, pickled green beans, lemon, parsley, bacon, cheese cubes, boiled shrimp, etc.

Tito's Hot Chocolate.description: Adults love hot chocolate just as much as kids, and with this adults-only recipe, you'll wish it were winter all year round.
Tito's Hot Chocolate.name: Tito's Hot Chocolate
Tito's Hot Chocolate.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a large mug. Top with whipped cream

Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.description: Tito's jalapeno-infused vodka is a great way to add spice to any of your Tito's cocktails. Try some of Tito's other recipes, but with this infusion!
Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.name: Tito's Jalapeno Infusion
Tito's Jalapeno Infusion.recipeInstructions: Slice your peppers (removing some seeds) and put them into a bottle of Tito's Handmade Vodka. Hint: you may have to drink a little to make room for the peppers. Jalapenos can infuse quickly, so test the heat every 30 minutes. When it's hot enough for you, remove the pepper slices. Use this infusion in a TitoRita or Tito's American Mule, or mix it with lemonade

Tito's Madras.description: If you want to feel like you are on vacation, make yourself a Tito's Madras and grab your shades. It's gonna be sunny sippin' from here on out.
Tito's Madras.name: Tito's Madras
Tito's Madras.recipeInstructions: Pour Tito's Handmade Vodka and orange juice into a glass filled with ice. Stir. Top with cranberry juice

Tito's Martini.description: The martini seems simple, but everyone has their own way of making it. Shaken or stirred, the Tito's Martini is sure to please all aficionados.
Tito's Martini.name: Tito's Martini
Tito's Martini.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, dry vermouth, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake or stir. Strain into a chilled martini glass

Tito's Screwdriver.description: Tito's Screwdriver is like a glass of sunshine that is super easy to make. Great for brunch or porch sipping, this classic cocktail couldn't be simpler.
Tito's Screwdriver.name: Tito's Screwdriver
Tito's Screwdriver.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a rocks glass

Tito's Smash.description: A little sweetness with a touch of heat, the Tito's Smash is sure to spice up your evening.
Tito's Smash.name: Tito's Smash
Tito's Smash.recipeInstructions: Muddle all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Add ice. Shake well. Pour everything, including the ice, into a rocks glass

Tito's Sonic.description: Tonic and soda water come together to make a sonic. Add Tito's Handmade Vodka and you magically get Tito's Sonic. Simple and satisfying.
Tito's Sonic.name: Tito's Sonic
Tito's Sonic.recipeInstructions: Pour Tito's Handmade Vodka in a glass over ice. Top with tonic and soda water

Tito's Toast.description: A toast to Texas, this festive drink adds a little sparkle to your next cocktail party.
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Champagne or Sparkling White Wine
Tito's Toast.name: Tito's Toast
Tito's Toast.recipeInstructions: Combine Tito's Handmade Vodka, honey, and lemon juice in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a champagne flute. Top with champagne

TitoRita.description: Tito likes to do things his own way. This margarita replaces tequila with, you guessed it, Tito's Handmade Vodka.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Triple Sec or Orange Liqueur
TitoRita.name: TitoRita
TitoRita.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass or serve over ice. Garnish with a lime wedge or wheel. If you like it salty, rim your glass before mixing and pouring your drink

Toddy No. 1.description: Warm up on a cold night with the Toddy No. 1 from Old Forester.
recipeIngredient: 3/4oz Old Forester Perfect Old Fashioned Syrup
2 droppers Old Forester Smoked Cinnamon Bitters
Toddy No. 1.name: Toddy No. 1
Toddy No. 1.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a mug. Stir to combine. Serve warm. Garnish with a lemon wheel and cinnamon sticks

Tom Collingwood.description: Swap in Collingwood Canadian Whisky for the gin in a Tom Collins and you've got Tom Collingwood! He doesn't disappoint.
Tom Collingwood.name: Tom Collingwood
Tom Collingwood.recipeInstructions: Fill a collins glass with ice . Mix in Collingwood, simple syrup and lemon juice. Top with soda water. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Tom Collins.description: An old favorite (circa 1867), the Tom Collins was created by Jerry Thomas, the father of American Mixology. He's kind of a big deal. This lemonade and gin combination is an easy-drinking option for any occasion.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Gin
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
3/4 oz Simple Syrup
Club Soda
Lemon to garnish
Tom Collins.name: Tom Collins
Tom Collins.recipeInstructions: Mix the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup in a highball glass with ice. Fill glass with club soda, stir and enjoy

Tonic Trance.description: A bitter and somewhat herbaceous cocktail, we mixed this one up for Shark Week. While researching shark terminology we came across the phenomenon of tonic immobility. We won't bore you with the details, but we will share this great recipe.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Gin
3/4 oz St. Germain
1/2 oz Lemon Juice
1/4 oz Simple Syrup
1/2 oz Grapefruit Juice
1 dash Orange Bitters
1 oz Tonic Water
Tonic Trance.name: Tonic Trance
Tonic Trance.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients, except tonic, to shaker filled with ice. Shake, then strain into a cocktail glass. Top with tonic and garnish with a lemon or orange wedge

Touchdown Boilermaker.description: For a game-winning play, try a classic boilermaker: a shot of Crown Royal and a glass of your favorite beer. Touchdown!
Touchdown Boilermaker.name: Touchdown Boilermaker
Touchdown Boilermaker.recipeInstructions: Pour Crown Royal into a shot glass. Pour your favorite beer into a pint glass. Drink your shot, sip your beer!

Traditional Elderfashioned.description: A beautiful twist on this classic cocktail, St-Germain adds an extra layer to compliment the whisky notes while adding a little 'je ne sais quoi' to this old timer.
Traditional Elderfashioned.name: Traditional Elderfashioned
Traditional Elderfashioned.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add ingredients. Stir well. Garnish with an orange twist

Traditional Punch.description: Try this traditional drink from Old Forester.
Traditional Punch.name: Traditional Punch
Traditional Punch.recipeInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into double old fashioned glass with fresh ice. Garnish with a lemon peel and grated nutmeg

Trap Queen Smash.description: Hey, what's up? Hello...this is a drink fit for a queen. Blueberries, mint and the elderflower magic of St. Germain mix this into a majestic, purple, smash hit.
recipeIngredient:
2 oz Vodka
1/2 oz St. Germain
10 Fresh Blueberries
2 sprigs of Fresh Mint
1/2 oz Simple Syrup
Trap Queen Smash.name: Trap Queen Smash
Trap Queen Smash.recipeInstructions: Muddle 5 blueberries and 5 mint leaves with simple syrup to base of a shaker. Be sure to thoroughly muddle the mint to release its fragrance and oils. Fill shaker with ice, vodka and St. Germain, shake 5-10 seconds until cold. Strain into a glass with crushed ice

Tropical Coconut Margarita.description: This tropical coconut margarita is PERFECT for Cinco de Mayo. And it was so so easy to whip up! I love a good tropical margarita on any old day, but this one is especially perfect for my favorite “holiday” on May 5th.
Tropical Coconut Margarita.name: Tropical Coconut Margarita
Tropical Coconut Margarita.recipeInstructions: Muddle fresh mint in bottom of shaker with simple syrup, lime juice, Cointreau (or triple-sec).. Add tequila, coconut milk, and shake vigorously for 20 seconds.. Pour coconut shavings/shredded coconut on a plate.. Take a lime wedge and wet the rim of your glasses, then dip in coconut.. Fill glasses with ice and pour over shaken mixture.. Garnish with additional coconut shavings and edible flowers.

Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.description: A fun, nonalcoholic take on the popular brunch beverage, this mocktail is full of fresh, tropical flavor that will instantly remind you of summer. You can also easily make it boozy by subbing sparkling wine for the club soda!
Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.name: Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa
Tropical Pineapple Lime Faux-mosa.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients except the club soda (or sparkling wine) in a cocktail shaker filled ¾ of the way full with ice.. Shake vigorously for 10-20 seconds and strain into a champagne flute. . Top with club soda or sparkling wine. . Garnish with a fresh pineapple wedge and enjoy!

Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.description:
Turmeric Root, the peppery cousin to Ginger is known for its distinct golden orange color. Due in part to its many health benefits and unique flavor, the Turmeric Root is on the verge of having it's 'Moment' in American kitchens everywhere. We've combined fresh Turmeric root with tangy pineapple and tart lemon rind for an earthy, sweet infusion that pairs well with spicy ginger beer and squeeze of citrus.

Check out our Infusions 101 Page for even more home infusion flavor ideas!
recipeIngredient: Vodka of your choice (We used Tito's)
1 Tablespoon Fresh Grated Turmeric Root (or 1 Teaspoon Ground Turmeric)
Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.name: Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodka
Turmeric, Lemon & Pineapple Infused Vodk.recipeInstructions: Place grated turmeric root, lemon rind and pineapple into the bottom of a 1.5 Pint Mason Jar. . Fill the rest of the jar with a vodka of your choice (we used Tito's) and seal with lid. . Give the mixture a good shake to distribute ingredients, and let sit in a cool dark place for up to 3 days, shaking occasionally. . After 3 days, strain ingredients out through a fine mesh strainer, and place your infused vodka into a sealed jar. . Infusion will keep for several weeks refrigerated.

UV Blue Bombsicle.description: Literally of one the world's favorite cocktails. And it will quickly become one of yours, too. Promise.
UV Blue Bombsicle.name: UV Blue Bombsicle
UV Blue Bombsicle.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Blue Ginger.description: Don't let the “blue" in the name fool you. This delicious little cocktail will bring you anything but down. Simply pour, sip and smile.
UV Blue Ginger.name: UV Blue Ginger
UV Blue Ginger.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Bluedriver.description: Like a traditional screwdriver, but so. much. better. It will turn your frown upside down.
UV Bluedriver.name: UV Bluedriver
UV Bluedriver.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cake Float.description: If you're a kid at heart, this cocktail is made for you…you cute little 21 year-old, you.
UV Cake Float.name: UV Cake Float
UV Cake Float.recipeInstructions:
Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir
& enjoy!

UV Cake N\u2019 Cola.description:
This cocktail
combines two of the best “C" words: cake and cola. What more could you ask for?<!--EndFragment-->
UV Cake N\u2019 Cola.name: UV Cake N’ Cola
UV Cake N\u2019 Cola.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cherry Bomb.description: Two American classics come together for one hugely flavorful cocktail. Enjoy it pool side.
UV Cherry Bomb.name: UV Cherry Bomb
UV Cherry Bomb.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cherry Pride.description: Quick and cute as a cherry, this is a cocktail you'll be proud to serve anywhere, anytime.
UV Cherry Pride.name: UV Cherry Pride
UV Cherry Pride.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cherryade.description:
Sweet and refreshing,
this quick little cocktail is like a burst of sunshine on a cloudy day.<!--EndFragment-->
UV Cherryade.name: UV Cherryade
UV Cherryade.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cran Razzle.description: Razzle dazzle your taste buds with this super swift, nice and easy, incredibly tasty cocktail.
UV Cran Razzle.name: UV Cran Razzle
UV Cran Razzle.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Cran-Cherry.description:
Two fruits join
forces to create one amazing cocktail. Easy to mix and even easier to enjoy.<!--EndFragment-->
UV Cran-Cherry.name: UV Cran-Cherry
UV Cran-Cherry.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Ginger Cake.description: Ginger ale has many great qualities, one of which being the perfect companion for UV Cake.
UV Ginger Cake.name: UV Ginger Cake
UV Ginger Cake.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Silver Bloody Mary.description: This UV Silver soaked burst of tomato is the hair of the dog and then some. Mix it in minutes.
UV Silver Bloody Mary.name: UV Silver Bloody Mary
UV Silver Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions:
Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Garnish with fresh olives, celery, and anything
else your heart desires

UV Silver Greyhound.description: Bet you can mix this delicious little fruit refreshment faster than you can say “grapefruit."
UV Silver Greyhound.name: UV Silver Greyhound
UV Silver Greyhound.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Silver Sparkler.description: This easy-to-make cocktail is cool, crisp and 100% class in a lowball glass. What a party pleaser.
UV Silver Sparkler.name: UV Silver Sparkler
UV Silver Sparkler.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Spicy Margarita.description: This cocktail is perfect for the 5th of May and pretty much any other day. Bring this spice girl to the party and show your amigos how it's done.
UV Spicy Margarita.name: UV Spicy Margarita
UV Spicy Margarita.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Sriracha Bloody Mary.description: Why settle for routine? We guarantee you've never tasted a Bloody Mary quite like this before.
UV Sriracha Bloody Mary.name: UV Sriracha Bloody Mary
UV Sriracha Bloody Mary.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Garnish with fresh olives, celery and anything else your heart desires   . Stir and enjoy!

UV Upside Down Cake.description: Go on an exotic beach vacation without leaving the comfort of your patio…or couch. No judging.
UV Upside Down Cake.name: UV Upside Down Cake
UV Upside Down Cake.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Vodka Cran.description:
So simple, so delicious, it's so obvious why
this cocktail has stood the test of time. <!--EndFragment-->
UV Vodka Cran.name: UV Vodka Cran
UV Vodka Cran.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a lowball glass. Stir and enjoy!

UV Bonfire.description: Anything but ordinary, this hot little number is guaranteed to warm you up on a cold winter's day or night.
UV Bonfire.name: UV Bonfire
UV Bonfire.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a mug.  Stir, add whipped cream and enjoy!

UV Sriracha Fried Ice Cream.description: You don't need a spoon to dig into this delicious dessert-like decadence. Simply pour, sip & enjoy.
UV Sriracha Fried Ice Cream.name: UV Sriracha Fried Ice Cream
UV Sriracha Fried Ice Cream.recipeInstructions:
Add ingredients to shot glass over ice, or
straight up chilled. Enjoy!

UV Sriracha Screwdriver.description: This spicy twist on the classic screwdriver will keep you and your taste buds on your toes.
UV Sriracha Screwdriver.name: UV Sriracha Screwdriver
UV Sriracha Screwdriver.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass. Stir and enjoy!

Unusual Negroni.description: Herbal and slightly bitter, the Unusual Negroni is our unexpected take on the classic cocktail.
recipeIngredient:
1 part Bulldog London Dry Gin
1 part Sweet Vermouth
1/2 part Campari
1/2 part Aperol
Orange Segments and Zest
Unusual Negroni.name: Unusual Negroni
Unusual Negroni.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well and pour over ice into an old fashioned glass. Garnish with orange zest and an orange slice

Urban Jungle.description: Made with the first bottled bourbon, the Urban Jungle has a tropical twist.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Old Forester Perfect Old Fashioned Syrup
Urban Jungle.name: Urban Jungle
Urban Jungle.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in shakerwith ice. Shake vigorously. Strain into Collins glass with fresh ice . Garnish with a pineapple leaf, a lime wheel, and mint leaves

Vanilla Bean Mind Eraser.description: For the girls' night pregame? Kahlua, Absolut Vodka, Vanilla Bean Soda. As easy as 1, 2, 3, this new IT glam drink for girl's night can be made before your curling iron even has time to heat up!
recipeIngredient:
1 part Kahlua
1 part Vodka
1 part DRY Vanilla Bean Soda
Vanilla Bean Mind Eraser.name: Vanilla Bean Mind Eraser
Vanilla Bean Mind Eraser.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice to the brim. Add Kahlúa® and Absolut Vodka to the glass. Top with vanilla bean soda. Enjoy

Vanilla Lime Mule.description: This simple, seasonal mule cocktail recipe is perfect for any cold weekend.
Vanilla Lime Mule.name: Vanilla Lime Mule
Vanilla Lime Mule.recipeInstructions: Combine Crown Royal Vanilla and lime juice in a shaker with ice. Shake well and drain into a mule mug over fresh ice. Top with ginger beer and garnish with a lime wheel. Top with aromatic bitters

Vanilla Spiced Cocktail.description: The ingredients to a good night? Vanilla, spice, and a little bit of ice.
recipeIngredient:
1 1/2 oz Baileys Original Irish Cream
1/4 oz Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
1/4 oz Espresso
Vanilla Spiced Cocktail.name: Vanilla Spiced Cocktail
Vanilla Spiced Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a rocks glass

Vesper.description: What's cooler than a cocktail created by James Bond himself? (Answer: nothing.) Making its debut in Casino Royale, this drink melds a clean, refreshing taste with a subtle, sweet kick. A word to the wise, this is a large drink, so you may want to share this mission with a friend.
recipeIngredient:
3 oz Gin
1 oz Vodka
1/2 oz Lillet Blanc
Vesper.name: Vesper
Vesper.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in an ice filled glass and stir for 15-20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a lemon twist

Vodka Gimlet.description: The classic Gimlet is typically served with gin although more and more people are ordering a Vodka Gimlet as the flavor is a bit more smooth. If you're a fan of making vodka drinks like this at home we suggest storing your vodka in the freezer to keep it primed for mixing.
Vodka Gimlet.name: Vodka Gimlet
Vodka Gimlet.recipeInstructions: In a shaker filled with ice combine vodka, lime juice and simple syrup; shake until cold. Pour into a martini glass or rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a fresh wheel of lime

Vodka Soda.description: A classic, simple cocktail to please the masses!
Vodka Soda.name: Vodka Soda
Vodka Soda.recipeInstructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Mix in Ketel One Vodka and club soda. Garnish with a slice of lime

Vodka Soda Jello Shots.description: If a Vodka & Soda is your go-to drink, you have to give these a shot (see what we did there?). Using spiked seltzer in place of plain club soda kicks these up a few notches, and opens up tons of opportunity to play around with different flavor combinations. If you are making for a party we recommend mixing up a few different batches and dropping in a coordinating fruit piece to the top so your guests know what to expect! Some of our favorites are Lime Spiked Seltzer with Raspberry vodka, and Orange Spiked Seltzer with Orange flavored vodka. Happy mixing!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Flavored Vodka (We chose Smirnoff Raspberry)
Vodka Soda Jello Shots.name: Vodka Soda Jello Shots
Vodka Soda Jello Shots.recipeInstructions: Combine unflavored gelatin mix and granulated sugar in a bowl and pour in boiling water.. Stir together until gelatin & sugar granules are completely dissolved.. Pour in remaining ingredients and mix well until completely combined.. Line a rectangular glass pyrex dish with plastic wrap and pour in mixture to set.. About halfway through the setting process place fresh fruit pieces evenly throughout the dish, then return to the fridge to set the rest of the way. . When ready to serve, slice into squares around each of the fruit pieces.

Vodka Sonic.name: Vodka Sonic
Vodka Sonic.recipeInstructions: Fill a collins glass with ice. Add vodka. Add equal parts Schweppes Club Soda and Schweppes Tonic Water to top. Garnish with a lime wedge. Enjoy!

Washington Apple Shot.description: This crisp, clean shot tastes just like a granny smith apple. Enjoy the Washington Apple Shot as a shooter or make a double serving and drink over ice. It can pack a punch though so enjoy responsibly!
recipeIngredient:
1/2 oz Crown Royal
1/2 oz Sour Apple Schnapps
1/2 oz Cranberry Juice
Washington Apple Shot.name: Washington Apple Shot
Washington Apple Shot.recipeInstructions: In a shaker filled with ice combine ingredients and shake until cold. Strain into a shot glass and enjoy

Watermelon Basil Julep.description: A thirst-quenching, fruit forward cocktail you're bound to enjoy!
Watermelon Basil Julep.name: Watermelon Basil Julep
Watermelon Basil Julep.recipeInstructions:
Muddle mint and basil with watermelon cubes. Stir
in Maker’s Mark® Bourbon Whisky and lime juice. Pour
over crushed ice and sprinkle with sea salt

Watermelon Citrus Slush.description: A refreshing mix of watermelon and lemon, this vibrant slush is perfect for a hot summer day. Any gin will work, but Plymouth Gin, with its citrus undertones, is a perfect fit. This drink will separate as it sits, so enjoy immediately or have a spoon or straw handy for stirring.
Watermelon Citrus Slush.name: Watermelon Citrus Slush
Watermelon Citrus Slush.recipeInstructions: Fill Freeze watermelon cubes for at least 2 hours.  . Blend frozen watermelon with gin, limoncello, lemon juice and sugar.  . Divide between 2 glasses and garnish with mint sprigs.  . Enjoy immediately!

Watermelon Fizz Beach Bag.description:
Cool cucumber vodka and watermelon puree come together with spiked seltzer make a fizzy drink that definitely packs a punch.

Check out the rest of our 'Beach Bag' cocktails!
recipeIngredient: Watermelon Cubes & Cucumber Wheels For Garnish
Watermelon Fizz Beach Bag.name: Watermelon Fizz Beach Bag
Watermelon Fizz Beach Bag.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except seltzer into a small 8 oz zip-top plastic bag.. Shake gently to mix. . Lay flat in freezer for 6-8 hours until frozen. . When ready to serve gently crush bag contents until a slush.. Open bag and pour in the spiked seltzer. . Drop in watermelon and cucumber garnish and serve with a straw.

Watermelon Jello Shots.description: These jiggly summer shots are just as fun to look at as they are to eat. Watermelon jello shots can be made in a baking sheet or even inside of lime rinds to look like miniature watermelons. This recipe is easy to mix up with your favorite vodka or tequila, which make them the perfect crowd pleasing treat for your next party.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups of vodka or silver tequila
Watermelon Jello Shots.name: Watermelon Jello Shots
Watermelon Jello Shots.recipeInstructions: Combine all your gelatin in a large bowl and stir together. . Slowly mix in 2 cups of boiling water and stir until dissolved. . After all the powder mixture is dissolved pour in your liquor of choice while you continue to stir.. Use a ladle to evenly distribute mixture into hollowed out lime halves.. Carefully place into your fridge and allow to cool until they are set up (usually between 2-4 hours). Once set slice into wedges keeping the rind on and serve.. For shots containing vodka garnish with coarse sugar or sesame seeds. For tequila shots use coarse sea salt on top.

Watermelon Margs.description: Watermelon and lime come together for these crazy-easy-to-make margs. The Ritas love to come together for a good time. #HAVEARITA
Watermelon Margs.name: Watermelon Margs
Watermelon Margs.recipeInstructions: Mix ingredients in a margarita glass. Garnish with watermelon wedge. Enjoy!

Watermelon Smash.description: A fresh, delicious concoction that is best served in the sun!
Watermelon Smash.name: Watermelon Smash
Watermelon Smash.recipeInstructions: Add vodka, watermelon juice, lemon juice, simple syrup, and mint leaves into a pitcher. Add ice. Mix well. Pour into glasses and garnish

Whiskey Patch.description: One of my all-time favorite types of candy is Sour Patch Kids, so working them into a festive drink for Halloween was a no-brainer. Enjoy my take on a whiskey sour, with an added emphasis on the sour. Of course — First it’s sour, then it’s sweet!
recipeIngredient: 1 small bag of Sour Patch Kids
Whiskey Patch.name: Whiskey Patch
Whiskey Patch.recipeInstructions: Empty Sour Patch Kids from bag and rim tumbler with a lemon.. Dip tumbler in the sugar at the bottom of the Sour Patch Kids bag.. Fill tumbler with ice and set aside.. In a shaker, combine lemonade, whiskey and simple syrup.. Shake well.. Pour mixture into tumbler.. Add in splash of cherry juice.. Garnish with a cherry and speared Sour Patch Kids.. Enjoy!

Whiskey Sour.description: If you're looking for a classic, whiskey-based cocktail to wind down with at the end of a long day - the Whiskey Sour is the drink for you. This popular cocktail dates back to the late 1800's, and has seen many iterations over the years. Classic ingredients include bourbon or whiskey, sugar and lemon, with the option of adding a dash of egg white if you're feeling ambitious.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 ounces Whiskey (or Bourbon, Scotch, Canadian Whiskey, or Irish Whiskey)
Whiskey Sour.name: Whiskey Sour
Whiskey Sour.recipeInstructions: Combine the whiskey and sour mix in a large old-fashioned glass with ice.. Stir, garnish with cherry, and serve.

White Lady.description: While the White Lady's history can be disputed, it was favored with Cointreau by the likes of Laurel and Hardy at the Savoy Hotel in London in the 1930s. With today's regained popularity of gin, this cocktail is poised to reclaim its deserved place in the hall of classics.
White Lady.name: White Lady
White Lady.recipeInstructions:
Combine
  all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass. Shake and strain into a chilled
  cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist

White Lily.description: A floral cocktail combining the botanicals of gin and the sparkle of La Marca.
White Lily.name: White Lily
White Lily.recipeInstructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker except La Marca. Shake and strain into sparkling coupe while simultaneously pouring in the La Marca. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel

White Russian.description: Somewhere between a jacked up iced coffee, and a boozy dessert sits the White Russian. If you're a Big Lebowski fan, you know this as the "Dude's" favorite cocktail. Ever wondered what people are always buying that one bottle of Kahlua for? This is it. The rich sweet, coffee flavors of Kahlua are off set by vodka and cold milk, resulting in a decadent drink that is easy to sip anytime of day. Not a dairy fan? Swap in the whole milk for coconut milk for a nutty twist on this classic.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 oz Whole Milk or Heavy Cream
White Russian.name: White Russian
White Russian.recipeInstructions: In a rocks glass combine vodka and coffee liqueur over ice. Add milk or cream and stir. Optional Step 3. Put on your best plain white tee, and channel your inner 'Dude'.

White Russian on Spring Vacation.description: Since Darling be Daring is known for our Girl On-The-Go recipes and our viewers come to us for healthy twists on recipes, we've substituted the cream in the White Russian recipe to Coco Lopez Cream of Coconut and added bittermens Elemakule Tiki bitters for a fun, tropical twist!
recipeIngredient: 1 part Coco Lopez Cream of Coconut
1 tsp Sugar or Agave to sweeten
White Russian on Spring Vacation.name: White Russian on Spring Vacation
White Russian on Spring Vacation.recipeInstructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Pour in Absolut Vodka, followed by Kahlua. Add in optional sugar or agave, as well as Tiki Bitters. Stir to combine and top with Cream of Coconut

recipeIngredient: A bottle of chilled, Dry White Wine
A variety of Fresh Sliced Fruits, such as Peaches, Oranges, Blueberries
A few sprigs of Mint Leaves
White Sangria.name: White Sangria
White Sangria.recipeInstructions: Grab a pitcher and add your raspberries and mint to muddle at the bottom . Add 3-4 handfuls of ice . Add your slices of peaches, oranges, and blueberries . Pour 2 cups of apple juice into the fruit and ice . Pour the full bottle of wine into the pitcher . Top with 1-2 cans of 7UP to add a little sweetness and fizziness to your drink!

White Wine Spritzer.description: Spruce up your white wine spritzer with a punch of citrus with 7UP
White Wine Spritzer.name: White Wine Spritzer
White Wine Spritzer.recipeInstructions: In a wine glass over ice, combine the wine and Diet 7UP. Garnish with a lemon wedge

Wicked Ale.description: Try this beer cocktail that is both wicked good and wicked easy to make.
Wicked Ale.name: Wicked Ale
Wicked Ale.recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a pint glass and gently stir to combine. Garnish with lemon wedge

Wild Turkey Manhattan.description: This consummate classic cocktail gets its particularly bold bite from Wild Turkey Rye. We like it served in a proper coupe glass with a Maraschino cherry tossed in for good measure.
Wild Turkey Manhattan.name: Wild Turkey Manhattan
Wild Turkey Manhattan.recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into coupe glass. Garnish with a cherry

Winking Witches Brew.description: This quick and easy recipe is perfect for a Halloween get together with friends!  We added a Twizzlers garnish around the edge and a Twizzlers straw to give it a fun Halloween look that goes perfectly with the spooky purple color. Enjoy!
Winking Witches Brew.name: Winking Witches Brew
Winking Witches Brew.recipeInstructions: In a saucepan, combine 12 oz. of fresh or frozen blueberries with 1/2 cup water. . Heat until boiling and then let simmer for 10 minutes. . Once fully cooked through, mash blackberries and strain so only the juice remains. . In tumblers, mix together 6 oz of blackberry juice, 1 oz. simple syrup and 2 oz. of Titos vodka and stir with a swizzle stick. . Top with ice and garnish with a cut Twizzlers for a candy swizzle stick.

Winter Citrus Swizzle.description: We love this low-cal drink for more than just the refreshing flavor. If you use a grapefruit vodka with color the ombre effect in the drink between the pink vodka and sparkling water is drink perfection.
Winter Citrus Swizzle.name: Winter Citrus Swizzle
Winter Citrus Swizzle.recipeInstructions: In a collins glass with ice, pour vodka first then rosemary simply syrup and finally top with Perrier L'Orange sparkling water. Slide a tall sprig of rosemary down the side of the glass. Stir gently with rosemary before enjoying

Winter Fruit Sangria.description: A wintery take on a summertime favorite. This sangria combines typical winter citrus fruit into a deliciously-drinkable cocktail.
recipeIngredient: 2 bottles of Chilled Yellow Tail Cabernet Sauvignon
Winter Fruit Sangria.name: Winter Fruit Sangria
Winter Fruit Sangria.recipeInstructions: In a large pitcher combine sugar, brandy, and cut fruit. Stir well and refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Add wine and stir. Add club soda immediately before serving. Serve over ice

Woodford Reserve Neat.description: Sometimes the best "cocktail" is poured straight from the bottle.
Woodford Reserve Neat.name: Woodford Reserve Neat
Woodford Reserve Neat.recipeInstructions: Pour Woodford Reserve into a cocktail glass. Enjoy!

Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned.description: A classic American cocktail with a great history.
Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned.name: Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned
Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned.recipeInstructions: Add ingredients to the mixing glass. Add ice and stir for 30-40 seconds. Strain into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lightly expressed orange peel

1-2 Punch.description: Detox. Retox. Repeat. This green power juice goes rogue with the help from a little rum. The addition of fresh ginger root gives this healthy-ish take on a Rum Punch an extra kick.
1-2 Punch.name: 1-2 Punch
1-2 Punch.recipeInstructions: In a cocktail shaker or protein shaker combine green juice, light rum and ice. . Shake vigorously for 10-15 seconds. . Pour entire contents into a glass. . Garnish with fresh pineapple and other citrus of your choosing.

1920 Highball.description: Enjoy a blast from the past with this 1920 Highball from Old Forester.
1920 Highball.name: 1920 Highball
1920 Highball.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in highball glass. Add ice. Stir to combine. Garnish with lemon twist

19\u00b0 North.description: Sriracha meets Herradura Reposado in a complex and fiery drink.
19\u00b0 North.name: 19° North
19\u00b0 North.recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake hard so that some of the ice melts. Strain over fresh ice into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge

7UP Orange Spice Punch.description: This isn't your grandmother's sherbet punch. It's a fresh take on a seasonal favorite with tangy fruit juice, smooth sherbet, bright bubbles, and just the right amount of holiday spice. Whether you serve it in a retro crystal bowl or a sleek new one, it's a fun and festive centerpiece on any table or buffet.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Canadian Whiskey (or whiskey of your choice)
Slices of Lemon, Lime, and Orange
7UP Orange Spice Punch.name: 7UP Orange Spice Punch
7UP Orange Spice Punch.recipeInstructions: Add everything except for sherbet into a one-gallon punch bowl. Float scoops of sherbet on top. Let sherbet soften in the punch for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with lemon, lime and orange slices, cinnamon sticks, and a touch of pumpkin spice

7UP Pom Spritzer.description: Mix up the typical spritzer with a fresh taste of citrus
7UP Pom Spritzer.name: 7UP Pom Spritzer
7UP Pom Spritzer.recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and stir. Garnish with a lemon or lime, fresh mint, and pomegranate seeds. Best served in a highball glass

7UP Side Down Cocktail.description: Start with sprinkles. Add cake-flavored vodka, pineapple juice, and 7UP, and you've got a party in a glass.
7UP Side Down Cocktail.name: 7UP Side Down Cocktail
7UP Side Down Cocktail.recipeInstructions: Build first three ingredients in a rocks glass over ice and fill to the top with 7UP®. Garnish with sprinkles, a cherry, and an orange twist

7UP Winter Mint Punch.description: A perfect festive punch that is sure to be a crowd pleaser with a lemon-lime twist
7UP Winter Mint Punch.name: 7UP Winter Mint Punch
7UP Winter Mint Punch.recipeInstructions: Add everything except for sherbet into a one-gallon punch bowl. Float scoops of sherbet on top. Let sherbet soften in the punch for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with mint leaves and slices of lemon and lime

7UP Pineapple Rum Float.description: A float is always a great idea. But turning it into an adult beverage is even better. This cocktail would be great for summer pool parties and other celebrations.
7UP Pineapple Rum Float.name: 7UP Pineapple Rum Float
7UP Pineapple Rum Float.recipeInstructions: Add spiced rum, 7Up and pineapple juice to a glass. Stir well. Add 1-2 scoops of pineapple sherbet. Enjoy!
